record.title: [Lectures on surgery].
record.note: Binder's title; though lettered Volume 1, 1829, contents are complete.

The manuscript, written in ink on paper and bound in cloth with quarter leather, is not in Brodie's hand and does not correspond with his printed "Lectures" [1846 or 1852] or with his "Works" [1865]. It was purchased by Yale Med from Walford catalog 41 in April, 1962.
Watermarked 1828.
The lectures (39 in number, with Introduction and Index) were delivered to students in London during 1829. They concern surgery and kindred subject matter.

record.title: Surgery and diary / Sewall Brown's.
record.note: Cover title.

Manuscript, written in brown ink on paper, was sent by Richard Wheatland to John Fulton in February, 1933. Dr. Fulton later donated it to the Yale Medical Historical Library. Entries include medical and accounting data.

record.title: Phrenological character of Mr. Chas. C. McLauthlin : given at Fowlers and Wells' phrenological cabinet / by D. P. Butler.
record.note: Signed: D. P. Butler, Professor of Phrenology, and dated March 7th, 1853.
Manuscript, written in ink on paper, includes original printed phrenology wrappers.
In folder: 31 cm.

record.title: Partielle Differentialgleichungen; Anwendungen der Abel'schen Functionen; Infinitesimalgeometrie; Bestimmte Integration / [vorgetragen von Prof. Christoffel], 1885-1886.
record.note: Lecture notes taken by Lehmann during four mathematics classes taught by Professor Christoffel at Strassburg during the 1885-1886 school session.

record.title: Recherches sur les premières modifications de la matière organique, et sur la formation des cellules / par M. Coste.
record.note: Each of the two sections preceded by a 2 leaf note: 21 cm.
In folder: 36 cm.

record.title: [Notes on some medical lectures / delivered by Dr. Astley Cooper (and others)].
record.note: Manuscripts, written in ink on paper and bound in full leather, purchased by Yale Med from Myers & Co. (London, England) on 4 May 1951. The three volumes are lettered on spine: lectures II-IV.
Pages are hand numbered, and each volume includes an index (two parts are in the last volume).

record.title: Report of the Committee concerning the Hemlock Gum agreeable to the following vote of the Strafford District of the New Hampshire Medical Society : read before the Stafford District of the New Hampshire Medical Society, Feb'y.11, 1818.
record.note: Caption title.
Report, written Jan. 10, 1818 in ink on paper, acquired by Dr. Cushing in 1935; source not specified.

record.title: Casebook / [signed] Virgil M. Dow.
record.note: Text written in ink on paper: final 52 pages are back to front; Dr. Dow originally donated book to the New Haven Hospital Library; it came to Yale Med in January, 1949.
Flyleaf dated Dec.19, 1817.

record.title: Robert Duer's receipt book, 10th of July, 1812 : book 10.
record.note: Likely Duer's pharmacy/materia medica class notes, as he graduated from the University of Pennsylvania in 1814.
Manuscript, written in brown ink on paper, was purchased by Yale Med in May, 1950 from Whitlock (book seller of New Haven, Conn.). Title from material written inside front cover.
Inside front cover: "Robert Duer's Book the 10th of July 1812" ; inside back cover: "Robert Duer's book 1813."

record.title: Daybook.
record.note: Manuscript, written in black ink on lined paper, was purchased by Yale Med from Everett Hale Whitlock in November, 1943.
Binder's title.

record.title: Notes on trip abroad : August 23 to October 15, 1879.
record.note: Manuscript, written in black ink on lined paper, was purchased by Yale Med from Whitlock (New Haven, Conn. book dealer) on 31 August 1943.
On cover: Edward S. Dwight, M.D. of New Haven, Conn. U.S.A.

record.title: Notes on the quizzes in medicine of Dr. J. E. Winters : October 1, 1879 to March 15, 1880.
record.note: Manuscript, written in pencil into two un-lined notebooks, was transferred to Yale Medical from Yale University Library in January, 1953. An acid free envelope with Volume 2 includes material on the opium registration law of 1915.

record.title: Analysis of, and notes on Darwin's Origin of Species, Ed.VI, 1876, and extract from Darwin's provisional theory of pangenesis.
record.note: Manuscript, written in black ink on light blue paper and bound in quarter leather, was purchased by Dr. Harvey Cushing from Raphael King Ltd rare books London in September, 1938 and later donated to Yale Medical Historical Library.

record.title: Gustavus Eliot scrap book :, 1875 December 29 - 1887 February 24.

Dealer unable to identify the author; but his extensive descriptive commentary is pasted onto inside of back cover of volume one.
Manuscript of a Russian or Czech surgeon on various subjects, with some entries dated from 1833 to 1842.

record.title: Physiology : lectures on the physical conditions of the tissues of the human body as applied to the explanation of vital phenomena : delivered at the College of France, 1834 / by F. Magendie, Professor of Physiology and Medicine, 1834.

record.title: [Medical recipes], 1834-1879.
record.note: Manuscript, written in brown ink into a book bound in quarter leather, was purchased by Yale Med from Walford [British book dealer] in October, 1962. Most entries are dated, and there are seven small annotated inserts between various pages of the booklet.

record.title: Receipes for takeing of cemicals, 1850.
record.note: Caption title.
Page 3 has small label pasted on, reading: "Salts of gold, Meade Brothers, Importers, No. 233 Broadway, N.Y." The brothers established that location in 1850, hence the dating of the document.
Recipes for mixing chemicals.
The name D. F. [or G.?] Kellogs, Utica, New York, is inscribed within.
Manuscript, written in ink on first five pages of a 32 page booklet (remainder is blank), includes bookplate of Yale University Library dated 1942.

record.title: Correspondence to Major Philip Cardew / from William Thomson Kelvin, Glasgow, 1889-1903.

record.title: Note-book of experiments and observations on anatomy and physiology / George Gulliver, January 1839.
record.note: Manuscript notebook bound in quarter leather, written in black ink on unlined paper, kept by Gulliver over a period of years, the last one seeming to be 1874; titled from author's inscription inside front cover.
Some pages are blank, some have extra leaves inserted; there is an index on the final page.
Inserted are several letters addressed to the author from John Davy and one from Thomas Hodgkin; also an "Obituary notice" of Gulliver written in his own hand.
Includes much of his original research on the blood.

record.title: Book of accounts, 1793-1803.

record.title: Excelsior diary : Columbian edition, 1893 / [signed in ink on title page: Geo. W. Vansint].
record.note: Diary includes a blank page for each date, printed almanac and calendar, and pages for accounts.
Although this is obviously a physician's book, detailing his practice in New York City, I can find no listing of Vansint in Polk's, AMA, NUC, New York Acad., or Worldcat directories.
Manuscript, written in ink on lined paper, is notebook, diary, and account book; it was donated to Yale Med by Charles Anchie in November, 1966.

record.title: Account book, 1862-1870.

record.title: Theorie der Determinanten der algebraischen Gleichungen; Theorie der gewönliche Differentialgleichungen; Kugelfunctionen; [vorgetragen von Prof. Schering]; Neuere Methoden der analytischen Geometrie; Analytische Mathematik; [von] Prof. Reye; Electrodynamik [von] Prof. Cohen; Experimental-Chemie, [von] Prof. Fittig, 1885-1886.

record.title: Memoria medica : a medical common place book, with an alphabetical index of the most common terms occurring in practice [followed by Dr. Hubbard's manuscript notes dated 1832-1833].

record.title: Prescription book.
record.note: This small leather-bound notebook, written in brown ink, then pencil, on lined paper, was purchased by Yale Med from Whitlock Books (New Haven, Conn.) in May, 1959. Dr. Hungerford graduated from Yale Medical School in 1839 and practiced in his home town of Watertown, Conn. from 1844 until 1883.
Pages 1-30, numbered, contain prescriptions for common illnesses.
Pages 31-[72] are dated 1842-1845 and contain household and patient accounts.

record.title: Account book.

Entries are dated 1839-1850; five checks, with heading "Treasurer of First Ecclesiastical Society of Watertown" and dated 1874 and 1875, are inserted into notebook.

record.title: Prescription book.
record.note: Cover signed: A. M. Hungerford. Dated from entry within text.

record.title: Recipe book, 1836.
record.note: Signed on first leaf: Allyn M. Hungerford. Sept. 15, 1836.

Dr. Hungerford graduated from Yale Medical School in 1839 and practiced in his home town of Watertown, Conn. from 1844 until 1883.

record.title: Stereoscopic Roentgen pictures / by Elihu Thomson, 1896.

record.title: Mechanische Wärmetheorie [et al.] (Prof. Sohnke) [et al], 1883-1884.

record.title: On fevers - by Jos. M. Smith, M.D. [ / lecture notes taken by Jared Linsly].

record.title: Diary, 1887.
record.note: Please note: Doctor Joseph Edward Lumbard (1865-1942) is the Father of the judge Joseph Edward Lumbard, Jr. (1901-1999) - cf. JAMA Volume 120, 1942.
Notebook, diary, and account book of a male nurse; Dr. Lumbard then earned his M.D. in 1889.

record.title: The religious experience of Mr. Benjamin Lyon of Woodstock who died in August 1768 in the 38th year of his age / transcribed from his own hand by William H. Manning, 1815 April.

record.title: Vorlesungen über Pathologie / Dr. Hessert's.

Inscription on last leaf reads: "Fini le 16 Decembre 1813."
Yale Med volume purchased from Thiébaud (Paris) catalog 85 in 1963.
Last [58] p. contain prescriptions dated 1813, some pages are blank.

record.title: One hundred new fables : embellished with designs to each fable / by James Northcote, R.A.
record.note: Manuscript. Consists of hand-written text as well as illustrations for Northcote's first series of fables, published in 1828 as: One hundred fables, original and selected.

Text is embellished with 175 illustrations prepared by Northcote in collage form; each composed of portions of various 18th-century engravings, many with additions in pen and ink and wash (see Muir, DNB and the preface to the 1838 edition of the fables for an account of this). According to the 4 p. index at end, there are about 175 fables, of which only 100 were eventually published. Some bear the pencilled word "omit."
The artist William Harvey copied Northcote's designs from the ms. onto wood blocks, which were then given to the wood engravers to cut (notably John Jackson, responsible for about half the blocks).
In two boxes. Ms. is disbound and placed in box. Original red velvet-covered casing is stored in a separate box.

The manuscript is described at length in "The Fables Mauscripts and Collages," chapter 8 of: Ledbury, Mark. James Northcote, history painting, and the Fables. New Haven : Yale Center for British Art, 2014.

Pts. II and III, "Tractatus pathologiae" and "Institutionum medicarum...therapeutices," were published.
Manuscript, written in brown ink and bound in leather, was purchased by Yale from Nourry-Thiébaud catalog 80 in October, 1960.

record.title: La maladie angloise : ou, traité des indispositions nerveuses de toute espèce, comme les vapeurs ... : manuscript / par Monsr. Cheyne Docteur en médecine.
record.note: Full title page: La maladie angloise ou, traité des indispositions nerveuses de toute espèce, comme les vapeurs, l'abbatement, la langueur des esprits, les affections hysteriques, hypochondriaques / En trois parties: La premiere traite de la nature, et des causes des maladies nerveuses; la séconde, de leur cure; la troisiéme comprend différentes observations, qui illustrent et confirment la méthode curative. Avec le propre cas de l'auteur. Par Monsr. Cheyne Docteur en médecine, membre du college des medecins d'Edinbourg de la société Royale.

record.title: Anatomical and chirurgical lectures : read by Dr. William Hunter and Mr. William Cruikshank (on dissected bodies) : at their theatre in Windmill Street, Hay Market, London, taken in writing by William Tempest Mercer, a pupil attending the said lectures in 1775 and 1776.
record.note: The first section of the lectures deals with general subjects, the next chiefly with the arteries, and the latter portion with surgery and obstetrics.

record.title: A description of the human gravid uterus and its contents / by William Hunter ; purchased at the sale of Dr. Combe's books, April 1817.
record.note: On title page: "Identical account of the gravid uterus which, many years after the death of the author, was published by his nephew, Matthew Baillie M.D. ... this M.S. is precisely as it was left by Dr. Hunter ; whether the writing is his own or not I am uncertain": not signed, but dated 18 May 1817.

Note included with MS, signed by C.H. Brock, Glasgow University, July 1977: "This is not the original manuscript of William Hunter's A description of the Human Gravid Uterus and its contents published after Hunter's death by Matthew Baillie and it is not in William Hunter's handwriting. The original manuscript mainly in William Hunter's hand with additions in Matthew Baillie's hand is in...Glasgow University. This manuscript may have been transcribed by Charles Combe..."
Manuscript, written in black ink on paper and bound in full brown calf, given to Yale Med by Dr. Harvey Cushing.

record.title: Introduction a la connoissance des plantes.
record.note: Notes, including an index, taken by a student of his "Cours de botanique pour l'année 1762" at Jardin du Roi.
Manuscript, written in brown ink on paper and bound in contemporary cloth, was purchased by Yale Med from Chez Durtal, catalog XIX, in April 1937.

record.title: Geka kummo zui.
record.note: The famous work on surgery by Ambroise Pare was brought to Japan at an early date. This manuscript is about the section on wounds and was done about 1767. It was eventually printed in 1769. The illustrations follow closely those of the European editions of De chirurgie.
Manuscript, written in ink on paper and bound in two volumes with contemporary paper covers, was purchased by Yale Med from R.C. Rudolph (London book seller) in November, 1969.

record.title: Traité de Lauchamp chirurgien sur divers sujets de medecine et de chirurgie.
record.note: Manuscript, written in brown ink on paper and bound in contemporary leather, was purchased by Yale Med from Thiébaud (Paris book seller) on 11 July 1959.

record.title: A course of lectures of anatomy and the animal oeconomy / by B. Lawrence, M.D.
record.note: Includes letter to J. Fulton from rare book dealer Ifan Kyrle Fletcher of London dated 13 September 1940 which identifies the doctor as Thomas Lawrence, notwithstanding the "B. Lawrence" on the title page.
Manuscript written in black ink on paper, with several diagrams, and bound in full leather.

record.title: [Cours de pathologie et de chirurgie].
record.note: Manuscript, written in ink on paper and bound in three volumes with contemporary boards, is comprised of notes taken by Joseph Despine. Yale Med purchased work from Thiébaud (Paris) catalog 85 in 1963.

record.title: [Tefillah le-magefat ha-aba bu ot].
record.note: Order of prayers against an epidemic outbreak of a disease, and especially of smallpox.

"This prayer has its origin in the Bible. It consists mainly of Biblical passages, from Mishna and Talmud. Some mystical parts were composed by holy Rabbis of the Middle Ages. On fol.9b, the Tetragrammaton is drawn in very large letters indicating that the congregation should pronounce it in a loud voice."
"On fol.10a, a Psalm is written in the form of a Menorah of seven branches and a base; on top of each branch is written a word of mystic meaning in code form."
Written in fine Hebrew square characters by an Italian hand of the late 18th century, this manuscript was purchased by Yale Med from Henry Schuman (publisher and book seller) in February, 1955.

record.title: Muqaddimah fī uṣūl al-dīn. -- 1742.
record.note: Title taken from fly-leaf.
Also known as: al-Sanūsīyah; and ʻAqīdat ahl al-tawḥīd al-ṣughrá.

record.title: [Surgical cases].
record.note: Manuscript, written in brown ink on paper and bound in vellum, was the gift to Yale Med. of the author's great-grandson, Dr. Thomas Hubbard Russell, in June, 1941. Text dated 1768 on page 3, and September 30th, 1818 on final leaf. Dr. Thomas Hubbard received an honorary M.D. from Yale University in 1818.

Note on leaf following the first 36 pages states: "The foregoing observations are extracted from the manuscript of the late ingenious and justly celebrated Doct'r Albigence Waldo of Pomfret." It is dated June 17th, 1795.

record.title: Sharḥ Hidāyat al-ḥikmah. -- 1819?
record.note: Date barely legible.

record.title: [Ḥayāt] al-nafs fī ḥaḍrat al-quds. -- 1897.
record.note: Brockelmann gives title as: Ḥayāt al-nafs fī ḥadīth al-quds.

record.title: al-Īsāghūjī. -- 1831 or 2.

With: 1 other title.

record.title: [Sharḥ al-Īsāghūjī]. -- [ca. 1831 or 2].

With: 1 other title.

record.title: al-Maqāṣid al-ḥasanah fī al-aḥādīth al-mushtaharah [ʻalá al-alsinah]. -- 1620.
record.note: Title taken from fly-leaf.
Brockelmann gives title as: al-Maqāṣid al-ḥasanah fī kathīr min al-aḥādīth al-mashhūrah ʻalá al-alsinah.
Islamic binding, paper-covered, with flap.
Marginalia.
Preceded by 1 page of notes.

record.title: [Sharḥ Ṣaḥīḥ al-Bukhārī]. -- [ca. 1506].

record.note: Also known as: Sharḥ Risālat Qāsim ibn Quṭlūbughā.
Upside-down in Islamic binding, paper-covered, with flap.

record.note: Leaves 2-150 in a more recent hand.
Islamic binding, paper-covered, flap missing.
Marginalia.

record.title: [al-Taḥqīq]. -- [15--?].
record.note: Authorship uncertain.
Title may be: al-Daqāʾiq.
Unbound.
Marginalia.

record.title: Sharḥ Dīwān Imriʾ al-Qays. -- 1726 or 7.
record.note: Islamic binding, in red, with flap.

record.note: Islamic binding, paper-covered, with flap.
Followed by legal decisions in various hands.
Marginalia.

record.title: al-Jawharah al-nayyirah. -- 1554.
record.note: Leaf 3 recto illuminated.
Badly damaged Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.
Table of contents precedes text.
Marginalia.

record.title: Mashāriq al-anwār al-nabawīyah min ṣiḥāḥ al-akhbār al-Muṣṭafawīyah. -- 1396.
record.note: Preceded by table of contents and other notes.
Profuse marginalia.

record.title: al-Firqah al-nājiyah. -- 1673.
record.note: Islamic binding, in brown, flap missing.
With: 1 other title.

record.title: Arbaʻūn ḥadīthan. -- [ca. 1673].

Islamic binding, in brown, flap missing.
With: 1 other title.

record.title: [Ijāzah]. -- [17--].
record.note: Authorship uncertain.
With: 1 other title.

record.title: Kanz al-wuṣūl ilá maʻrifat al-uṣūl. -- [14--?].
record.note: Islamic binding, in purple with gilt decoration, with flap.
Considerable marginalia and interlinear notes in the beginning.

record.title: Kitāb ʻawārif al-maʻārif. -- [16--?].
record.note: Islamic binding, in turquoise, with flap.
Table of contents in various hands.

record.title: Maladies de la tête et de la poitrine.
record.note: Lecture notes taken by a student.
Manuscript, written in ink on paper and bound in contemporary vellum, was purchased by Yale Medical Library in 1963 from Thiébaud (Paris) catalog 85.

record.title: The art of healing : or, a new practice of physic.
record.note: "Preface to the fourth edition, Birmingham, Dec. 24th, 1776": pages 1-39, [1].
"Observations on the hooping cough, asthma, consumptions, by Thomas Hayes": p. [2], 82 at end, dated London, 1786.
Includes index and errata.

Manuscript, written in ink on paper and bound in full leather, an inscribed presentation copy from Dr. Alexander W. Rogers to Dr. Francis Harrison Todd in 1905; in turn Mrs. Francis H. Todd presented same to Yale University in May, 1951.

record.title: Traité de médecine pratique : ou méthode & moyens que je mets en usage pour le traitement des maladies énoncées à la table cy-après.
record.note: Manuscript, written in brown ink and bound into two volumes of contemporary full calf, was purchased by Yale Med from Thiebaud (Paris) catalog 82 in March, 1962.
"Advertissement" signed: David Ménard--Doct. med. Monsp.

record.title: Methode de traiter les morsures des animaux enragées et de la vipere : suivie d'un precis sur la pustule maligne, 1844.
record.note: Yale Med purchased item from Mathews catalog 151 in March, 1960; dealer's squib says it is an unsigned manuscript, prepared for publication. Text closely matches our copy of Methode ... by Joseph Enaux and François Chaussier, which was published by A. M. Defay at Dijon in 1785; so this manuscript is likely a copy written out in 1844.

record.title: Traite de chirurgie / [signed: Mignonneau chirurgien].
record.note: Signed at end (p. 276), and dated on table of contents leaf following.
Manuscript, written in black ink on paper and bound in contemporary full vellum, was purchased by Yale Med from Thiébaud (Paris) catalog 79 in 1959.

record.title: Narrativa di alcune delle malattie guarite coll' uso delle terme di Lucca : raccolte senz' ordine, ma con sincerità descritte.
record.note: Over 100 case histories of diseases cured by the famous warm springs and baths of Lucca during the period of about 1754-1770.
An anonymous Italian doctor gives exact case histories with full name and age of the patients. Cases of cancer, venereal diseases, eye diseases, rickets, etc. are described in detail.

Manuscript, written in ink on paper and bound in contemporary red morocco, richly gilt, with fine old marbled paper used as end papers, was purchased by Yale Med from L. Harper, catalog 6, in February, 1958.

record.title: [Account book of unknown physician-pharmacist of Norwich, Connecticut, Jan. 1763-Feb. 1765].
record.note: Possibly that of either Philip Turner or Daniel Lathrop.
Bound with it is "Dr. Philip Turner of Norwich, Connecticut" by Charles B. Graves, M.D., New London, Conn., 1928 (reprinted from vol.X., no.1, pages 1-24, Annals of Medical History).

record.title: Observations medicales, 1785-1786.
record.note: Notes likely made by a student, in 3 parts: I. Observations made by L. Desbois de Rochefort.--II. "Des maladies de la Charite traitees par M. Mathey en avril 1786."--III. "Questions discutees par M. La Planche ... a l'hospice de Vangirard."
Manuscript, written in ink on paper and bound in full contemporary leather, was purchased by Yale Med from Nourry-Thiebaud catalog 80 in October, 1960.

record.title: Traité de phisiologie / par monsieur Petit.
record.note: Manuscript, written in ink on paper and bound in contemporary vellum, was purchased by Yale Med from Nourry-Thiébaud catalog 78 in November, 1957.
Possibly copied by his son, Marc Antoine Petit (1766-1811).

record.title: Cours de medecine pratique, contenant la maniere de connoitre et de guerir les maladies : d'apres les lecons de M. A. Petit.
record.note: Lecture notes include a course on venereal diseases, to which are added two manuscripts in another hand on materia medica and case histories from L'Hopital militaire des fievres de Brest, 1768.
Manuscript, written in black ink and bound in contemporary mottled leather, was purchased by Yale med from Thiebaud (Paris) catalog 82 in March, 1962. Petit's dates taken from dealer's description.

record.title: Traite des accouchements.
record.note: Manuscript, written in brown ink on paper and bound in contemporary boards, of a course of lectures given by Antoine Petit which has later been published under the title: "Traite des maladies des femmes enceintes." It was purchased by Yale Med in October, 1960 from Librairie Emile Nourry, J. Thiébaud, successeur, catalog 80.

record.title: Cours d'accouchements / par Mr. Petit, Docteur Regent dans la Faculte-de Paris, 1765.
record.note: Binder's title: Maladies de la grosse.
Manuscript, written in brown ink and bound in contemporary quarter leather, was purchased by Yale Med from Thiébaud (of Paris) in July, 1959.

record.title: Physiologia seu gonomologia : sive disputatio p:a : de semine et sanguine corporis humani principiis.
record.note: Dated from contemporary notation pasted inside front cover.

Manuscript, written in black ink on paper and bound in contemporary vellum, was purchased by Yale Med in December, 1964 from Ximenes Rare Books (Cambridge, Mass.). Letter from Stephen Weissman, enclosed with manuscript, states that it was acquired from an un-named book store in Naples, Italy.
Leaves 70-79 skipped in numbering; no text lost.

record.title: Prolegome in universae medicinae / authore Antonio Wenceslao Rings ... urbem Pragenam physico jurato ; conscripta a me Fr. Faustino Fechtner iusdem facultatis auditore.
record.note: Manuscript, written in black ink (including illustrations) and bound in contemporary boards, was acquired by Yale Med from Perlstein (gift?) in October, 1961.
A manuscript prepared for publication.

record.title: A treatise on the operations of surgery : as they are now performed in St. Thomas's hospital / by C.S., 1754.
record.note: Manuscript, written in brown ink on paper and bound in contemporary full leather, also includes author's book plate.

record.title: Ein Rec. wieder alle Krankheiten der Seelen ümb vergebüng der Sünden.
record.note: Includes materia medica.
Manuscript, written in brown ink on paper and bound in contemporary boards, was purchased by Yale Med. from Kraus (book dealer) in February, 1962.
Page 2 signed: Matthias Thadaeus Schebl.
Signed [on page 201]: Mathias Joannes Schebl artis chyrurgica et theoria practicus, Wiennae 4. Januarii anno 1735.

record.title: Medical lecture notes on various topics : manuscript.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger.
Includes indices at the end of each unit.

Title of unit 1: Collegium casuale chirurgicum viri illustris excellentissimi consultissimi experientissimi domini Ernesti Stahlri, philos. et medic. doctoris celeberrimi, potentiss. regis boruss coroiliarii atque archiatri spectatissimi, In alma Friedericiana, cum tunc temporis professora tum ibi teneret, habitum. Descripsit J. G. Breithaupt mens maio anni 1718.

Title of unit 2: Collegium de praescriptione formularum viri excellentissimi et experientissimi domini dni Georgii Danielis Coschwizii philos. et med. doctoris celeberrimi in illustr. Friedericiana professoris publici ordinarii exceptum a Joanne Godofredo Breithaupt med. stud. Halae MDCCXVI.

Title of unit 3: Collegium dogmatico [pathologico] clinico practicum viri excelenetissimi atque experientissimi domini dn Georgii Danielis Coschwizii, med. doctoris celeberrimi in illustri Friedericiana professoris p.o. ellegantissimi fidelissimique privato studio exceptum a Johanne Godofredo Breithaupt med. studios. crucib. Thur. Halae Magdeb. A[nn]o MDCCXV, XVI et XVII.
Binding: bound in contemporary quarter vellum with marbled paper-covered boards.

record.title: Ṭarīqat nāmah. -- [16--?].

record.title: Ṭarīqat nāmah. -- [17--].
record.note: With: 4 other titles.

record.title: Koran. -- [15-- or 16--].

record.title: Mukhtaṣar fī akhbar al-bashar. -- [14--?].
record.note: Variant title in manuscript: Kitāb taʾrīkh Ṣāḥib Ḥamāh.
Leaf 2 recto illuminated.

record.title: Kanz al-maʻānī fī sharḥ Ḥirz al-amānī. -- [17--?].
record.note: Followed by 1 leaf of poetry and notes.

record.title: Scelta di varii secreti / del Dottore Carlo Tarallo, chirurgo della regia corte.
record.note: Manuscript in unidentified hand, on paper, containing the text "Scelta di varii secreti del Dottore Carlo Tarallo." Includes descriptions of various diseases and conditions, with suggested prescriptions and methods of cure. Examples include: Apoplesia, Paralesia, unguento per la carnosità, and many others. It is dated from a reference on page 108 to Pope Alexander VI (Borgia, who served 1492-1503; Poluere contro ueneno, puntura, et humore melanconico). Concludes with an index. One leaf before the index wanting.
Title from front title page.
Script: humanist minuscule.
Layout: single column of 20 lines.
Binding: bound in limp vellum. Unidentified manuscript note on front cover: Dr Raniga(?). Modern label on spine: 21.
Index: Tavola delle cose che si contengono nel presente libro.

record.title: De medicina : et therapeutica.
record.note: Manuscript, written in black ink on paper and bound in full calf, was purchased by Yale Med from Thiébaud (Paris book seller) catalog 85 in 1963.
"Ex libris petri jacobi ygnatii Van Stra[ceeke] 1752" written atop first page.

record.title: Tractatus de morbis capitis affectibus.
record.note: Lecture notes taken by a student: the 106 page section has caption title Tractatus de morbis pectoris; the 190 page part has caption title: De morbis infiniis ventris. Yale Med purchased this manuscript, rebound in vellum, from Thiebaud catalog 85 in 1963. Dealer's squib says the blank pages indicated this was copied from an incomplete manuscript.

record.title: [Daʻawāt]. -- 1889.

record.title: Antepraxis : Chirurgia universa ; Praxeos medicae liber VII delve venerea.

record.title: An extract of the history of a most cruel distemper which has never yet been described : drawn up according to the rules of physick, being a pamphlet in Latin of 60 pages in octavo.
record.note: Manuscript, written in English with black ink on paper, was purchased by Dr. Fulton from Wm. Dawson & Sons Ltd. (London) in April, 1960.
At head of caption-title: Bibliotheque Raisonnée, Volume 1.
Includes original grey wrappers.

record.title: Index chemicus : "Ablutio" to "Aquafoetida".
record.note: Manuscript, written in brown ink on paper and bound in quarter leather within blank pages, was purchased by Harvey Cushing from Sotheby & Company's sale of Newton papers on 13 July 1936. It was donated by Dr. Cushing to Yale Med.

record.title: Letter from Isaac Newton to Henry Ingle, 1712 Oct 13 : manuscript.
record.note: Published in Stanley D. Truelson, Jr., "An Isaac Newton Letter and the Enclosure Movement," Yale University Library Gazette, 47 (July 1972): pages 10-14.

record.title: Orationes of the Vita Christi (fragments).
record.note: Formerly known as "The Book of Hours." Leaves identified by Peter Kidd, 2017, as part of the Vita Christi of Ludolph of Saxony. Additional leaves discovered in the Harry Ransom, HRC Leaf 18, and Detroit Art Institute, reference number 69.277.
Title devised by cataloger.
Script: humanist minuscule.
Decoration: text in yellow frame. Two-line initials in white, blue, and gold with floral motifs. Titles in blue ink. Red, blue, and gold line fillers.

Ten miniatures in ink, tempera, and gold, framed by columns: Jesus, accompanied by two apostles, heals man with leprosy (f. 1r); Jesus, accompanied by two apostles, stands beside centurion and bed-ridden servant (f. 1v); Jesus stands in field of wheat, accompanied by three apostles (f. 2r); Jesus, accompanied by apostle, heals man with withered hand--two men (Pharisees) stand behind him (f. 2v); Jesus frees possessed man from red demon (f. 3v); Jesus raises child from grave--mother looks on (f. 3v); Jesus frees possessed man from red demon (f. 4r); Jesus in front of city, talks to crowd (f. 4v); Jesus, accompanied by unidentified person, frees two possessed men from black and gold demons (f. 5r); Jesus, accompanied by unidentified person, heals bed-ridden paralyzed man (f. 5v).
Layout: written in 1 column of 21 lines.
Binding: modern cloth binding over pasteboard signed by binder: Bound by J. Desmonts / J. Macdonald Co. / Norwalk. Conn.
Foliation of original sequence(?) in modern pencil on recto: 38, 55, 39, 72, 72.y52; and foliation of order of fragments (i.e., 1-5) in modern pencil on verso.

record.title: The building of Stafford House.
record.note: Other architects mentioned include Robert Smirke and Charles Barry.

Lawyer's brief (ms.) prepared for use in a civil action brought by Benjamin Wyatt against the Duke of Sutherland during the course of the building of Stafford House (later Lancaster House) in London. Case was probably never tried. See Colvin, p. 28.
Pencilled title on p. 59: Correspondence, etc., concerning alterations and work on Stafford House.

record.title: 880-02 Zāwiyat Shaykh al-Shuyūkh / Sharaf al-Dīn ʻAbd al-ʻAzīz ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī ; ikhtiyār Taqī al-Dīn Abī Bakr ibn Ḥijjah. --, 1409.
record.note: Incipit of Zāwiyat shaykh al-shuyūkh: "Bismillāh al-Raḥman al-Raḥīm. Ammā baʻd ḥamd Allāh alladhī aṭlaʻanā min zawāyā al-adab ʻalá khabāyā ..."
Fair naskhī, in red and black; ʻunwān in gold and color on leaf 1 recto.
Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.
Misbound, with some leaves missing.
With: 2 other titles.

On folio 60a: A colophon of the selection from the poems of Zuhayr al-Muhallabī (Bahāʼ al-Dīn Zuhayr ibn Muḥammad, 1185-1258), presumably by Ibn Ḥijjah, as follows: "Hādhā ākhir mā ikhtartuhu min shiʻr ... Bahāʼ al-Dīn Abī al-Faḍl Zuhayr ... bi-al-Qāhirah ... fī shahr al-Muḥarram, sanat ithnay ʻashar wa-thamānimiʼah."

Translation of the colophon on folio (60a): "This is the end of what I selected from the poetry of ... Bahāʼ al-Dīn Abī al-Faḍl Zuhayr ... in Cairo ... in the month of al-Muḥarram of the year 812 [of the Hijrah = May/June 1409]."
Colophon (folio 67b): "Najaza al-mukhtār al-musammá bi-Zāwiyat shaykh al-shuyūkh bi-al-Qāhirah al-maḥrūsah fī ghurrat al-Muḥarram sanat ithnay ʻashar wa-thamānimiʼah ..."

Translation of the colophon (folio 67b): "The selection from the book titled Zāwiyat shaykh al-shuyūkh was completed in protected Cairo at the beginning of al-Muḥarram of the year 812 [of the Hijrah = 25 May, 1409] ..."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Mulḥat al-iʻrāb / Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥasan ibn al-Ṣāʼigh. --, 1316.
record.note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ... Qāla ... Abū Muḥammad al-Qāsim ibn ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Ḥarīrī ... Aqūlu min baʻdi iftitāḥi al-qawli // bi-ḥamdi dhī al-ṭawli al-shadīdi al-ḥawli ..."
Calligraphic naskhī, in red and black; vocalized throughout.
Colophon: "Najazat ... fī mustahall shahr Rajab al-fard, sant sittata ʻashar wa-sabʻimiʼah ..."
Translation of the colophon: "It was completed ... at the beginning of the month of Rajab, the year 716 [of the Hijrah = 27 September 1316] ..."

record.title: 880-03 Dīwān / Abū al-Ṭayyib Aḥmad ibn al-Ḥusayn ibn al-Ḥasan al-Mutanabbī al-Kūfī. --, 1458 or 1459.
record.note: Collected poems.
Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ... Qāla Abū al-Ṭayyib Aḥmad ibn al-Ḥusayn ibn al-Ḥasan al-Mutanabbī al-Kūfī wa-mawliduhu fīhā bi-Kindah, sanat thalāth wa-thalāthimiʼah ..."
Good naskhī.
Extensive marginalia.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.
Colophon (folio 1a): "Raqama hādhihi al-nuskhah wa-ḍabaṭahā ... mālikuhā kātib hādhihi al-asṭur Muḥammad ibn ʻĪsá ibn Muḥammad ibn [?] al-Shāfiʻī, sanat 863 ..."

Translation of the colophon: "This copy was transcribed and corrected ... by its owner, the writer of these lines, Muḥammad ibn ʻĪsá ibn Muḥammad ibn [?] al-Shāfiʻī, in the year 863 [of the Hijrah = 1458/1459 ..."

record.title: 880-03 Dīwān / Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn Zaghdān. --, [15--?].
record.note: Collected Sufi poems.
Fairly old (16th century?) naskhī, in red and black.
Beginning and end missing. Starts with: "... Wa-qad āna dhikr Tarjumān al-mushāhid bi-lisān al-wārid. Ḥarf al-alif. Qāla lisān al-wārid: Alifu al-tafānī ādhanat bi-fanāʼī ..."

record.title: 880-02 Durrat al-aslāk fī dawlat al-Atrāk. Al-Juzʼ al-thānī / Badr al-Dīn al-Ḥasan ibn ʻUmar ibn Ḥabīb al-Ḥalabī. --, 1448.
record.note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī lā tārīkha li-azalīyatihi wa-qidamih ..."
Hasty naskhī, in red and black.
Marginalia.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihi fī yawm al-Sabt ... al-ʻāshir min shahr Allāh al-Muḥarram, iftitāḥ shuhūr sanat ithnayn wa-khamsīn wa-thamāni miʼah ... wa-katabahu li-nafsihi ... Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻUthmān ibn Abī al-faḍl al-Kātib ..."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy was completed on Saturday ... 10 Muḥarram, the beginning of the months of the year 852 [of the Hijrah = 25 March, 1448] ... wrote it for himself ... Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻUthmān ibn Abī al-faḍl al-Kātib ..."

record.title: 880-02 Ṭarz al-ghurar fī ḥall al-durar / Sulaymān ibn Ḥamzah ibn Ḥashīsh al-Falakī al-Ḥanafī al-ʻUthmānī. --, 1837.
record.note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ... al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn ... Yā man jaʻala qulūb al-ḥussāb aflākan li-maṭāliʻ al-budūr ..."

Translation of the colophon: "This copy was completed ... on 22 Shaʻbān, 1253 [of the Hijrah = 21 November, 1837] ..."

record.title: 880-03 al-Rāmizah al-shāfiyah fī ʻilm al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfiyah / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUthmān al-Khazrajī. --, [1727 or 1728].

record.title: 880-02 Fatḥ Rabb al-Barīyah bi-sharḥ al-Qaṣīdah al-Khazrajīyah / Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī. --, 1728.
record.note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla ... Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyāʼ al-Anṣārī ... Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhā sharḥ ʻalá al-Khazrajīyah ..."

Translation of the colophon: "This commentary was completed ... on Thursday, 18 Jumād al-Awwal, 1140 [of the Hijrah = 1 January, 1728] ..."

record.title: Lettre de cachet du 1er [?] Feb. 1747 [?].
record.note: Ms. copy of a lettre de cachet, presumably by King Louis XV, asking for the resignation of d'Argenson from his post as "secretaire d'état de la guerre". Following the lettre de cachet are some lines of satircal verse.

record.title: 880-01 Fawāʼid kanz al-fuqahāʼ. --, [before 1794].
record.note: Title written on bottom edges as Fawāʼid al-fuqahāʼ.
Brockelmann, S II, p. 953 lists a Fawāʼid al-fuqahāʼ by Maḥmūd ibn Muḥammad ibn Sulaymān Efendi.
Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ... al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-Ghanī al-Wahhāb, al-munzzah ʻan al-laghw wa-al-alqāb ... Wa-sammaytu hādhā al-kitāb 'Fawāʼid kanz al-fuqahāʼ' ..."
Fairly modern naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.

record.title: 880-01 Mishkāt al-Miṣbāḥ al-mughnī ʻan al-Ḍawʼ wa-al-Iftitāḥ. --, [18--?].
record.note: The first word of the title is misspelled on leaf 1 recto and in the incipit (leaf 1 verso) as Mushkilāt.
Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ... al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī nawwara qulūbanā bi-maʻālij [bi-maṣābīḥ] al-ʻilm wa-al-ḥikam ..."
Modern (19th century?) naskhī, in red and black.
Interlinear and marginal notations.

record.title: 880-02 Kharīdat al-ʻajāʼib wa-farīdat al-gharāʼib / Zayn al-Dīn ʻUmar ibn al-Muẓaffar ibn al-Wardī. --, [17--?].
record.note: Manual of cosmography; curiosities and wonders.
Some sources attribute the book to Ibn al-Wardī, Sirāj al-Dīn Abū Ḥafṣ ʻUmar, died 1457.
Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ... al-Ḥamdu lillāh ghāfir al-dhanb, qābil al-tawb, shadīd al-ʻiqāb, ʻālim al-ghayb ..."
Fair modern (18th century?) naskhī, in red and black; leaves 141-174 supplied by a later hand.
Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Nikāt al-arbaʻīn al-Nasafīyah / Shams al-Dīn Maḥmūd ibn Ibrāhīm al-Khuwārizmī. --, 1308.
record.note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī yusahhilu li-aḍʻaf ʻibādihi bi-ʻināyatihi al-azalīyah kull ʻasīr ..."
Very minute sparsely pointed hand.
Marginalia.
With: 4 other titles.

Colophon: "Faragha min kitābatihi li-nafsihi, muttiʻa bi-hi, ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Qāshī maḥtidan, al-Kūfī mawlidan ... fī yawm al-Thulāthāʼ, ḥādī ʻashar Muḥarram, sanat thamān wa-sabʻimiʼah ..."

Translation of the colophon: "Copied by ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Qāshī maḥtidan, al-Kūfī mawlidan for himself. May it be enjoyable ... on Tuesday, 11 Muḥarram, 708 [of the Hijrah = 9 July, 1308] ..."

record.title: 880-01 Sharḥ Manshaʼ al-naẓar. --, 1310.
record.note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn ... Wa-baʻd, fa-inna Manshaʼ al-naẓar wa-in kāna ṣūrah min al-mukhtaṣarāt fa-lā yakfī minhā ..."
Very minute sparsely pointed hand.
Marginalia.
With: 4 other titles.
Colophon: "Faragha min taḥrīrihi ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Qāshī fī baldat Mardīn, fī shahr Muḥarram, min sanat ʻashr wa-sabʻimiʼah."
Translation of the colophon: "Copied by ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Qāshī in the city of Mardīn, during the month of Muḥarram, in the year 710 [of the Hijrah = June/July, 1310]."

record.title: 880-01 Sharḥ al-Muqaddimah al-khilāfīyah. --, [1310].
record.note: A fragment, the first leaf, only.
Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn ... Wa-baʻd, wa-al-lāzim ʻalá al-munāẓir taḥrīr al-mabāḥith ..."
Very minute sparsely pointed hand.
Marginalia.
With: 4 other titles.

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Qusṭās fī al-manṭiq / Muḥammad ibn Ashraf al-Samarqandī. --, 1305.
record.note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ḥamda al-shākirīn ... Wa-baʻd, fa-inna ḥuṣūl al-saʻādāt al-abadīyah wa-al-kamālāt [al-ladhdhāt] al-sarmadīyah innamā yutawaqqaʻu bi-iktisāb al-kamālāt al-ʻilmīyah ..."
Very minute sparsely pointed hand.
Interlinear and marginal notations.
With: 4 other titles.

Colophon: "Faragha min taḥrīrihi li-nafsihi, muttiʻa bi-hi ... ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Qāshī maḥtidan, al-Kūfī mawlidan ... ʻuṣayr al-Sabt, min ayyām shahr Jumādá al-Ūlá, min sanat khams wa-sabʻimiʼah ... bi-baldat Iṣfahān ..."

Translation of the Colophon: "Copied by ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Qāshī maḥtidan, al-Kūfī mawlidan, for himself, may it be enjoyable ... on the afternoon of Saturday, of the month of Jumādá al-Ūlá, of the year 705 [of the Hijrah = November/December, 1305] ... in the city of Iṣfahān ..."

record.title: 880-01 Risālah fī waḍʻ al-wafq al-tāmm. --, [1305].
record.note: With diagrams.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn ... Wa-baʻd, fa-lammā kāna iʻdād al-wafq qad ishtahar min khawaṣṣihā, mā suʻifa bi-sababihi kull aḥad bi-maʻrifat waḍʻihā ..."
Very minute sparsely pointed hand.
Marginalia.
With: 4 other titles.
Colophon: "Faragha [...] ... ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Qāshī ..."
Translation of the colophon: "Completed by [...] ... ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Qāshī ..."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Durrat al-ghawwāṣ / Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Abī Bakr al-Anṣārī al-Shāfiʻī al-Fūwī. --, [17--?].
record.note: The title as given is written on the lower adges.
The author's name al-Fūwī is misprinted as al-Lughawī in Kâtip Çelebi, III, 206 and is corrected in the Istanbul edition, I, 741.
For the village of Fūwah (Egypt) see Yāqūt (Muʻjam al-buldān).

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ... Qāla al-Shaykh ... Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn ... Abī Bakr al-Anṣārī al-Shāfiʻī al-Fūwī ... al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-ʻAlī wa-bi-hi aʻtaqid, al-Qawī wa-ʻalayhi aʻtamid ..."
Fairly modern (18th century?) naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.
Marginalia.
In pencil on fly-leaf: "James Barnett."

record.title: 880-02 Adab al-ḥukkām fī sulūk ṭuruq al-aḥkām / Sharaf al-Dīn ʻĪsá al-Ghazzī. --, 1472.
record.note: Title from: Cairo catalog, III, 190 (same incipit).
Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ... al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn ... Ammā baʻd, fa-inna al-qaḍāʼ min al-waẓāʼif al-khaṭirah fī al-ākhirah jiddan ..."
Fair naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in brown, flap missing.
Marginalia.
Colophon: "Najaza ʻalá yad mālikihi ... Muḥammad Lī [...] fī nahār al-Khamīs al-mubārak, thālith ʻishrīn Shawwāl ... sanat sitt wa-sabʻīn wa-thamānimiʼah ..."
Translation of the colophon: "It was completed by the hand of its owner ... Muḥammad Lī [...] on blessed Thursday, 23 Shawwāl ... 876 [of the Hijrah = 12 April 1472]."

record.title: 880-01 Fatāwá fī al-furūʻ. --, [17--?].
record.note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Kitāb al-Istiḥsān wa-al-karāhiyah. Dhakar fī fatāwá al-Sirājīyah fī hādhā al-kitāb bāban fī al-masāʼil al-iʻtiqādīyah ..."
Fairly modern (18th century?) nastaʻlīq, in red, green, and black.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.

record.title: 880-02 Kitāb al-muthallath / Abū ʻAlī Quṭrub ibn Aḥmad al-Mustanīr al-Baṣrī. --, 1578.
record.note: Hitti 2003(27) is a versified version, and Ahlwardt 7072 a shorter one, without the shawāhid.
Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ... Qāla [Abū] ʻAlī Quṭrub ibn Aḥmad al-Mustanīr al-Baṣrī ... hādhā kitāb al-lughah yuqālu la-hu Kitāb al-muthallath ..."
Fair naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in brown, front cover and flap missing.
With: 1 other title.
Colophon: "Katabahu ... kātibuhu Ḥasan ibn Ḥusayn fī Madrasat Tatimmah ... tārīkhuhu sittah [wa-]thamānīn wa-tisʻimiʼah, Rabīʻ al-Awwal ..."
Translation of the colophon: "Copied by ... its transcriber Ḥasan ibn Ḥusayn at Madrasat Tatimmah ... dated Rabīʻ al-Awwal, 986 [of the Hijrah = May/June, 1578]."

record.title: 880-02 al-Taʻrīfāt / ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Sayyid al-Sharīf al-Jurjānī. --, [15--?].
record.note: Incipit: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh ḥaqqa ḥamdih ... Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi taʻrīfāt jamaʻtuhā wa-iṣṭilāḥāt akhadhtuhā min kutub al-qawm ..."
Fair 16th century nastaʻlīq, in red and black.
Marginalia.
Islamic binding, in brown, front cover and flap missing.
With: 1 other title.

record.title: 880-02 Itḥāf al-murīd bi-Jawharat al-tawḥīd / ʻAbd al-Salām ibn Ibrāhīm al-Mālikī al-Laqānī. --, [1781].
record.note: Incipit: ""Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ... al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī rafaʻa li-ahl al-Sunnah al-Muḥammadīyah fī al-ʻālamīn aʻlāman ..."
Fair Maghribī hand, in red and black.
Marginalia.
Islamic binding, paper covered, flap missing.

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min hādhā al-kitāb ... yawm al-Ithnayn, ʻinda al-zawāl ... ʻalá yad ... Abī al-Qāsim ibn al-Zawāghī ibn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAbbās ibn Ūsīr [al-Asīr?] nasaban al-Ashʻarī iʻtiqādan, al-Mālikī madhhaban ... Wa-kāna al-farāgh minhu fī shahr ... Rajab, yawm al-ikhtitām [?] minhu [...]"

Translation of the colophon: "This book was concluded ... on Monday evening ... by the hand of ... Abī al-Qāsim ibn al-Zawāghī ibn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAbbās ibn Ūsīr [al-Asīr?] nasaban al-Ashʻarī iʻtiqādan, al-Mālikī madhhaban ... it was completed in the month of ... Rajab, the day it was completed [?] [...]."

record.title: 880-02 Mughnī al-labīb ʻan kutub al-aʻārīb. Al-Niṣf al-awwal / Jamāl al-Dīn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Yūsuf ibn Hishām. --, [before 1413].
record.note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ... Ammā baʻd ḥamd Allāh ʻalá afḍālih ... fa-inna awlá mā taqtariḥuhu al-qarāʼiḥ wa-aʻlá mā tanjaḥu [tajnaḥu] ilá taḥṣīlihi al-jawāniḥ mā yatayattasū [yatayassaru] bi-hi fahm Kitāb Allāh al-munzal ..."
Fair naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.
The second half wanting.

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ al-Talkhīṣ al-musammá al-Mukhtaṣar / lil-Saʻd al-Taftāzānī. --, 1732.
record.note: Known as: al-Sharḥ al-mukhtaṣar.
Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ... Naḥmaduka yā man sharaḥ ṣudūranā li-talkhīṣ al-bayān fī īḍā[ḥ] al-maʻānī ..."
Fair naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihi yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, rābiʻ shahr Dhī al-Ḥijjah ... sanat alf wa-miʼah [wa-]arbaʻah wa-arbaʻīn ... ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-faqīr ... Muḥammad ..."
Translation of the colophon: "Copied on blessed Thursday, 4 Dhī al-Ḥijjah ... 1144 [of the Hijrah = 29 May, 1732] ... by the hand of the poor servant ... Muḥammad ..."

record.title: 880-02 al-Dīwān al-mawsūm bi-Istinārat al-sālikīn wa-tuḥfat al-mustahlakīn / Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad Wafāʼ al-Iskandarī al-Shādhilī. --, 1697.
record.note: Collected Sufi poems.
The last line of Ahlwardt 8084 is found on leaf 103 recto of this manuscript, in the middle of a poem.
Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ... Qāla ... Tawahhumu dhāt al-farqi aqṣá kamā adná // fa-lā gharaḍan aqṣá wa-lā maqṣadan asnā ..."
Fair naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.
Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh minhu yawm al-Ithnayn al-mubārak sābiʻ shahr Shawwāl al-mubārak, sanat [1]108 ..."
Translation of the colophon: "It was completed on blessed Monday, the seventh of the blessed month of Shawwāl, of the year [1]108 [of the Hijrah = 29 April, 1697] ..."

record.title: 880-03 Kitāb al-Mufaṣṣal fī ṣanʻat al-iʻrāb / Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar al-Zamakhsharī. --, [16--?].
record.note: Arabic grammar.
Incomplete at end.
Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Allāh aḥmadu ʻalá an jaʻalanī min ʻulamāʼ al-ʻArabīyah ..."
Fairly old (17th century?) calligraphic naskhī, in red and black.
Profuse interlinear and marginal notations in the first part of the manuscript.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.

record.title: 880-03 Dīwān / Abū al-Ḥasan ʻAlī ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Shushtarī al-Numayrī. --, 1592.
record.note: Collected Sufi poems.
Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ... Hādhā Diwān al-Shaykh ... Abū al-Ḥasan al-Shushtarī al-Numayrī ... Qaṣdiya unẓur ilayya wa-infī dhā al-wahma ʻannī ..."
Calligraphic naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.
Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh ... fī yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, thālith ʻashar Shawwāl ... sanat alf ... ʻalá yad ... Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Jarmakī ..."

Translation of the colophon: "It was completed ... on blessed Thursday, 13 Shawwāl ... the year 1000 [of the Hijrah = 23 July, 1592] ... by the hand of ... Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Jarmakī ..."

record.title: 880-02 Mishkāt al-Maṣābīḥ / Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Khaṭīb al-Tibrīzī. --, 1715.
record.note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ... al-Ḥamdu lillāh naḥmaduhu ... Ammā baʻd, fa-inna al-tamassuk bi-hadyihi lā yastatibbu illā bi-al-iqtifāʼ li-mā ṣadara min mishkātihi ..."
Fair naskhī, in red and black; ʻunwān in colors on leaf 1 verso.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.
Colophon: "Tammat al-kitāb ... fī yawm al-Jumʻah, ʻishrīn shahr <min> Dhī al-Qaʻdah, sanat 127 [1127]."
Translation of the colophon: "The book was completed ... on Friday, 20 Dhī al-Qaʻdah, the year 127 [(1127) of the Hijrah = 17 November, 1715] ..."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Risālah li-ʻIṣām al-Dīn : ay, [Sharḥ ʻalá] Risālat al-waḍʻ li-ʻAḍud al-Dīn / Ibrāhīm ibn Muḥammad al-ʻIṣām al-Asfarāyīnī. --, [17--?].
record.note: Known as: Sharḥ ʻalá al-Risālah al-waḍʻīyah.
Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn ... Hādhihi al-īmāʼ ilá al-maʻānī al-mutarattibah al-mawjūdah fī al-taʻaqqul faqaṭ ..."
Fairly modern (18th century?) naskhī, in red and black.
Profuse marginalia in the first part of the manuscript.
Laid-in leaves.
With: 2 other titles.

record.title: 880-01 Natījat afkār dhawī al-majd fī taḥrīr abḥāth wa-baʻdu. --, 1742 or 1743.
record.note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ... al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī la-hu al-amr min qablu wa-min baʻdu ..."
Fair naskhī, in red and black.
With: 2 other titles.
Colophon: "Tammat sanat 1155."
Translation of the colophon: "It was completed in the year 1155 [of the Hijrah = 1742/1743]."

record.title: 880-02 Kashf al-ḥijāb fī maʻrifat al-ajzāʼ wa-al-aḥzāb / taʼlīf al-shaykh ʻUmar ibn Qāsim al-Anṣārī al-shahīr bi-al-Nashshār. --, 1819 or 1820.
record.note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Yaqūlu ... ʻUmar ibn Qāsim al-Anṣārī al-Nashshār: al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-mutafaḍḍil bi-al-ʻaṭāʼ al-midrār ..."
Good naskhī, in red and black.
Title in the incipit (leaf 33 recto) is given as: Kashf al-ḥijāb ʻan ajzāʼ al-aḥzāb.
With: 2 other titles.
Colophon: "Tammat ... sanat 1235."
Translation of the colophon: "It was completed ... in the year 1235 [of the Hijrah = 1819/1820]."

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ Muslim lil-Imām al-Nawawī : al-juzʼ al-akhīr. --, [15--?].
record.note: Known as: al-Minhāj fī sharḥ Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim ibn al-Ḥajjāj.
Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Kitāb al-Ṣayd wa-al-dhabāʼiḥ mimmā yuʼkalu min al-ḥayawān ..."
Fairly old (16th century?) naskhī, in red and black.
Loose in Islamic binding, in black, with flap.
2 leaves from another manuscript are inserted at end.

record.title: 880-02 al-Jāmiʻ al-ṣaghīr / Ḥusām al-Dīn ʻUmar ibn ʻAbd al-ʻAzīz al-Bukhārī. --, 1668 or 1669.
record.note: Title from: Brockelmann, I, 172.
Title given on leaf 1 recto (as Kitāb khilāfīyāt of al-Nasafī) is wrong.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ... al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn ... Qāla ... Ḥusām al-Dīn ʻUmar ibn ʻAbd al-ʻAzīz al-Bukhārī ... Ammā baʻd, fa-inna mashāyikhanā ... kānū yuʻaẓẓimūna hādhā al-kitāb taʻẓīman wa-yuqaddimūnahu ʻalá sāʼir al-kutub taqdīman ..."
Coarse naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, paper covered, flap missing.
Colophon: "Tammat hādhihi al-nuskhah ... ʻalá yad ... ʻAlī ibn [...] fī tārīkh alf wa-tisʻah wa-sabʻīn ..."
Translation of the colophon: "This copy was completed ... by the hand of ... ʻAlī ibn [...] in the year 1079 [of the Hijrah = 1668/1669] ..."

record.title: 880-02 al-Dhayl al-mutraf min al-Ashraf ilá al-Ashraf / naẓm al-Shaykh Shihāb al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn Asad ibn ʻAbd al-Wāḥid al-Amyūṭī al-Shāfiʻī. --, 1625.
record.note: The author's surname is spelled as al-Usyūṭī in al-Baghdādī. The work is perhaps the same supplement as the one ascribed to "al-Suyūṭī" in Brockelmann.
Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Yaqūlu al-faqīr Aḥmad ibn Asad: Min baʻd ḥamd Allāh dhī al-ṭawl al-ṣamad ḥamdan yafūqu ʻadad al-aḥṣāʼ fī kull ḥāl lā ilá inqiḍāʼ ..."
Calligraphic naskhī, in gold, red, and black.
Marginalia.
Colophon: "Taḥrīran fī al-yawm al-ḥādī wa-al-ʻishrīn min Shaʻbān al-Muʻaẓẓam, sanat arbaʻ wa-thalāthīn wa-alf."
Translation of the colophon: "Dated on 21 of glorious Shaʻbān, the year 1034 [of the Hijrah = 29 May, 1625]."

record.title: 880-02 al-ʻIbar fī man maḍá wa-ghabar / Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn ʻUthmān al-Dhahabī. --, 1548.
record.note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ... Qāla al-Shaykh ... Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn ʻUthmān al-Dhahabī: al-Ḥamdu lillāh mumīt al-aḥyāʼ wa-muḥyī al-amwāt ..."
Good naskhī, in red and black.
Loose in Islamic binding, in black, flap missing.
With: 1 other title.
Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min zabrihi waqt al-ẓuhr min yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ, al-tāsiʻ min shahr Rajab ... sanat khams wa-khamsīn wa-tisʻimiʼah ..."
Translation of the colophon: "The copy was completed on Wednesday noon, 9 Rajab ... of the year 955 [of the Hijrah = 24 August, 1548 ...]."

record.title: 880-02 Aḥsan al-sulūk fī naẓm man waliya Zabīd min al-mulūk / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn ʻAlī al-Daybaʻ. --, [1548].
record.note: Good naskhī, in red and black.
Loose in Islamic binding, in black, flap missing.
With: 1 other title.

record.title: 880-02 al-Tiriyūdī. --, [18--?].
record.note: Incipit: "Bi-ism al-Āb wa-al-Ibn wa-al-Rūḥ al-Quds ilāh wāḥid. Āmīn. Nabtadī ... naktubu kitāb al-Tiriyūdī min Aḥd al-Firrīsī wa-al-ʻAshshār ilá Aḥad al-Fiṣḥ al-majīd ..."
Modern (19th century) naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in red.

record.title: Arabic primer of calligraphy. -- [1800].
record.note: Copied about 1800.
Calligraphic naskhī, in red and black; ʻunwāns in gold and colors on leaf 1 verso and 2 recto.
"Yale College Library" written on inside of front cover.

record.title: 880-01 Kitāb fī al-ṭibb. --, [17--?].
record.note: A fragment only.
Begins on folio 1a with: "... wa-huwa alladhī kathura fīhi al-burūdah wa-al-ruṭūbah wa-qalla fīhi al-ḥarr wa-al-yabas ..."
Modern (18th century?) naskhī, in red and black.

record.title: 880-01 Wadāʻ Yūnus Kīnj ilá aḥbābihi fī Filasṭīn wa-Sūriyā. --, 1825.
record.note: Modern cursive hand.
Incipit: "Fī badʼ Aylūl sanat 1825. Yā aḥibbāʼī. Innahu yajibu al-suʼāl lanā min kathīrīn fī hādhihi al-bilād bi-an hal ʻinda al-Inkilīz dīn ..."

record.title: 880-01 al-Qurʼān. --, 1852.
record.note: Calligraphic naskhī; ʻunwāns in gold and colors on leaves 1 verso, 2 recto, 302 verso, and 303 recto.
Islamic binding, in black, gilt, with flap.
Colophon: "Tammat ... ʻalá yad ... al-Sayyid Aḥmad al-Ḥāmidī al-maʼdhūn min Aḥmad al-Sakhāʼī ... sanat 1268, fī 17 JA [Jmadá al-Awwal]."
Translation of the colophon: "It was completed ... by the hand of ... al-Sayyid Aḥmad al-Ḥāmidī, authorized by Aḥmad al-Sakhāʼī ... on 17 JA [Jumadá al-Awwal], 1268 [of the Hijrah = 9 March, 1852]."

record.title: Arabic primer of calligraphy. --, [17--?].
record.note: In manuscript on front cover: "Le 4ẹ Juillet 1731 François Surian". In pencil on back cover: "Bought on the Quais. Paris Aug. 1930. 30 frs."
The owner's name is written as al-Sarjān "Sergeant" on verso of front cover.
Calligraphic naskhī; ʻunwāns in colors on leaf 1 verso and 2 recto.

record.title: 880-01 Asāṭīr al-awwalīn fī qiṣaṣ al-anbiyāʼ wa-al-mursalīn : qiṣṣat Yūsuf. --, 1925.
record.note: Copied in 1925.
Fair naskhī.

record.title: 880-01 Ṣalawāt. --, [17--?].
record.note: For similar collections, cf. Berlin catalog, III, 398.
Calligraphic naskhī, richly gilt, with several ʻunwāns in gold and colors.
Fairly modern (18th century?) hand.
Islamic binding, in black, gilt, with flap.

record.title: 880-02 Tahdhīb al-lughah / Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Azharī. --, 1692-1695.
record.note: V.1 (210 folios); v.2 (187 folios); v.3 (242 folios); v.6 (212 folios).
Volumes 4 and 5 wanting.
Spaces and whole blank pages left for missing text.
Fair naskhī, in red and black.
Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ... al-Ḥamdu lillāh Dhī [...] ʻalá mā asbagha ʻalaynā min niʻamihi al-ẓāhirah ..."
Islamic binding, in brown, with flaps.

Colophon: "Wa-waqaʻa al-farāgh minhu fī yawm al-Sabt, al-rābiʻ min shahr Dhī al-Qaʻdah ... sanat 1103 [- fī yawm al-Thulāthāʼ, al-ʻishrīn min shahr Shaʻbān ... sanat 1106, sitt wa-miʼah wa-alf] ... ʻalá yad ... khalaf ibn Yūsuf al-Najafī ..."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy was completed on Saturday, 4 Dhī al-Qaʻdah ... 1103 [of the Hijrah = 18 July, 1692-Tuesday, 20 Shaʻbān ... 1106 of the Hijrah = 5 April, 1695] ... by the hand of ... Khalaf ibn Yūsuf al-Najafī ..."

record.title: 880-01 al-Qurʼān. -- 1374.
record.note: Calligraphic naskhī, in red, gold, and black; several ʻunwāns in gold. Nicely decorated.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.
Colophon: "Min ʻashr shahr Ramaḍān al-muʻaẓẓam sanat khamsah wa-sabʻīn wa-sabʻimiʼah ..."
Translation of the colophon: "On the tenth of the month of glorious Ramaḍān, 775 [of the Hijrah = 3 March, 1374] ..."

record.title: 880-01 al-Qurʼān. -- 1685 or 1686.
record.note: Calligraphic naskhī, in blue, gold, and black; ʻunwāns in gold and colors. Nicely decorated.
Islamic binding, in brown, gilt, with flap.
Colophon: "Tamām shad farāgh az khaṭṭi Muṣḥaf fī sanat-i sabʻah wa-tisʻīn wa-alf."
Translation of the colophon: "The copy of the Muṣḥaf was completed in the year 1097 [of the Hijrah = 1685/1686]."

record.title: 880-01 al-Qurʼān. -- 1652.
record.note: On envelope, inserted loose: "Bought in Cairo April 1910 E. Francis Riggs Jr."
Calligraphic naskhī, in gold and black; ʻunwāns in gold and colors.
Islamic binding, in brown, gilt, with flap.

Colophon: "Wa-qad ittafaqa al-farāgh min tanmīqihi ... fī tāsiʻ wa-al-ʻishrīn fī shahr Shawwāl ... sanat ithná wa-sittīn wa-alf ... wa-anā al-faqīr ... Muṣṭafá ibn Dilāwar al-Bawwāb al-Sulṭānī ..."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy was calligraphed ... on 29 Shawwāl ... of the year 1062 [of the Hijrah = 3 October, 1652] ... by me, the poor Muṣṭafá ibn Dilāwar, the Imperial Gate-keeper ..."

record.title: 880-02 Dalāʼil al-khayrāt / Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Sulaymān al-Jazūlī. -- 1848 or 1849.
record.note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ... Qāla al-Shaykh ... Abū ʻAbd Allāh ... Muḥammad ibn Sulaymān al-Jazūlī ... al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī hadānā lil-īmān wa-al-Islām ..."
Calligraphic naskhī, in red and black; ʻunwāns in gold and colors.
Islamic binding, in red, with flap.

record.title: 880-01 Ṣalawāt. -- 1800.
record.note: Calligraphic naskhī, in red, white, and black; ʻunwāns in gold and colors.
Islamic binding, in brown, gilt, with flap.
Colophon (flolio 154a): "Katabahu al-dāʻī Muḥammad Amīn al-Rushdī ... fī R [?] 1 [probably Rabīʻ Awwal], sanat 1214."
Translation of the colophon: "Copied by the supplicant Muḥammad Amīn al-Rushdī ... in R [?] 1 [probably Rabīʻ Awwal], 1214 [of the Hijrah = August/September, 1799 [?]."

record.title: 880-02 Tuḥfat al-kirām bi-khabar al-ahrām / taʼlīf al-shaykh Jalāl al-Dīn al-Suyūṭī ; edited by Leon Nemoy. -- 1937.
record.note: Copied in 1937.
Title also given as: Tuḥfat al-kirām fī khabar al-ahrām.
Clean copy of text filed as Document 1064 in the American Documentation Institute, Washington, D.C.
Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ... al-Ḥamdu lillāh wa-salāmun ʻalá ʻibādihi alladhīn iṣṭafá. Hādhā juzʼ sammaytuhu Tuḥfat al-kirām bi-khabar al-ahrām ..."
Fair naskhī.

record.title: 880-03 Tuḥfat al-ḥukkām fī nukat al-ʻuqūd wa-al-aḥkām / Abū Bakr Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻĀṣim. -- 1757.
record.note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ... Qāla al-Shaykh ... Abū Bakr ibn ʻĀṣim ... al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī yaqḍī wa-lā yuqḍá ʻalayh, jalla shaʼnan wa-ʻalā ..."
Coarse Maghribī hand, in red and black.
Loose leaves, in a black leather wrapper, with strap, in red leather carrying case.
Profuse interlinear and marginal notations.
With: 1 other title.

record.title: 880-02 al-Itqān wa-al-iḥkām fī sharḥ Tuḥfat al-ḥukkām / Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad Mayyārah. -- 1757.
record.note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ... Qāla al-Shaykh ... Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad Mayyārah ... al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-munfarid bi-al-ḥukm wa-al-tadbīr, al-mustabidd bi-al-qaḍāʼ wa-al-taqdīr ..."
Small coarse Maghribī hand, in red and black.
With: 1 other title.

Colophon: "Faraghtu min hādhā al-sharḥ ... ʻinda al-zawāl, fī shahr ... Jumād al-Ūlá, li-ʻashrat ayyām maḍá minhu, fī ʻām sabʻīn baʻda al-miʼah wa-alf ... Katabahu li-nafsihi ... Muḥammad ibn Ḥamad Saʻīd ibn Sanab ibn Saʻīd ..."

Translation of the colophon: "I finished copying this commentary ... in the evening, in the month of ... Jumād al-Ūlá, ten days having passed of it, in the year 1170 [of the Hijrah = 31 January, 1757]. Wrote it for himself ... Muḥammad ibn Ḥamad Saʻīd ibn Sanab ibn Saʻīd ..."

record.title: 880-01 al-Qurʼān. -- 1840.
record.note: Fair naskhī; ʻunwāns in colors on leaves 1 verso and 2 recto.
Lacquered binding, with flap; in slip-case.
Bookplates of Richard Morris Hunt (one his own, the other jointly with Margaret Hunt).
Colophon: "Qad furigha tasweed hādhā al-kitāb ... fī yawm al-Ithnayn, fī shahr Jumādá al-Ūlá min shuhūr [sanat] sitt wa-khamsūn wa-miʼatayn baʻda alf ... 1256."
Translation of the colophon: "The copy of this book was completed ... on Monday, in the month of Jumādá al-Ūlá, of the year 1256 [of the Hijrah = [6 (?)] July, 1840]."

record.title: 880-02 Dalīl al-qāʼid li-kashf asrār ṣifāt al-Wāḥid / Muḥammad al-Ṣāliḥ ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Salīm al-Awjalī. -- [17--?].
record.note: His grandfather's name is given as Taslīm in Brockelmann.
Alternate title: Salīm ism.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ... Qāla al-Shaykh ... Muḥammad al-Ṣāliḥ ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Salīm al-Awjalī ... al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-ʻAlī al-Bārī // wa-munshiʼi al-khalq bi-al-ikhtiyāri ..."
Modern (18th century?) coarse Maghribī hand.
Interlinear and marginal notations.
Loose leaves in wrapper of goatskin with the fur on the inside.
Bookplate of A. Edward Newton.
With: 1 other title.
Colophon: "Tammat kitāb summiya Salīm ism ḥaqīqatuhu Dalīl al-qāʼid, yawm Sabt, ʻinda al-ẓuhr ... katabahu al-Ḥasan Jātawī ..."

Translation of the colophon: "The book titled Salīm ism [Faultless name] which is in its reality Dalīl al-qāʼi [Guide to the leader] was completed on a Saturday, at noon ... copied by al-Ḥasan Jātawī ..." of the colophon: "The book titled Salīm ism [Faultless name] which is in its reality Dalīl al-qāʼi [Guide to the leader] was completed on a Saturday, at noon ... copied by al-Ḥasan Jātawī ..."

record.title: 880-01 al-Jawāhir al-ḥisān fī taḥqīq maʻrifat arkān al-īmān. -- [17--?].
record.note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ... al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-Wāḥid al-Aḥad, al-fard al-ṣamad, alladhī lam yalid wa-lam yūlad ..."
Modern (18th century?) coarse Maghribī hand.
The title appears on folio 4a.
Perhaps by Muḥammad al-Ṣāliḥ al-Awjalī, the author of the other title of this manuscript.
With: 1 other title.

record.title: 880-01 Durr al-buḥūr min Mukhtaṣar sīrat al-Sharīf Yūsuf Rūbīnsūn / Daniel Defoe ; adapted into Arabic by John Lewis Burckhardt. -- 1812.
record.note: In manuscript on lining paper: "Síret Róbinsón A Tale, in Arabic, founded on Daniel Defoe's Romance of Robinson Crusoe -- This work was composed as an Exercise in the Arabic language, by John Lewis Burckhardt ... at Aleppo in 1810 (Nubia p. xxviii)."

On lining paper: " ... Three copies of it were sent by him [J.L. Burckhardt] to his friends, under the care of Mr. Fiott of St. John's College, Cambridge (now Dr. Lee of Doctors' Commons and Hartwell House) ... Of these copies one is now in Dr. Lee's possession, the second was delivered to ... Sir Joseph Banks, and the third (which is this book) was ... delivered to ... George Cecil Renouard, Chaplain to the British Factory ... Rectory, Swanscombe 5, April 1838. G.C. R[enouard]."

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Abadī al-Azalī al-Sarmadī ... nabtadī ... wa-naktubu sīrat al-Sharīf Rūbīnsūn min ahālī madīnat Būrk [Yūrk] min bilād al-Inkilīz, wa-mā qāsā [qāsá] min al-ahwāl wa-al-shadāʼid ..."
Fair naskhī, in red and black. [qāsá]
Islamic binding, in red, with flap.

Colophon: "Fa-hādhā min kitāb [al-kitāb] al-musammā [al-musammá] Durr al-buḥūr min mukhtaṣar sīrat al-Sharīf Yūsuf Rūbīnsūn ... qad tamma naskhuhu ... fī 13 Rabīʻ Awwal, sanat sabʻ wa-ʻishrīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf, 1227."

Translation of the colophon: "This is taken from the book titled 'Durr al-buḥūr min mukhtaṣar sīrat al-Sharīf Yūsuf Rūbīnsun' ... it was copied ... on 13 Rabīʻ Awwal, 1227 [of the Hijrah = 27 March, 1812]."

record.title: 880-01 al-Qurʼān. -- [before 1851].
record.note: Minute calligraphic naskhī, within gold border; ʻunwāns in gold and colors at the beginning.
Islamic binding, in brown, with gilt ʻunwāns, and with flap.
Bookplate of David Wagstaff.
Colophon: "Ṣaḥḥaḥa hādhā al-Muṣḥaf al-Sharīf ... Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm ibn Yūsuf al-Miṣrī al-Balqāsī bi-qirāwatihi fīhi khatmatan ... fī 25 Dh 1 [probably Rabīʻ Awwal] 67 [1267]."

Translation of the colophon: "This Noble Muṣḥaf was corrected/edited ... by Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm ibn Yūsuf al-Miṣrī al-Balqāsī while reading the entire Book ... on 25 Dh 1 [probably Rabīʻ Awwal] 67 [1267 of the Hijrah = 16 January, 1851]."

record.title: 880-01 al-Qurʼān. -- 1860 or 1861.
record.note: Small calligraphic naskhī, within gold border; ʻunwāns in gold (faded) and colors at the beginning and at end.
Islamic binding, in maroon, gilt, with flap.
Bookplate of William Fowler Hopson.
Colophon: "Kataba al-faqīr ... al-Sayyid Ḥāfiẓ Ḥasan al-Ḥasanī Bakwabjī Zādah min talāmīz [talāmīdh] al-Sayyid Bī Bāshā Zādah ... sanat sabʻ wa-sabʻīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf."

Translation of the colophon: "Written by the poor ... al-Sayyid Ḥāfiẓ Ḥasan al-Ḥasanī Bakwabjī Zādah, a student of al-Sayyid Bī Bāshā Zādah ... in the year 1277 [of the Hijrah = 1860/1861]."

record.title: 880-01 al-Qurʼān. -- 1812.
record.note: Calligraphic Turkish hand; elaborate ʻunwāns at the beginning, smaller decorations in gold and colors elsewhere; text within gilt border.
Islamic binding, in brown, with deeply impressed ʻunwāns, with flap; gilt edges.
Colophon: "Katabahu al-Ḥājj Aḥmad al-Nūrī wa-huwa min talāmīdh al-Ḥājj ʻAbd al-Raḥmān Afandī wa-al-Ḥājj al-Shaykh Maḥmūd Afandī ... sanat 1227."

Translation of the Colophon: "Copied by al-Ḥājj Aḥmad al-Nūrī, a student of al-Ḥājj ʻAbd al-Raḥmān Afandī and al-Ḥājj al-Shaykh Maḥmūd Afandī ... in the year 1227 [of the Hijrah = 1812]."

record.title: 880-01 Ṣalawāt. -- 1634 or 1635.
record.note: Calligraphic naskhī, in red and black; ʻunwāns in gold and colors.
Islamic binding, velvet covered, with flap.
Colophon: "Kata[bahu] al-faqīr ... Darwīsh Aḥmad al-maʻrūf bi-Qarah Chāwush Zādah ... sanat 1044."
Translation of the colophon: "Copied by the poor ... Darwīsh Aḥmad, known as Qarah Chāwush Zādah ... in the year 1044 [of the Hijrah = 1634/1635]."

record.title: 880-02 al-Qurʼān. -- [16--?].
record.note: Calligraphic hand, in gold, white, red, and black; magnificent ʻunwāns in gold and colors on each page.
Colophon: "Katabahu ... ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Ḥusaynī."
Translation of the colophon: "Copied by ... ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Ḥusaynī."

record.title: 880-03 al-Jāmiʻ al-ṣaḥīḥ / Muḥammad ibn Ismāʻīl al-Bukhārī. -- [1701 or 1702].
record.note: Corpus of traditions.
Hasty naskhī, in red and black.

record.title: 880-01 Majmūʻat ashʻār. -- [18--?].
record.note: Incipit: "Qaṣīdah lil-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Ghanī al-Nābulusī ... Anā al-nūr al-mubīnu wa-lā ukanná ..."
Fair modern (19th century) naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.
Colophon: "Tammat ... ʻalá yad al-faqīr ʻUmar ʻAlī Bālī [?] ..."
Translation of the colophon: "Copied ... by the hand of the poor ʻUmar ʻAlī Bālī [?] ..."

record.title: 880-03 al-Tabṣirah wa-al-tadhkirah fī ʻilm al-Ḥadīth / Zayn al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Raḥīm ibn al-Ḥusayn al-ʻIrāqī. -- 1445.
record.note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ... Yaqūlu rājī Rabbihi al-muqtadiri // ʻAbd al-Raḥīmi ibni al-Ḥusayn al-Atharī. Min baʻdi ḥamdi Allāhi dhī al-ālāʼi // ʻalá imtinānin jalla ʻan iḥṣāʼi ..."
Calligraphic naskhī, in red and black.
Marginalia in the beginning.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.
Colophon: "Najazat ... nahār al-Khamīs, rābiʻ Shaʻbān ... sanat tisʻ wa-arbaʻīn wa-thamān miʼah."
Translation of the colophon: "It was completed ... on Thursday, 4 Shaʻbān ... 849 [of the Hijrah = 14 November, 1445]."

record.title: 880-03 Lawāqiḥ al-anwār fī ṭabaqāt al-akhyār / Nāṣir al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Wahhāb ibn Aḥmad al-Shaʻrānī. -- [17--?].
record.note: Incomplete at end.
The correct title, as above, appears in the incipit, leaf 3 verso; the title on leaf 1 verso reads: Kitāb lawāʼiḥ al-anwār fī ʻilm taʼrīkh ṭabaqāt al-akhyār li-Nāṣir al-Dīn.
Incipit: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī khalaʻa ʻalá awliyāʼihi khulaʻ inʻāmih ..."
Fairly modern (18th century?) calligraphic naskhī, in red and black.

record.title: Creek Indian allotment plat book, [190-].
record.note: Title derived from typed label pasted on front.

record.title: 880-01 al-Qurʼān. -- [17--?].
record.note: Calligraphic naskhī, in red and black; elaborate ʻunwāns in gold and colors.
Lacquered binding, in colors; guard-sheets between leaves, of thin membrane.

record.title: 880-01 al-Qurʼān. -- [17--?].
record.note: Modern (18th century?) calligraphic naskhī, in white and black on a field of gold; elaborate ʻunwāns in gold and colors.
Lacquered binding, in colors.

record.title: 880-02 al-Qurʼān. -- [17--?].
record.note: Modern (18th century?) calligraphic naskhī, in white and black on a field of gold; ʻunwāns in gold and colors.
Islamic bindings, elaborately gilt.
In manuscript on fly-leaves: "W.H. Bradley."

record.title: 880-02 al-Qurʼān : Sūrat al-anʻām. -- 1705 or 1706.
record.note: Calligraphic naskhī; ʻunwāns in gold and colors.
Islamic binding, in brown, gilt, with flap.
Colophon: "Katabahu ... al-Sayyid ʻAbd Allāh, min talāmīdh ʻUthmān al-maʻrūf bi-Ḥāfiẓ al-Qurʼān."

Translation of the colophon: "Copied by ... al-Sayyid ʻAbd Allāh, a student of ʻUthmān who is known as Ḥāfiẓ al-Qurʼān [Memorizer of the Qurʼān] ... in the year 1117 [of the Hijrah = 1705/1706]."

record.title: 880-01 al-Qurʼān. -- [18--?].
record.note: Modern (19th century) naskhī, in red and black; ʻunwāns in colors.

record.title: 880-02 Zahr al-kimām fī qiṣṣat Yūsuf / ʻUmar ibn Ibrāhīm al-Anṣārī al-Awsī. -- [16--?].
record.note: Incipit: "Qāla al-ʻabd al-muftaqir ilá raḥmat Rabbihi ʻUmar ibn Ibrāhīm al-Anṣārī al-Awsī ... al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn ... Iʻlamū, raḥimakum Allāh, inna qiṣaṣ al-anbiyāʼ ... ʻiẓah li-man ittaʻaẓ ..."
Fairly old (17th century?) naskhī, in red and black; ʻunwāns in gold and colors on leaf 1 recto and verso.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.
In pencil on leaf 1 recto: "H.J. Anderson Nov. 16 1847."

record.title: Arabic primer of calligraphy. -- 1697 or 1698.
record.note: Calligraphic naskhī.
Islamic binding, in brown, gilt.
Colophon: "Mashaqqat aḍʻaf al-kuttāb Maḥmūd al-maʻrūf bi-Jalāl al-Dīn ... sanat tisʻ wa-miʼah wa-alf ..."
Translation of the colophon: "The endeavor of the weakest of the calligraphers Maḥmūd, known as Jalāl al-Dīn ... the year 1109 [of the Hijrah = 1697/1698] ..."

record.title: 880-01 Majmūʻat rasāʼil Durzīyah. -- [18--?].
record.note: Calligraphic Druze naskhī, in gold, red, blue, green, and black; fairly modern (19th century).
Islamic binding, in red, with flap.

record.title: Receipt-certificates relating to a grain-warehouse. -- 1833.
record.note: Hasty hands; with stamp-impressions.

record.title: 880-01 Kitāb ṣalāt al-aghrabanīyāt wa-tartīb afāshīn al-saḥarīyāt wa-khidmat asrār al-quddās li-iḥtiyāj al-kāhin wa-al-shammās / taʼlīf Yūḥannā ... wa ... Bāsīliyūs ... wa-al-Bruwījiyāsmānā al-mansūb ilá ... Gharīghūriyūs. -- [18--?].
record.note: Known as: Ṣalāt al-aghrabanīyāt wa-al-saḥarīyāt.
Cf. British Museum catalog of printed Arabic books, for identification of contents.
Incipit: "Ṣalāt al-aghrabniyā. Yaʼtī al-kāhin wa-al-shammās wa-yantaṣibān amāma al-abwāb al-muqaddasah makshūfayn [makshūfay] al-ruʼūs ..."
Modern (19th century) cursive naskhī.
With: 1 other title.

record.title: 880-01 Kitāb al-ʻAẓamah min kutub al-dafāʼin min kutub Dāniyāl. -- [18--?].
record.note: Title in manuscript: Kitāb al-ʻAẓamah; the complete title taken from: Hitti, 778.
Presumably not Kitāb al-ʻAẓamah of Ibn Abī al-Dunyā (Brockelmann I:154).
Incipit: "Min hunā awwal al-mawjūd min hādhā al-kitāb. Dhālika al-mawḍiʻ wa-maʻahu jamāʻah min talāmīdhihi, wa-kāna ʻiddatuhum arbaʻīn kātiban ..."

"... Qāla ʻAbd Allāh ibn Sallām: Yā Amīr al-Muʼminīn, waqaʻa fī yadī kitāb min kutub al-dafāʼin min kutub Dānīyāl ... wajadtu fīhi jamīʻ mā khalaqa Allāh taʻālá bi-qudratih ʻalá kull shayʼ ..."
Modern (19th century) cursive naskhī.
With: 1 other title.
Colophon: "Tamma Kitāb al-ʻAẓamah."
Translation of the colophon: "Kitāb al-ʻAẓamah is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Majmūʻat al-rasāʼil / ʻAlī ibn Sulṭān Muḥammad al-Qārī al-Ḥanafī. -- 1724.
record.note: Seventeen theological tracts.
In manuscript on lining paper: "M. Sprengling, The University of Chicago, Dec. 4, 1937."
Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī khalaqa al-kāʼināt ʻalá hayʼāt mutabayyināt ..."
Fair naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.

Colophon: "Qad waqaʻa min tatimmat Rasāʼil ... ʻAlī al-Qāriʼ ... ʻalá yad ... Ibrāhīm al-Muḥammadī bi-al-shahīr [al-shahīr] bi-Kātib ibn Muqsin Aḥmad Katkhadā Mustaḥfiẓān ... bi-tārīkh sābiʻ ʻishrīn Dhī al-Ḥijjah, ʻām sittah wa-thalāthīn wa-miʼah wa-alf ... bi-Miṣr al-maḥrūsah ..."

Translation of the colophon: "The Rasāʼil [Tracts] ... of ʻAlī al-Qāriʼ were completed ... by the hand of ... Ibrāhīm al-Muḥammadī, known as Kātib ibn Muqsin Aḥmad Katkhadā Mustaḥfiẓān ... on 27 Dhī al-Ḥijjah, 1136 [of the Hijrah = 16 September, 1724] ... in protected Egypt ..."

record.title: 880-02 al-Nutaf al-ḥisān fī al-fiqh ʻalá madhhab Abī Ḥanīfah al-Nuʻmān / lil-Shaykh al-Imām al-zāhid Abī Bakr al-Wāsiṭī. -- [17--?].
record.note: In manuscript on lining paper: "M. Sprengling, Dec. 4, 1937. Purchased from O. Reşer, Ankara."
Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻAlamīn ... Kitāb al-miyāh. Iʻlam, arshadaka Allāh, inna al-māʼ ʻalá wajhayn, muṭlaq wa-muqayyad ..."
Fairly modern (18th century?) naskhī, in red and black.
Marginalia.
Islamic binding, in black, with flap.

record.title: 880-02 Risālah fī rasm kalimat ibn / taʼlīf Ibrāhīm ibn Salīm. -- 1927.
record.note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻAlamīn ... Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi Risālah fī rasm kalimat ibn ḥarrartuhā infādhan li-amr ... al-Duktūr Qārl Sūshāʼim ..."
Modern cursive hand.

record.title: 880-02 Baḥth al-maṭālib wa-ḥathth al-ṭālib / Jabrāʼīl ibn Farḥāt al-Ḥalabī al-Mārūnī. -- [18--?].
record.note: Arabic grammar.
Incipit: "Bi-ism al-Āb wa-al-Ibn wa-al-Rūḥ al-Quds ilāh wāḥid. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī aṣlaḥa bi-kalimatihi al-anfus al-mukhtallah ..."
Good modern (19th century) naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap, in slip-case.
With: 2 other titles.

record.title: 880-01 Iʻrāb amthilat Kitāb Baḥth al-maṭālib. -- [18--?].
record.note: Good modern (19th century) naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap, in slip-case.
With: 2 other titles.

record.title: 880-02 Faṣl maʻqūd fī ʻawāmil al-iʻrāb / Jirmānūs Farḥāt. -- [18--?].
record.note: Arabic grammar.
Also known as: al-Faṣl al-maʻqūd fī maʻānī ʻawāmil al-iʻrāb.
Good modern (19th century) naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap, in slip-case.
With: 2 other titles.

record.title: 880-02 Baḥth al-maṭālib wa-ḥathth al-ṭālib / Jabrāʼīl ibn Farḥāt al-Ḥalabī al-Mārūnī. -- [18--?].
record.note: Arabic grammar.
Incipit: "Bi-ism al-Āb wa-al-Ibn wa-al-Rūḥ al-Quds al-Ilāh al-Wāḥid. Āmīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī aṣlaḥa bi-kalimatihi al-anfus al-mukhtallah ..."
Fair modern (19th century) naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in brown.

record.title: 880-03 al-Muqaddimah al-Ājurrūmīyah / Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Dāwūd al-Ṣanhājī al-Ājurrūmī. -- 1873.
record.note: Arabic grammar.
Title from: Brockelmann, II, 237.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ... Qāla al-Shaykh ... Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Dāwūd al-Ṣinhājī al-Ājurrūmī ... al-Kalām huwa al-lafẓ al-murakkab al-mufīd bi-al-waḍʻ ..."
Good Maghribī hand, in red, blue, green, yellow, and black.
Colophon: "Kamula ... fī 6 Rajab, sanat 1290 ..."
