On folio 1a of volume IV: A collation statement: "Kutubia hādhā al-juzʼ bi-kāmilihi min nuskhat (?) al-muṣannif bi-khaṭṭihi wa-qūbila (?) ʻalayhi ḥasba al-ṭāqah (?) wa-al-imkān (?) fa-ṣaḥḥa (?) wa-lillāh (?) al-ḥamd, wa-kadhālika al-juzʼ alladhī qablahu (?) wa-alladhī qablahu wa-qablahu ..."
Script: Good naskhī, in red and black.
Binding: In dark brown leather, Type II (with flap); covers embossed with central medallion; covers heavily deteriorated; parts of the flaps missing; many wormholes.
Other volumes wanting.
Decoration: Rubricated.

Colophon of volume II: "Najaza al-Juzʼ al-thānī min Kitāb al-Nikāḥ bi-ḥamdi Allāh wa-mannihi, yatlūhu fī al-juzʼ al-thālith min Kitāb al-Nikāḥ, in shāʼa Allāh taʻālá, Bāb al-ʻAdad, wa-dhālika ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá ʻafw Mawlāh, al-ghanī bi-hi ʻamman siwāh, ʻĪsá ibn Ayyūb ibn Yūsuf al-Bakrī al-Shāfiʻī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-li-man naẓara fīhi wa-daʻā la-hu bi-al-tawbah wa-al-maghfirah wa-bulūgh āmālih fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah wa-riḍā Allāh taʻālá wa-al-fawz bi-al-naẓar ilá wajhihi al-karīm wa-al-najāh min al-Jaḥīm wa-sukná Jannāt al-Naʻīm, wa-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn, wa-dhālika fī khāmis ʻishrīn Ṣafar, sanat khams wa-sabʻi miʼah [24 September 1305] bi-majlis al-ḥukm bi-al-Ḥusaynīyah."

To the left of the colophon of volume II: A collation statement: "Balagha muqābalatan min awwalihi ilá ākhirihi ʻalá nuskhat al-muṣannif bi-khaṭṭihi bi-yadihi ḥasba al-ṭāqah fa-ṣaḥḥa wa-lillāh al-ḥamd."

Colophon of volume IV: "Wa-qad najaza sharḥ masāʼil al-bāb, wa-huwa ākhir al-kitāb, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá mā awlá, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ fī al-ākhirah wa-al-ūlá. Wa-kāna al-farāgh minhu fī al-yawm al-mubārak, wa-huwa yawm al-Jumʻah, ghurrat shahr Dhī al-Qaʻdah, aḥad shuhūr sanat sitt wa-sabʻ miʼah [13 May 1307, wa-dhālika bi-majlis al-ḥukm al-ʻazīz al-Shāfiʻī, bi-Bāb al-Futūḥ bi-al-Qāhirah al-maḥrūsah, ḥarasahā Allāh wa-sāʼir bilād al-Muslimīn. ʻAllaqahu li-nafsihi, thumma li-man shāʼa Allāh la-hu min baʻdihi, al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá ʻafwi Mawlāhi, al-ghanī bi-hi ʻamman siwāhu, ʻĪsá ibn Ayyūb ibn Yūsuf al-Bakrī nasaban, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, al-Bibāwī baladan, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayh, wa-li-man naẓara fīhi wa-daʻā la-hu bi-al-tawbah wa-al-maghfirah wa-riḍā Allāh taʻālá wa-al-fawz bi-Dār al-Naʻīm wa-al-najāh min nār al-Jaḥīm wa-al-tamattuʻ bi-al-naẓar ilá wajhihi al-karīm, wa-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Wa-ṣalawātuhu ʻalá Muḥammad khātim al-nabīyīn, wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi, wa-ʻitratihi ajmaʻīn, ilá Yawm al-Dīn."

To the left of the colophon of volume IV: A Collation statement: "Kutiba hādhā al-juzʼ min khaṭṭ al-muṣannif ḥasba al-ṭāqah fa-ṣaḥḥa wa-lillāh al-ḥamd wa-al-minnah, wa-kadhālika al-juzʼ alladhī qablahu wa-alladhī qabla qablihi."

record.title: 880-03 Sirr al-ṣināʻah : manuscript / taʼlīf ... Abī al-Fatḥ ʻUthmān ibn Jinnī.
record.note: Copied in A.H. 662 (A.D. 1264).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rasamta, aṭāla Allāh baqāka wa-aḥsana imtāʻ al-ʻilm wa-ahlihi bika, fa-innaka, bi-ḥamd Allāh, mā zilata jamālan la-hu wa-lahum, wa-waqfan ʻalayhi wa-ʻalayhim, in aẓlama shiqqun minhu kunta lahum fīhi sirājan, aw ṭamusa manārun la-hu wujidta ilayhi minhājan, aw qaʻada ghayruka ʻanhu qumta bi-aʻbāʼihi murāmiyan ʻan ḥawzatihi min amāmihi wa-warāʼihi ..."
On folio 1a: "Kitāb Sirr ṣināʻat al-iʻrāb, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām al-awḥad Abī al-Fatḥ ʻUthmān ibn Jinnī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá wa-nafaʻa bi-ʻulūmihi fī al-dārayn. Āmīn."
Script: Fair naskhī. Leaf 1 supplied in a later hand.
Binding: In brown leather, Type II (with flap); cover and flap embossed with central medallion.

Author's colophon: "Hādhā ākhir kitābinā al-mawsūm bi-Sirr al-ṣināʻah, wa-narjū an yakūna Allāh ... subḥānuhu qad waffaqanā fīhi lil-ṣawāb wa-lam yadhhab binā wa-bi-hi ʻan ṭuruq al-rashād, wa-ʻinda Allāh naḥtasibu mā awdaʻnāhu, wa-īyāhu nastarʻī maḥāsinahu wa-badāʼiʻahu mā tasammaḥnā bi-hi fa-ḍammannāh, innahu kāfīnā wa-ʻalayhi tawakkulunā. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá khīratihi min khalqihi, Muḥammad al-Nabī, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-azwājihi, wa-Huwa ḥasbunā wa-niʻma al-wakīl."

Copyist's colophon: "Anhāhu naskhan bi-jumlatihi al-ʻabd al-ḍaʻīf al-faqīr ilá raḥmat Allāh ʻAbd al-Khāliq ibn Aḥmad ibn Ḥamīd al-Shāfiʻī al-Ṣarkhadī bukrata nahār al-Aḥad al-mubārak fī al-ʻishr al-awsaṭ min Rabīʻ al-Awwal, min sanat ithnayn wa-sittīn wa-sittimiʼah [20 January 1264], ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-li-mashāyikhihi, wa-li-man istansakhahu, wa-lil-nāẓir fīhi, wa-li-jamīʻ Ummat Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi."

record.title: 880-03 Kitāb al-Ashribah wa-dhikr ikhtilāf al-nās fīhā : manuscript / taʼlīf Abī Muḥammad ʻAbd Allāh ibn Muslim ibn Qutaybah.
record.note: Copied from a manuscript in the Khedivial library, Cairo in A.H. 1309 (A.D. 1892).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Ashribah wa-dhikr ikhtilāf al-nās fīhā taʼlīf Abī Muḥammad ʻAbd Allāh ibn Muslim ibn Qutaybah, ʻafá Allāh taʻālá ʻanhu. Āmīn. M.M. Riwāyat al-Ḥusayn ibn Muẓaffar ibn Aḥmad ibn Kundāj ʻan Abī Muḥammad ʻAbd Allāh ibn Jaʻfar ibn Durustawayh al-Naḥwī ʻan Abī Ṭāhir Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Bayyiʻ."

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Akhbaranā al-Shaykh Abū Ṭāhir Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Bayyiʻ fīmā adhina lanā an narwiyahu ʻanhu, qāla akhbaranā Abū ʻAbd Allāh al-Ḥusayn ibn al-Muẓaffar ibn Kundāj al-Bazzāz qirāʼatan ʻalayhi, qāla akhbaranā Abū Muḥammad ʻAbd Allāh ibn Jaʻfar ibn Durustawayh al-Naḥwī qirāʼatan ʻalayhi qāla: Qāla Abū Muḥammad ʻAbd Allāh ibn Muslim ibn Qutaybah al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī hadānā li-dīnihi al-murtaḍá ..."
Script: Calligraphic naskhī, in red and black.
Binding: Modern library binding.
Decoration: Rubricated.

Colophon: "Tamma Kitāb al-Ashribah wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá ashraf al-mursalīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Tamm. Balagha muqābalatan jayyidah. Muḥammad Aḥmad al-Khūjah. Nuqila min nuskhat al-aṣl min al-Kutubkhānah al-Khudaywīyah al-Miṣrīyah al-kāʼinah bi-Sarāy Darb al-Jamāmīz al-maḥmīyah, numrah 166 majāmīʻ, fī yawm al-Ithnayn, 29 Shaʻbān, sanat 1309 Hijrīyah, al-muwāfiq 28 Mārth, sanat 1892 Milādīyah, ʻalá yad al-faqīr ilá Rabbihi al-Ghanī, Muḥammad al-Laythī, ghufira la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi."

record.title: Kitāb fuṣūl al-tamāthīl fī tabāshīr al-surūr / taʾlīf Abī al-ʻAbbās ʻAbd Allāh ibn al-Muʻtazz. -- 1892.

Fair nastaʻlīq, in red and black.
Copious diagrams.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.

record.note: Leaves numbered 89-167; loose notes, 1 leaf, inserted between leaves 87-88 (numbered 91-92).
Fair nastaʻlīq, in red and black.
Copious diagrams.

record.note: Good naskhī, in red and black.

record.note: Title according to Berlin catalog; given in the explicit as: al-Ḥāshiyah.
Fair naskhī, in red and black.
Loose in Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.

record.title: Dhikr kalām al-nās fī manbaʻ al-Nīl wa-makhrajihi wa-ziyādatih. -- 1655.
record.note: Not identical with Fī manbaʻ al-Nīl (Brockelmann, S III, p. 1255) of al-Akfahsī (d. 1405), since this work mentions events which occurred much later (cf. leaf 62 recto, where mention is made of the year A.H. 897, and of Jalāl al-Dīn al-Suyūṭī).
On leaf 8 recto is a map of the Mountain of the Moon and of the source of the Nile.
Fair naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.

record.title: Tarjīḥ asālīb al-Qurʾān ʻalá asālīb al-Yūnān fī uṣūl al-adyān / Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm ibn al-Wazīr. -- 1703.
record.note: Fair Yemenite naskhī.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.
With: 1 other title.

record.note: Fair Yemenite naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.
With: 1 other title.

record.title: Mukhtaṣar akhbār al-ḥurūb al-nāshiʾah min Ghāliyā wa-al-mumtaddah ilá sāʾir Afrūbā. -- 1819.
record.note: Good naskhī.

record.title: al-Fatāwá al-ʻadlīyah / Rasūl ibn Ṣāliḥ al-Āydīnī. -- 1861.

record.title: al-ʻAdad al-maʻdūd fī al-muḥāḍarāt / Zakarīyā ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Marāghī. -- [14--?].
record.note: Coarse old (15th century?) naskhī; leaves 1 and 8 in a later hand.

record.title: Talkhīṣ al-Jāmiʻ al-kabīr / Muḥammad ibn ʻAbbād al-Khilāṭī. -- [17--?].
record.note: Fairly modern (18th century?) hand, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in red.

record.title: Ghawth al-jadīb al-hālik bi-ghayth al-mujīr al-mālik. -- 1651.
record.note: The title, as above, appears on leaf 6 recto; the title, in a later hand, on leaf 1 recto (Mukhtaṣar Kawkab al-rawḍah), is evidently an error; al-Suyūṭī's Kawkab al-rawḍah (cf. Landberg MSS 202) is an entirely different work.
Title also given as (colophon): al-Risālah al-Fayyūmīyah.
Fair naskhī, in red and black.
Loose in Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.

record.title: Dīwān / ʻAbd al-Ḥayy ibn Abī Bakr ibn ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Sulaymī. -- [before 1714].
record.note: For the author's death date see Berlin catalog, index.
Fair naskhī, in red and black.
Leaves 3-11 with ornamental colored borders.
Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.

record.title: al-Tanwīr fī isqāṭ al-tadbīr / Tāj al-Dīn Abū al-Faḍl Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Karīm ibn ʻAṭāʾ Allāh al-Iskandarī. -- 1443.
record.note: Fair naskhī, in red and black; leaves 1-29, 119-128 supplied in a later hand.
Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.

record.title: Farāʾid al-fawāʾid wa-taʻāruḍ al-qawlayn li-mujtahid wāḥid / Ṣadr al-Dīn Muḥammad al-Sulamī. -- [14--?].
record.note: The colophon, dated A.H. 660, is chronologically impossible and is therefore fictitious.
The manuscript in Alexandria, dated A.H. 792 (A.D. 1390), was copied while the author was yet living (also cf. Brockelmann).
Fair 15th century naskhī, in red and black.
Loose in Islamic binding, in black, flap missing.

record.title: Tuḥfat al-anām fī faḍāʾil Dimashq al-Shām / Jalāl al-Dīn [Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad] al-Buṣrawī [ibn al-Imām]. -- [17--?].
record.note: Modern (18th century) naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.

record.title: Shawākil al-ḥūr fī sharḥ Hayākil al-nūr / Muḥammad ibn Asʻad al-Dawwānī. -- 1538.
record.note: A note by a later hand on leaf 1 recto calls this the first juzʾ, but the text seems complete.
Hasty hand, partly unpointed; some leaves supplied by another, smaller hand.
Islamic binding, paper covered.

record.title: al-Risālah al-nūrīyah fī al-amrāḍ al-ḍurūrīyah / Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm ibn al-Akfānī. -- [1700?].
record.note: The explicit of the Risālah (leaf 53 verso) states that the Maqālah fī al-faṣd will be followed by Natījat al-fikar fī ʻilāj al-baṣar (cf. Brockelmann, S II, p. 170, the Natījat al-fikar fī ʻilāj amrāḍ al-bashar of Aḥmad al-Qaysī?). The latter however is now missing.
The colophon on leaf 53 verso, dated A.H. 770(?) (A.D. 1369) is evidently that of the author.
Small hasty hand, in red and black. Leaf 60 supplied in a later hand.
Islamic binding, paper covered.

record.title: al-Ṣaḥīfah al-kāmilah. -- [17--?].
record.note: Compared with the 1845 lithographed edition.
Calligraphic naskhī, in black and gold, within gold line borders; Persian translation in red.
18th century(?) hand.
Leaves numbered 1-149, but 43 is repeated.
Islamic binding, in black.

record.title: al-Nujūm al-shāriqāt fī dhikr baʻḍ al-ṣanāʾiʻ al-muḥtāj ilayhā fī ʻilm al-mīqāt / Muḥammad ibn Abī al-Khayr al-Urmayūnī. -- 1715.
record.note: Fair naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.

record.title: al-Tuḥfah al-madanīyah fī ḥall mushkilāt Sharḥ al-Nukhbah al-fikarīyah / Ghaḍanfar ibn Jaʻfar. -- 1594.
record.note: On the author cf. Brockelmann, S I, p. 469.
C. Landberg misread the date A.H. 1200; the Manchester manuscript of the same author's commentary on the Burdah (Mingana 471) is dated 1589 (Brockelmann, S I, p. 469).
For Nukhbat al-fikar see Brockelmann, II, 68.
The Sharḥ al-Nukhbah is presumably Ibn Ḥajar's own.
Small hasty hand, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.

record.title: al-Misk al-adhfar fī nashr mazāyā rijāl al-qarn al-thānī ʻashar wa-al-thālith ʻashar / Maḥmūd Shukrī al-Ālūsī. -- 1887.
record.note: Fair nastaʻlīq, in blue and red.

record.title: Kitāb fī al-ḥadīth. -- [15--?].
record.note: The title, as above, supplied by a later hand on leaf 1 recto.
Fairly modern (16th century?) calligraphic naskhī, in black and gold.
Islamic binding, in brown.

record.title: Tuḥfat al-bararah fī al-masāʾil al-ʻasharah / Sharaf ibn Muʾayyad al-Baghdādī. -- 1585.
record.note: Fair naskhī.
Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.

record.title: Rātib sayyidinā al-imām Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Mahdī al-Muntaẓar. -- 1886.
record.note: In manuscript on title-page: "Imprimé à Umdurman, capitale du Mahdi, vis à vis de Khartoûm. Donné par le Mahdi lui-même à un espion du gouvernement egyptien qui demeura longtemps avec le Mahdi sans être reconnu. Ce livre est d'une rareté extraordinaire et le Mahdi ne l'á donné qu'à des plus fidèles partisans. Je l'ai acheté à l'espion susnommé lors de son retour au Caire. C. de Landberg. Caire Nov. 1890".

record.title: ʻUnwān al-sharaf al-wāfī fī al-fiqh wa-al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-taʾrīkh wa-al-naḥw wa-ʻilm al-qawāfī / Ismāʻīl ibn Abī Bakr ibn al-Muqrī. -- [1800?].
record.note: Modern (ca. 1800) Yemenite naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.

record.title: Thabt asānīd / Jamāl al-Dīn Yūsuf ibn Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī. -- [1800?].
record.note: The author is presumably the same as listed in Brockelmann, S II, p. 947; evidently the son of Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī (ca. 1423-ca. 1520).
C. Landberg gave the date of the author's death as A.H. 984 (A.D. 1576 or 7).
Fair naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.

record.note: Fair naskhī, in red and black. With diagrams.

record.title: ʻUyūn al-ḥikāyāt / Abū al-Faraj ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn ʻAlī ibn al-Jawzī. -- 1731.

Fair naskhī.

record.title: Waṣīyah / ʻAbd Allāh ibn Aḥmad ibn Qudāmah. -- 1731.

record.title: Kitāb al-adhkiyāʾ / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn ʻAlī ibn al-Jawzī. -- 1731.
record.note: Fair naskhī.

record.note: P. Brönnle interpreted the colophon date as A.D. 1763, but this seems hardly likely; the scribe ends with an eulogy of Muḥammad, and is evidently a Muslim.

record.note: The first word of the title is variously given as: al-ibāḥah, al-bāḥah, al-lāḥah, or al-rāḥah.

record.note: The colophon-date, A.H. 1063 (A.D. 1653) appears to be that of the manuscript from which this copy was made (i.e. that of the prototype, not of composition; cf. Landberg MSS 388, which was copied in 1639).
Good modern (19th century) naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.

record.title: Jamʻ al-muhimmāt li-ḥall alfāẓ Natījat al-mīqāt / Muḥammad ibn Ramaḍān al-Marzūqī. -- 1847.
record.note: For the author cf. Brockelmann, S III, p. 1309-9.

The author's name is given in the original colophon, where the date of completion of the work is given as 1st Shaʻbān A.H. 1236 (A.D. 1821); the date of the composition of the Natījah is given on leaf 87 verso as A.H. 1235 (A.D. 1819 or 20).
The incipit states that the author of the Natījah was the author's brother.
Coarse naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.

record.title: Ṭabaqāt al-khawāṣṣ ahl al-ṣidq wa-al-ikhlāṣ / Aḥmad ibn Aḥmad al-Sharjī al-Zabīdī. -- [18--?]-1848.

record.title: Ḥadā’iḳ el-Ḥaḳā’iḳ.
record.note: Title assigned by cataloger. Spine title: Z̲eyl-i Şeḳāʼiḳ (ذيل الشقائق). Fore-edge title: Z̲eyl-i Şeḳāʼiḳ Devlet-i Selāṭīn-i Meḥmed Hān (ذيل الشقائق دولت سلاطين محمد).
Colophon indicates manuscript was copied by Es-Seyyid Ḥasan Burhānzāde (السيد السيد حسن برهانزاده) (f. 82b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.
Layout: Single columns of 25 lines. Catchword on each verso.
Script: Naskh.
Binding: Flap binding, quarter-bound in brown leather, gold-tooled marbled paper over paper pasteboards.
Decoration: Illuminated headpiece; rubrication.
Contemporary foliation starts at text opening, with modern f. 3b numbered 1, f. 4a numbered 2, f. 5a numbered 3, and so on.
Contemporary annotations of title and scribe name in different hands (f. 1a).
Accompanying material: bibliographical note (1 leaf).

record.title: ʻAjāʾib al-makhlūqāt wa-gharāʾib al-mawjūdāt : al-juzʾ al-awwal / Ismāʻīl ibn Aḥmad ibn al-Athīr. -- [13--?].

Fair 18th century naskhī, in red and black.
ʻUnwān in gold and colors on leaf 1 recto; gold borders.

record.title: Tuḥfat al-sāʼil fī ajwibat al-masāʼil / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-ʻAbbāsī. -- 1856.
record.note: Calligraphic naskhī, in red, blue, and black.
ʻUnwān in colors on leaf 1 verso.

record.title: Mukhtaṣar Naẓm al-sulūk / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad al-Bisṭāmī. -- 1815.
record.note: For the author see Brockelmann, II, 231.

C. Landberg's card referred to Ḥājjī Khalīfah, VI, 360, where there is listed a Naẓm al-sulūk fī waʻẓ al-mulūk, by Abū Bakr Muḥammad ibn ʻĪsá ibn al-Lubānah al-Lakhmī al-Andalusī, d. A.H. 507 (not in Brockelmann).
On leaf 28 verso the date of composition is given as A.H. 909, which must be an error. The date A.H. 999 on leaf 82 recto is part of a prophecy and is therefore legitimate.
Cf. Naẓm al-sulūk fī tawārīkh al-khulafāʾ wa-al-mulūk attributed to Ibn ʻAsākir (Brockelmann, S II, p. 24).
Coarse naskhī, in red and black.

record.title: al-Bayān wa-al-iʻrāb ʻammā bi-arḍ Miṣr min al-Aʻrāb / Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī al-Maqrīzī. -- [18--?].
record.note: Modern (19th century) naskhī.

record.title: al-Nafaḥāt al-sanīyah fī al-maʾāthir al-ʻInānīyah / Aḥmad ibn Basyūnī. -- 1881.
record.note: C. Landberg's card calls this holograph; but there seems to be no evidence that the "kātib (scribe)" Aḥmad Manṣūr is the same person as the author.

The colophon date, 22d Muḥarram 1297, cannot be correct, since according to leaves 27 verso-28 recto, al-ʻInānī died on the 21st Rajab 1297; 1297 in the colophon is therefore presumably an error for 1299.
Fair naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.

record.title: al-Naṣāʾiḥ al-mawjūdah fī bayān al-shiyam al-maḥmūdah / al-Ḥasan ibn Rashīq al-ʻAskarī. -- [17--?].
record.note: Modern (18th century?) naskhī; several leaves at the beginning and at end in another cursive hand.
Islamic binding, in brown.

record.title: Sharḥ mā ashkala min alfāẓ al-Yamīnī / Shihāb al-Dīn Nāṣiḥ ibn Ẓafar al-Jarbādhaqānī. -- [before 1597 or 8].
record.note: For the author see Brockelmann, I, 314; S I, p. 548.
C. Landberg refers to Ḥājjī Khalīfah, VI, 515; there mention is made only of al-Jarbādhaqānī's Persian translation of al-Kitāb al-Yamīnī.
Fair naskhī, scantily pointed, in red and black.
Loose in Islamic binding, in brown.

record.note: Calligraphic naskhī, fully vocalized.
Loose in Islamic binding, with flap.

The incipit is the same as in Hitti 200, where the work is ascribed to ʻAbd al-Laṭīf ibn Yūsuf al-Baghdādī (cf. Brockelmann, S I, p. 487); perhaps it is the same work.

Fair naskhī, in red and black.

record.title: al-Shams ʻalá Janāḥ [al-]ṭāʾir fī maqām al-wāqif [wa-]al-sāʾir / ʻAbd al-Ghanī ibn Ismāʻīl al-Nābulusī. -- 1731 or 2.

record.note: Fair naskhī.

record.title: al-Tadhkirah al-fākhirah bi-aḥwāl al-ākhirah / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ... al-Suḥaymī. -- [after 1741].
record.note: The colophon-date, A.H. [11]54 (A.D. 1741) is presumably that of composition.
Claims to be a holograph, but the handwriting seems to be not similar to that of Landberg MSS 109 (holograph by al-Suḥaymī).
Fair naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.

record.title: Ṣafwat al-madhhab min Nihāyat al-maṭlab : al-juzʾ al-thānī / ʻAbd Allāh ibn Muḥammad ibn Abī ʻAṣrūn. -- [12--?].
record.note: Brockelmann omits "Abī" in the author's name; cf. the autograph of vol. I, Bankipore catalog, XIX, 2, no. 1822, where also is found the spelling "min" (not "fi") in the title.
The Bankipore manuscript has 33 lines per page, and the measurements are somewhat smaller than this manuscript, so presumably this is not a holograph.
Old (13th century?) naskhī, for the most part entirely unpointed.
Loose in Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.
Badly water-stained, faded, and corroded in part.

record.title: al-Ḥāshiyah al-wāqiʻah ʻalá al-masʾalah al-shaʻīrīyah / Aḥmad ibn Ḥaydar. -- [18--?].
record.note: For the author see Brockelmann, S II, p. 291.
In the explicit, the title reads: al-Ḥāshiyah al-wāqiʻah ʻalá al-amthilah al-shaʻīrīyah.
Modern (19th century) naskhī, in red and black.

record.title: al-Iṣābah fī tamyīz al-ṣaḥābah : al-juzʾ al-rābiʻ / Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī ibn Ḥajar al-ʻAsqalānī. -- 1763.
record.note: The title on leaf 1 recto reads: al-Iṣābah fī asmāʾ al-ṣaḥābah.
Fair naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.
Other volumes wanting.

record.note: The title on leaf 1 recto reads: al-Jalīs al-anīs fī taḥrīm al-khandarīs.
Modern (19th century) cursive hand, in red and black.

record.note: Fair naskhī, in red and black. Leaf 1 supplied in a later hand.

record.title: Miftāḥ al-jafr wa-miṣbāḥ al-nūr al-lāmiʻ / Kamāl al-Dīn Abū Sālim Muḥammad ibn Ṭalḥah. -- [15--?].
record.note: On leaf 2 verso the title is given as: al-Durr al-munaẓẓam fī al-sirr al-aʻẓam.
The title on leaf 1 recto (Sharḥ al-Miftāḥ al-jāmiʻ wa-al-nūr al-lāmiʻ, attributed to ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Bisṭāmī) is evidently erroneous.
In the Berlin manuscript, al-Bisṭāmī has contributed a postscript to this work.
Fair naskhī (ca. 1500?), in red and black.
Copious colored miniatures and diagrams.
Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.

record.title: Ghirbāl al-zamān / al-Ḥusayn ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn al-Ahdal. -- 1589.
record.note: For the author cf. Brockelmann, S II, p. 238.
Fair naskhī, in red and black; ʻunwān in gold on leaf 1 verso.

Fair Yemenite naskhī, in red and black.

record.title: [Juzʾ fī ṣawm Ramaḍān] / Aḥmad ibn ʻUmar al-Anṣārī. -- [13--?].
record.note: The author signs himself on leaf 1 recto as: Aḥmad ibn ʻUmar al-Anṣārī; "Ibn al-Mulaqqin" was supplied on the Landberg card (son of ʻUmar ibn al-Mulaqqin, Brockelmann, II, 92).
Good naskhī, in red and black.

record.title: Rawḥ al-rūḥ fī mā ḥadatha baʻda al-miʾah al-tāshiʻah min al-fitan wa-al-futūḥ / ʻĪsá ibn Luṭf Allāh ibn Rasūl Allāh. -- 1733.
record.note: Berlin catalog 9743 says that the terminus and quem is A.H. 1039, but Brockelmann and British Museum Suppl. 590 have 1029.
Good Yemenite naskhī.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.

record.title: Taʾrīkh thaghr ʻAdan / Abū Makhramah al-Ṭayyib ibn ʻAbd Allāh. -- 1875.
record.note: Fair Yemenite naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.

record.title: Nuzhat al-nufūs wa-al-abdān fī taʾrīkh al-zamān / ʻAlī ibn Dāʾūd al-Khaṭīb al-Jawharī ibn al-Ṣayrafī. -- 1877.
record.note: Title written also on lining-paper, in a later hand.
Good naskhī.

record.title: al-Durar al-farāʾid al-munaẓẓamah fī akhbār al-ḥajj wa-ṭarīq Makkah al-muʻaẓẓamah / ʻAbd al-Qādir ibn Muḥammad al-Jazīrī. -- [18--?].
record.note: Good modern (19th century) naskhī.

record.title: Tuḥfat al-aḥbāb wa-bughyat al-ṭullāb / Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Sakhāwī. -- [18--?].
record.note: Modern (19th century) naskhī.

record.title: ʻUqūd al-jumān fī akhbār al-zamān / Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Shāṭibī. -- [18--?].
record.note: The work is sometimes wrongly ascribed to Aḥmad al-Maqqarī.
Alternate title: al-Jumān fī mukhtaṣar akhbār al-zamān.
Modern (19th century) naskhī.

record.title: Sharḥ al-sunnah : Kitāb al-faḍāʾil / al-Ḥusayn ibn Masʻūd al-Baghawī. -- [14--?].
record.note: Title also given (leaf 132 recto) as: Kitāb faḍāʾil al-ṣaḥābah.
Old (15th century?) calligraphic naskhī, in red and black, fully vocalized.
Loose in Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.
Other volumes wanting.

record.title: [Amthāl al-ʻArab]. -- [18--?].
record.note: On Abū ʻUbayd's work cf. Brockelmann, I, 107; S I, p. 166.
Good modern (19th century) naskhī, in red, blue, and black.
Islamic binding, in red.

record.title: [Rasāʾil] / Muḥammad al-Mahdī ibn ʻAbd Allāh. -- [after 1885].
record.note: "Registre des lettres et proclamations du Mahdi qui se trouvent dans [ce] manuscrit"; 4 leaves, in C. Landberg's hand, in pocket, inside front cover.
Leaves numbered as pp. 1-503 (not counting the first page; pp. 495-503 are blank except for page-numbers).
Imperfect: pp. 252-351 wanting.
Fair Sudanese hand, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in red, with flap.

Cf. JAOS, 31(1911), 368-69, from where it would seem that C. Landberg's original manuscript 543 (a volume of "170 Seiten") is now in the Egyptian Intelligence Office in Cairo and that it was captured at the battle of Toski in 1889.

record.title: [Tafsīr al-Qurʼān]. -- [before 1276].
record.note: C. Landberg ascribed the authorship tentatively to al-Zarkashī (presumably Muḥammad ibn Bahādur al-Zarkashī; Brockelmann, II, 91; S II, p. 108), whose name appears in an ex-libris, dated A.H. 804(?), on leaf 211 verso. But the date of the other ex-libris, A.H. 674, makes this chronologically impossible.
Leaves 125-134 misbound after leaf 44.

record.title: Gharībay al-Qurʾān wa-al-ḥadīth ; al-juzʾ al-thānī / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Harawī. -- [15--?].
record.note: Fairly old (16th century?) naskhī, fully vocalized.
Part I wanting.

record.title: Futūḥ al-Ḥabashah al-musammá bi-Tuḥfat al-zamān / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Qādir ʻArab Faqīh. -- [18--?].
record.note: Fair modern (19th century) naskhī, in red and black.

record.title: [Majmūʻat ashʻār] / [ʻAbd al-Laṭīf ibn Yaḥyá ibn al-Minqār]. -- [before 1647].
record.note: Author and autograph identified by C. Landberg.
On the author see Khulāṣat al-athar, III, 20.
Islamic binding, paper covered.
Hasty naskhī, in red and black.

record.title: Khulāṣat al-athar fī sīrat sayyid al-bashar : al-juzʾ al-awwal / Aḥmad ibn Abī Bakr al-Baṭḥīshī. -- [17--?].
record.note: Fair modern (18th century?) naskhī, in red and black; ʻunwān in gold and colors on leaf 1 verso.
Islamic binding, in red, with flap.
Other volume(s) wanting.

record.title: al-Asrār al-ṣāfiyah wa-al-khulāṣāt al-shāfiyah fī kashf al-muqaddimah al-Kāfiyah / Ismāʻīl ibn Ibrāhīm al-Naḥrānī. -- 1393.
record.note: The author's surname is spelled in Berlin catalog and Ḥājjī Khalīfah as: al-Baḥrānī.
Fair naskhī, sparsely pointed, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.

record.title: Tanzīh al-anbiyāʾ wa-al-aʾimmah / al-Muḥassin ibn Muḥammad ibn Karrāmah al-Bayhaqī. -- 1289.
record.note: For the author see Brockelmann, S I, p. 731.
Good Yemenite naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in brown, of which only the front cover has been preserved.

record.title: Mashāriq al-anwār al-nabawīyah min ṣiḥāḥ al-akhbār al-Muṣṭafawīyah / al-Ḥasan ibn Muḥammad al-Ṣaghānī. -- 1628.
record.note: An ex-libris on leaf 164 recto is dated A.H. 1214.
C. Landberg's catalogue describes the manuscript as "aus diesem Jahrhundert," which is inexact, since even the ex-libris is dated before 1800.
Good naskhī, fully vocalized.
Loose in Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.

record.title: al-Bishārah wa-al-nidhārah fī taʻbīr al-ruʾyā wa-al-murāqabah / ʻAbd al-Malik ibn Muḥammad. -- 1233.
record.note: Good naskhī, in faded gold, red, and black.
Islamic modern bindings, in red, with flap.

record.title: [Kitāb al-fiqh] : [min] bāb al-umūr bi-mashīʾat Allāh ... [ilá] bāb karāhiyat rafʻ al-baṣr ilá al-samāʾ fī al-ṣalāh. -- [13--?].
record.note: Good old (14th century?) naskhī, generously vocalized.
Loose in Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap; in Oriental slip case.

record.title: Dīwān / al-Mutalammis. -- 1896.
record.note: Calligraphic naskhī, in red and black.

record.title: Badāʼiʻ al-zuhūr fī waqāʼiʻ al-duhūr / Ibn Iyās. -- [18--?].
record.note: C. Landberg called this volume III, but it is volume V according to Brockelmann.
C. Landberg's description apparently means that the handwriting is that of al-Ramzī.
Cursive modern (19th century) naskhī, in red and black.
Other volumes wanting.

record.title: al-Mughrib fī tartīb al-muʻrib / Nāṣir ibn ʻAbd al-Sayyid. -- [17--?].
record.note: Compared with Landberg MSS 577.
Fair modern (18th century) naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.

record.title: Mukhtaṣar al-Kifāyah fī ikhtilāf al-fuqahāʾ : al-juzʾ al-awwal / ʻAlī ibn Saʻīd al-ʻAbdarī. -- [before 1395].
record.note: For al-Kifāyah see Ḥājjī Khalīfah, V, 222.
Cursive naskhī, sparsely pointed.
Loose in Islamic binding, in brown, flap missing.
Other volume(s) wanting.

record.title: al-Ashbāh wa-al-naẓāʾir al-fiqhīyah / Zayn al-Dīn ibn Ibrāhīm ibn Nujaym. -- 1858.
record.note: Fair naskhī.
Islamic binding, in red, with flap.

record.title: al-Ishārāt ilá mā waqaʻa fī al-Minhāj min al-asmāʾ wa-al-amākin wa-al-lughāt / ʻUmar ibn ʻAlī ibn al-Mulaqqin. -- 1434.
record.note: Fair naskhī, in red and black.

record.title: Qahwat al-inshāʾ / Taqī al-Dīn Abū Bakr ibn ʻAlī. -- 1773.
record.note: Coarse naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.

record.title: Taʾrīkh mulūk al-Yaman / al-Qāsim ibn al-Ḥasan al-Jurmūzī. -- 1789.
record.note: For the author see Brockelmann, S II, p. 546.
Fair Yemenite naskhī, in red, green, and black.

record.title: al-Sharḥ al-ṣaghīr ʻalá al-Wajīz : al-juzʾ al-thānī. -- 1270 and 1363.
record.note: Fair naskhī, leaves 61-86 supplied in a modern hand.
Modern Islamic binding, in red, with flap.
The first half wanting.

record.title: Masʾalah fī daʻwá Ūqlīdas / al-amīr al-ajall ʻIzz al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Sulaymān ibn Qutlumush(?) al-Baghdādī. -- [before 1774].
record.note: Fair naskhī, in red and black, with diagrams.
With: 2 other titles.

record.title: al-Barkār al-tāmm / Abū Sahl Waykhan [sic] ibn Rustam al-Kūhī [sic]. -- [before 1774].
record.note: Fair naskhī, in red and black, with diagrams.

record.title: al-Hādī ilá al-Mijisṭī. -- [before 1774].
record.note: The 2d fann begins on leaf 53 recto.
Fair naskhī, in red and black, with diagrams.

record.title: Istiqṣāʾ al-madhhab fī sharḥ al-Muhadhdhab / ʻUthmān ibn ʻĪsá al-Mārānī. -- 1255.
record.note: The work is also mentioned in a note to Berlin catalog, 4459.
Fair naskhī.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.

record.title: Kawkab al-Rawḍah / Jalāl al-Dīn al-Suyūṭī. -- [1700?].
record.note: Fair naskhī, in red and black.
Many leaves supplied in later hands.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.

record.title: ʻImād al-balāghah / ʻAbd al-Raʾūf ibn Tāj al-ʻĀrifīn. -- 1860.
record.note: Alternate title: Bulūgh al-arab.
Fair naskhī, in red, blue, and black.
Islamic binding, in red, with flap.

record.title: al-Muthallath / ʻAbd Allāh ibn Muḥammad al-Baṭalyawsī. -- 1198.
record.note: Title and author supplied by C. Landberg.
Good Maghribī hand, generously vocalized.
Loose in Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.

record.title: al-Ḍawʾ al-lāmiʻ li-ahl al-qarn al-tāsiʻ : al-juzʾ al-thālith / Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Sakhāwī. -- 1844.
record.note: Fair naskhī, in red and black.
Other volumes wanting.

record.title: al-Ḍawʾ al-lāmiʻ li-ahl al-qarn al-tāsiʻ : al-juzʾ al-thālith / Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Sakhāwī. -- [18--?].
record.note: Fair modern (19th century) naskhī, in red and black.
Other volumes wanting.

record.title: al-Durar al-multaqaṭah min al-kutub al-mustanbaṭah. -- [15--?].
record.note: A note, evidently in a later hand, attributes the work to al-Māwardī (d. 1058); the attribution, however, is false, since among the author's sources (leaf 2 recto) there is listed a work by al-Suyūṭī (d. 1505). The attribution was probably inspired by al-Māwardī's Adab al-dīn wa-al-dunyā.
The title, as above, is given in the preface.
Good 16th century naskhī, in red and black.
Loose in Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.

record.title: Siyar aʻlām al-nubalāʾ / al-Dhahabī. -- [14--?].
record.note: Also known as: Taʾrīkh al-nubalāʾ (Brockelmann).
Old (15th century?) coarse naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in red, with flap.

record.title: Siyar al-nubalāʾ / Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Dhahabī. -- 1487.
record.note: Also known as: Taʾrīkh al-nubalāʾ (Brockelmann).
Volume XVIII begins on leaf 200 recto.
Good Yemenite naskhī, in red and black; several quires at end in different hands.
Islamic binding, in red, with flap.

record.title: Kitāb al-rūḥ / Ibn Qayyim al-Jawzīyah. -- 1370.
record.note: Wrongly catalogued by C. Landberg as the Rūḥ al-arwāḥ of Ibn al-Jawzī (Brockelmann, I, 505); the correct title appears on the flap of the slip-case; cf. also India Office catalog 172, where however the order of the questions (masʾalah) is different.
Cursive hand, partly unpointed.
Loose in Islamic slip-case.

record.title: Tuḥfat al-gharīb fī al-kalām ʻalá Mughnī al-labīb / Muḥammad ibn Abī Bakr al-Damāmīnī. -- [1402?].
record.note: C. Landberg thought the copy was used in the author's lectures; the lecture certificate of leaves 207 verso-208 verso is dated A.H. 886.
Cursive hand, in red and black; leaves 1-11 supplied in a later hand, and leaves 22-45 in a 19th century hand.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap; part of the flap missing.

record.title: Sharḥ Talkhīṣ al-Jāmiʻ al-kabīr : al-juzʾ al-thānī / al-Ghurduwānī [sic]. -- [13--?].
record.note: For the author see Brockelmann, S II, p. 270.

The author's surname is spelled (leaf 338 recto) as: al-Gharduwānī; for the town of Ghujduwān in Bukhārá, cf. Yaʻqūt, who lists no town named Ghurduwān, but one named Ghardayān. The misspelling would thus seem to cast doubt on C. Landberg's assumption that this is a holograph.
Fair naskhī, in red and black, partly deteriorating into a cursive hand.
Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.

record.title: Rawḍat al-ṭālibīn wa-ʻumdat al-muftīn / Yaḥyá ibn Sharaf al-Nawawī. -- 1338.
record.note: Several fair naskhī hands, in red and black.
Considerably worm-eaten and damaged by corrosive ink.

record.title: Risālat al-ikhwān min ahl al-fiqh wa-ḥamalat al-Qurʾān / ʻAlī ibn Maymūn al-Idrīsī. -- [16--?].
record.note: Good fairly modern (17th century?) naskhī, in red and black; leaf 1 supplied by a later hand.
Leaves numbered 1-165, omitting leaf 1 and a leaf between 95 and 96.
Loose in Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.

record.title: al-Mughrib fī tartīb al-muʻrib / Nāṣir ibn ʻAbd al-Sayyid al-Muṭarrizī. -- 1555 or 56.
record.note: Calligraphic naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in black.

record.title: al-Qawl al-maʾnūs bi-sharḥ mughlaq al-Qāmūs / Muḥammad ibn Yaḥyá al-Qarāfī. -- 1622.
record.note: Cf. Ḥājjī Khalīfah IV, 493-94, where the incipit is extensively quoted. Hitti 282 is a different, larger work.
Fair naskhī, in red and black.
Loose in Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.

record.title: Sharḥ al-Qāmūs / lil-Munāwī. -- [17--?].
record.note: Brockelmann (II, 183; S II, p. 234) lists only al-Munāwī's commentary on the Khuṭbah of al-Qāmūs.
Fair naskhī, in red and black, fairly modern (18th century?).
Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.

record.title: Tashnīf al-asmāʻ bi-fawāʾid al-tasmiyah ʻinda al-jimāʻ / ʻAbd al-Qādir ibn Muḥammad al-Shādhilī. -- [17--?].
record.note: The author's name, as above, is given in the title, leaf 1 recto.
For the author see Brockelmann, S II, p. 932.
Ascribed to ʻUmar al-Shammāʻ by Brockelmann and described as anonymous by Hitti.
Modern (18th century?) naskhī, in red and black.

record.title: al-Tuḥaf wa-al-ẓuraf / Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Mughīth ibn Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm ibn Muḥammad al-Dārimī al-kātib. -- 1761.
record.note: Calligraphic naskhī, in red and black.
Figures of birds on leaves 17 verso-18 recto, 42 verso-43 recto, 52 verso-53 recto.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.

record.title: al-Yāqūt al-muʻaẓẓam al-mufawwaf bi-ʻAqd ʻiqyān al-ḥikam / ʻAbd Allāh sibṭ al-Mutawakkil ʻalá Allāh. -- 1744.
record.note: The author's name on leaf 1 recto has been changed in a later hand to ʻAbd Allāh ibn Muḥammad al-Jawharī.
Fair Yemenite naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.

record.title: al-Īḍāḥ wa-al-tibyān fī maʻrifat al-mikyāl wa-al-mīzān / Najm al-Dīn Abū al-ʻAbbās Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ibn al-Rifʻah al-Anṣārī al-Shāfiʻī. -- 1889.
record.note: Fair naskhī, in black and blue.

record.title: al-Urjūzah al-miʾīyah fī dhikr ḥāl ashraf al-barīyah / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Shiḥnah. -- [18--?].
record.note: Also known as: Manẓūmah fī sīrat al-Rasūl (Brockelmann).
al-Miʾīyah (consisting of 100 lines) is misread in Berlin catalog as: al-mabnīyah.
Modern (19th century) calligraphic naskhī.

record.title: al-Baḥth al-ṣarīḥ fī al-dīn al-ṣaḥīḥ / Ziyādah ibn Yaḥyá al-Naṣb al-Raʾsī. -- [18--?].
record.note: The author was a Christian convert to Islam; on the author and work see Zapiski Kollegii vostokovedov, V, 774 ff.
Modern (19th century) naskhī, in red and black.

record.title: al-Maṭlab fī sharḥ al-Wasīṭ / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Rifʻah. -- [13--?].
record.note: Apparently a volume from the same set as Landberg MSS 479.
The waqf-deed on leaf 1 recto, mostly obliterated, seems to be the same as the one (dated A.H. 797 [A.D. 1395]) in Landberg MSS 479, volume II.
Fair 14th century naskhī, sparsely pointed.

record.title: Khāliṣat al-ḥaqāʾiq / Maḥmūd ibn Aḥmad al-Fāryābī. -- 1535 or 36.
record.note: Fair naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.

record.title: al-Sāmī fī al-asāmī / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Maydānī. -- 1272.
record.note: Calligraphic naskhī, in red and black.

record.title: Durr al-saḥābah fī manāqib al-qarābah wa-al-ṣaḥābah / Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Shawkānī. -- 1828.
record.note: For the author see Brockelmann, S II, p. 818.
The scribe appears to be the author's son; cf. Landberg MSS 591.
Coarse naskhī.

record.title: Sharḥ al-Maqṣūrah al-Duraydīyah. -- [14--?].
record.note: Same work as in Brockelmann, with minor variants, and as that in British Museum Suppl. no. 1035.
Old (15th century) naskhī, in red and black; leaves 83-86 supplied by a later hand.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.

record.title: [Rasāʾil] / Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Shawkānī. -- 1827-1829.
record.note: Hasty naskhī.
The scribe appears to be the author's son (in several title-headings the author is named al-wālid).

record.title: al-Mukhtār lil-fatwá / [ʻAbd Allāh ibn] Maḥmūd al-Buldajī. -- 1307.
record.note: Calligraphic naskhī, in red and black; leaves 41-48, 80-93 in a later hand.
Loose in Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.

record.title: al-Qawāʻid wa-al-ishārāt fī uṣūl al-qirāʾāt / Aḥmad ibn ʻUmar ibn Muḥammad ibn Abī al-Riḍá al-Ḥamawī. -- 1364.
record.note: Brockelmann lists only one copy, Rampūr, I, 53.
The story on the leaves of notes at end, with the ijāzah following it, seems to belong to the author's time.
Good naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, paper covered, flap missing.

record.title: [Dīwān] / Muḥammad ibn Abī Bakr al-Dāmāmīnī. -- [14--?].
record.note: The date A.H. 744 (A.D. 1343 or 44) occurs in one of the additional pieces, leaf 75 verso.
C. Landberg's card called this the author's autograph, which it clearly is not (cf. descriptive slip inserted in front, with description in Arabic of this manuscript).
Coarse 15th century naskhī.
The additional pieces at end are written in various scripts, some later, some earlier.
Many leaves mutilated.
Islamic binding, paper covered.

record.title: al-Īḍāḥ fī al-waqf wa-al-ibtidāʾ / Muḥammad ibn al-Qāsim al-Anbārī. -- [13--?].
record.note: Minute cursive 14th(?) century hand.
Islamic binding, paper covered.

record.title: [Qiṣṣat Sindbād al-barrī]. -- [17--?].
record.note: Fair modern (18th century?) naskhī, in red and black.
A few leaves supplied in a later hand.
Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.

record.title: Kanz al-dhakhāʾir / al-Maḥallī. -- 1588.
record.note: For the author see Brockelmann, S II, p. 150.
Fair naskhī, in red and black. Leaves 3 and 8 supplied by a later hand.
Loose in Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.

record.title: al-Hidāyah min al-iʻtiqād / Muḥammad ibn Abī Bakr al-Rāzī. -- 1441.
record.note: For the author see Brockelmann, S I, p. 658.
A note in a later hand on leaf 1 recto wrongly identifies this work with the commentary of Ibn Jamāʻah (which is far shorter, cf. Berlin catalog 2412; Gotha catalog 667).

Evidently same work as Berlin catalog 2409, where the text ends, as here, with the last six verses of the matn, without commentary; what seems like two additional verses on leaf 94 verso is a pious formula without meter.
Fair naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in brown, flap missing.

record.title: Rawḍat al-ṭālibīn wa-ʻumdat al-muftīn : Kitāb al-nikāḥ / al-Nawawī. -- 1328.
record.note: Good naskhī, in red and black.
Leaves 135-201 by another hand, of approximately the same time.
Islamic binding, in brown, flap missing.

record.title: ʻUqalāʾ al-majānīn / al-Ḥasan ibn Muḥammad al-Nīsābūrī. -- 1340.
record.note: Compared with Berlin catalog 8328, the verses with which the incomplete Berlin copy begins are on leaf 6 verso of this manuscript.
Fair naskhī, in red and black.
Loose in Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.

record.title: [Ijāzah] / Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī ibn al-Ḥasan ibn Jāmiʻ al-Dimashqī al-Shāfiʻī al-muqriʾ al-shahīr bi-Ibn al-Labbān. -- [before 1349].
record.note: For the author see Brockelmann, II, 111; S II, p. 137.
Hasty naskhī.

record.title: al-Mufaḍḍalīyāt. -- 1888.
record.note: Good naskhī, in red and black.

record.title: De martyrio serui dei Iosaphat Cunceuitii archiepiscopi polocensis : ad smum. D. N. Vrbanum VIII. pont. opt. max. relatio ex processibus super eius canonizatione formatis extracta / Joannis Baptistae Coccini Decani, Philippi Pirouani, & Clementis Merlini, rotae auditores, 1625.
record.note: Original limp vellum, remains of silk ties, manuscript title on spine, with white slip of paper with Phillipps number "5082" pasted at top of spine.

record.title: al-Shāfiyah. -- [16--?].
record.note: Marginalia.
Formerly laid in Arabic MSS suppl. 507.

record.title: Ghāyat al-itqān fī tadbīr badan al-insān / Ṣāliḥ ibn Naṣr Allāh ibn Sallūm. -- 1791.
record.note: Good naskhī (in several forms, though perhaps by the same hand), in red and black.
For Yaḥyá Efendi see Brockelmann, II, 365.

record.title: Maʻālim al-tanzīl / al-Ḥusayn ibn Masʻūd al-Baghawī. -- 1323.
record.note: Two hands: volume I, good naskhī, in red and black; volumes II-V, good naskhī. A few leaves supplied by later hands.
Islamic binding, in black, with flaps.

record.title: al-Jāmiʻ al-ṣaghīr fī al-naḥw / Muḥammad ibn Sharaf al-Kallāʾī. -- [14--?].
record.note: Old (15th century?) naskhī, in red and black; a few leaves supplied by a later hand.
Half-bound in modern deerskin(?), with label inside front cover: "Bound at the Aden jail."

record.title: al-Tabṣirah fī uṣūl al-dīn / ʻAbd al-Wāḥid ibn Muḥammad al-Shīrāzī. -- [13--?].
record.note: Old (14th century?) naskhī.

record.title: Khulāṣat Tadhhīb tahdhīb al-kamāl fī asmāʼ al-rijāl / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Khazrajī. -- 1744.
record.note: Fair Yemenite naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, paper covered, flap missing.

record.title: Kitāb al-ṭibb / lil-faqīh Jamāl (i.e. Najīb) al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ibn ʻUmar al-mutaṭabbib. -- 1368.
record.note: Compared with Berlin catalog 6289, incipit, after the Ḥamdalah, somewhat different; but the explicit is the same.
Good naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, covered with cheese-cloth.
With: 1 other title.

record.title: Aṭʻimat al-marḍá / Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Samarqandī. -- 1368.
record.note: The title is given in the incipit, leaf 120 verso; alternate title: Aghdhiyat al-marḍá.
Good naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, covered with cheese-cloth.
With: 1 other title.

record.title: al-Maḥṣūl fī uṣūl al-fiqh : al-juzʾ al-thānī / Fakhr al-Dīn al-Rāzī. -- [14--?].
record.note: For al-Rāzī's Shafiʻi persuasion see India Office catalog, no. 292.
Old (15th century?) Yemenite naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in red, with flap.
Other volume(s) wanting.

record.title: [Majmūʻat ashʻār]. -- [17--?].
record.note: Modern (18th century) Yemenite naskhī, in red, green, and black.
Islamic binding, paper covered.

record.title: Manāhil al-ṣafāʾ fī al-madfūnīn bi-Miṣr min āl al-Muṣṭafá / Muṣṭafá al-Ṣafawī al-Shāfiʻī al-Qalʻāwī. -- [17--?].
record.note: For the author cf. Brockelmann, S II, p. 289, k.
Modern (18th century) naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.
With: 2 other titles.

record.title: Qiṣṣat Rābiʻah al-ʻAdawīyah wa-mā jará lahā maʻa Dhī al-Nūn. -- [1700?].
record.note: Coarse modern (18th century) naskhī, in silver and black.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.
With: 2 other titles.

record.title: Zawāj sittinā Khadījah lil-Nabī. -- [17--?].
record.note: Coarse modern (18th century) naskhī, in silver and black.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.
With: 2 other titles.

record.title: Siyar aʻlām al-nubalāʾ : al-juzʾ al-thāmin / Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Dhahabī. -- 1651.
record.note: The title is given on leaf 1 recto as: Taʾrīkh al-Islām; and by Brockelmann as: Taʾrīkh al-nubalāʾ.
Fair naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in red, with flap.
Other volumes wanting.

record.title: [al-Muʻjām al-mufahras li-alfāẓ al-ḥadīth]. -- [16--?].
record.note: Misbound: leaves 1-6 contain bāʾ and tāʾ; leaves 7-21 and 25 contain alif.
Authorship and title uncertain.
With: 6 other titles.

record.title: Ḥāshiyat al-Ṭāʾūsī ʻalá al-Itḥāf al-ṣaghīr. -- [13--?].
record.note: The title is given in a much later hand on leaf 2 recto; it appears also on the upper and lower edges, without al-ṣaghīr.

The author is presumably not identical with ʻAlī ibn Mūsá al-Ṭāʾūsī (d. 1266, Brockelmann, S I, p. 911), a Shiʻite, or with Ibrāhīm ibn Muḥammad al-Ṭāʾūsī (fl. 1266, Brockelmann, S I, p. 806), a mystic, or with ʻAbd al-Karīm ibn Aḥmad ibn al-Ṭāʾūs (d. 1294, Brockelmann, S I, pp. 562, 714), a Shiʻite. The first of these, however, did write works in fiqh which are now lost (Brockelmann, S I, p. 913).
Old (14th century?) naskhī.
Islamic binding, in red, with flap.

record.title: [Sharḥ al-furūʻ]. -- [16--?].
record.note: Leaf 26 damaged, with considerable loss of text.
With: 6 other titles.

record.title: [Aḥādīth]. -- [16--?].
record.note: With: 6 other titles.

record.title: [Kitāb al-wakālah]. -- [16--].
record.note: With: 6 other titles.

record.title: Maḥāsin al-sharīʻah / Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Qaffāl al-Shāshī. -- [before 1420].
record.note: Good naskhī, in red and black; leaves 193-198 supplied by another, slightly younger, hand.
Islamic binding, in red, with flap.

record.title: [Tafsīr]. -- [16--?].
record.note: With: 6 other titles.

record.title: [Sharḥ al-furūʻ]. -- [16--?].
record.note: Very fine hands.
With: 6 other titles.

record.title: al-Milal wa-al-niḥal / Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Karīm al-Shahrastānī. -- [before 1299].
record.note: Compared with Cureton's edition.
Fair naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in brown, of which only the back cover is preserved.

record.title: Nuskhah fī mā ḥadatha fī akhbār al-buwash. -- [18--?].
record.note: Modern (19th century) hasty naskhī, in red and black.

record.title: al-Irshād fī uṣūl al-iʻtiqād / ʻAbd al-Malik ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Juwaynī. -- 1420.
record.note: Fair Yemenite naskhī.

record.title: Uns al-munqaṭiʻīn / al-Muʻāfá ibn Ismāʻīl ibn al-Ḥusayn ibn Abī al-Fatḥ ibn Abī Sinān. -- 1420.
record.note: Yemenite naskhī.

record.title: Jamīlat arbāb al-marāṣid fī sharḥ ʻAqīlat atrāb al-qaṣāʾid / Ibrāhīm ibn ʻUmar al-Jaʻbarī. -- [15--?].
record.note: For the matn see Berlin catalog 487.
Fairly modern (16th century?) naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in red, with flap.

record.title: al-Durr al-naẓīm fī madḥ al-maqām al-ʻālī al-karīm mawlānā ... Muḥammad ibn Shams al-Dīn ibn amīr al-muʾminīn al-Mutawakkil ʻalá Allāh. -- [16--?].
record.note: The subject's grandfather is presumably al-Mutawakkil listed in Brockelmann, S II, p. 557.

On the title-page (leaf 4 recto), the second word of the title has been changed to al-thamīn, but the original word seems to be visible clearly enough; the same title (with al-thamīn) appears also on the bottom edges of the volume.
Several Yemenite hands of the early 17th century.
The volume is misbound, many leaves being placed out of order.

record.title: Tashyīd al-bunyān fī sharḥ Nakhbat uṣūl al-qawāʻid wa-al-arkān / ʻUmar ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥīm al-Ḥaḍramī. -- 1860.
record.note: Ibn al-ʻArrāq's name is given on leaves 1 verso-2 recto as Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad al-Muhājir ibn ʻArrāq (which is somewhat different from Brockelmann's form; although the same as in Berlin catalog 427), and his date of death is wrongly given as 17th Ṣafar 733 (instead of 14th Ṣafar 933).
Fair naskhī, in red and black.
Loose in Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.
Other volume(s) wanting.

record.title: Nuzhat al-qulūb fī gharīb al-Qurʾān / Abū Bakr Muḥammad ibn ʻUzayr al-Sijistānī. -- 1144.
record.note: Calligraphic naskhī, in red and black, fully vocalized.

record.title: Jāmiʻ al-uṣūl li-aḥādīth al-rasūl / al-Mubārak ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Athīr. -- [13--?].
record.note: Old (14th century?) naskhī. Leaves 1-177, 374-382 supplied in modern hands.
Islamic binding, in brown, flap missing.
Other volumes wanting.

record.title: Mukhtaṣar al-Durar al-farāʾid al-munaẓẓamah / Muḥammad Madyan ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-ṭabīb. -- 1890.
record.note: In the title (leaf 1 recto), the author is called Abū Madyan.
Calligraphic naskhī, in red and black.

record.title: Mukhtaṣar al-Nūr al-sāfir ʻan akhbār al-qarn al-ʻāshir / Madyan al-ṭabīb. -- [18--?].
record.note: For the author see Brockelmann, S II, p. 402.
Modern (19th century) calligraphic naskhī, in red and black.

record.title: [Inshāʾāt] / ʻAbd al-Raḥīm ibn ʻAlī. -- [18--?].
record.note: The title, as given on leaf 1 recto, reads: inshaʾdah.
Modern (19th century) cursive hand.

record.title: [Rasāʾil] / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Ghunaymī al-Khazrajī al-Anṣārī. -- 1595.
record.note: For the author see Brockelmann, S II, p. 457.
Cursive hand.

record.title: Bughyat al-murīd ʻalá Risālat al-tawḥīd / Muḥammad ʻAyyād al-Ṭanṭāwī. -- 1856.
record.note: For the author see Brockelmann, S II, p. 729.
C. Landberg's catalogue calls the whole manuscript an autograph, which is obviously an error.

Penciled note in C. Landberg's hand on leaf 1 recto, evidently referring to a marginal note on the same page: "Autogr. d'Ahmed et Tantawi qui a écrit le livre sur la langue vulgaire" (cf. Brockelmann, II, 479).
Good naskhī, in red and black.

record.title: al-Taqyīd wa-al-takmīl fī maʻrifat ʻadad adhruʻ al-Nīl / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Ṣāwī al-Mālikī. -- [before 1825?].
record.note: In the incipit "Muḥammad" is written over an erased "Ibrāhīm," and there is also an erasure in the same place on the title page. It is not clear whether the change is the author's own legitimate correction, or a case of plagiarism.
For the supposed author see Brockelmann, S II, p. 743.
The hand writing is entirely different from that of Landberg MSS 9, also presumably a holograph, so the authors are not identical.
Fair naskhī, in red and black.

record.title: Taʾrīkh / Khalīl ibn Aḥmad al-Madābighī. -- [1816 or 17?].
record.note: Cursive hand.

record.title: al-Ṭirāz al-mudhhab li-aḥkām al-madhhab / Shihāb al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn ... Yūsuf ibn ... Muḥammad al-Sīrajī [sic] al-Shāfiʻī. -- 1598.
record.note: Both title and incipit point "mudhhab" not "mudhahhab" as does Brockelmann.
Fair naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in red, with flap.

record.title: Sharḥ al-sumūṭ al-sabʻ wa-qaṣīdatay ʻAmr ibn Kulthūm wa-al-Ḥārith ibn Ḥillizah / Abū Jaʻfar Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Naḥḥās al-naḥwī. -- 1376.
record.note: Good naskhī.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.

record.title: Bughyat al-khāṭir wa-nuzhat al-nāẓir / Muḥammd ibn Muṣṭafá al-Kānī. -- 1658.
record.note: The title is given in the incipit, leaf 2 recto.
Fair naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in brown, flap missing.

record.title: al-Fawāʾid al-muntakhabah min al-nafaḥāt al-ṭibbīyah / Muḥammad ibn Ziyād al-Waḍḍāḥī. -- 1870.
record.note: For the author see Brockelmann, S II, p. 994; the commentary was completed in A.H. 1107 (cf. leaf 58 verso).
For al-Kāshgharī's date cf. leaf 3 recto (died in A.H. 705).
Yemenite naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.
With: 1 other title.

record.title: Sharḥ al-Ājurrūmīyah / Ḥasan ibn ʻAlī al-Kafrāwī. -- [1870].
record.note: Fair Yemenite naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.
With: 1 other title.

record.title: Taʾrīkh / [Muḥammad] ibn Jarīr al-Nīsābūrī al-Shāfiʻī [al-Ṭabarī]. -- [13--?].
record.note: Old (14th century?) naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in brown, flap missing.

record.title: Asrār al-fiqh / al-Ḥusayn ibn Muḥammad al-Marwarrūdhī. -- 1421.
record.note: Ḥājjī Khalīfah, I, 282 lists a work under same title by Abū al-Qāsim ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad al-Marwazī al-Ghawrānī al-Shāfiʻī (d. 1069).

Evidently identical with Abū ʻAlī al-Ḥusayn ibn Muḥammad al-Marwarrūdhī (Brockelmann, I, 387; S I, p. 669). Cf. Ibn Khallikān (ed. Cairo), I, 145 where his teacher Abū Bakr al-Qaffāl al-Marwazī, quoted in the incipit, is mentioned. Cf. also al-Subkī, Ṭabaqāt al-Shāfiʻīyah, III, 155 ff.
Fair naskhī, sparsely pointed, in red and black.

record.title: al-Mushtahá bi-naḍm (i.e. naẓm) ashʻār wa-nawādir wa-ḥikāyāt wa-āsār (i.e. āthār) / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Manṣūr ibn al-Sulamī. -- 1644.
record.note: Fair Yemenite naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in brown and red, with flap.

record.title: Dīwān / Faḥmān Yāqūt. -- [before 1858 or 59].
record.note: Good Yemenite naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.

record.title: Sharḥ al-Wajīz / ʻAbd al-Karīm ibn Muḥammad al-Rāfiʻī. -- 1282.
record.note: Good naskhī.
Islamic binding, in brown, flap missing.

record.title: Kanz al-ʻirfān fī fiqh al-Qurʾān / al-Miqdād ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Suyūrī. -- 1588 or 89.
record.note: Calligraphic naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in brown, flap missing.

record.title: [Rasāʾil] / Aḥmad ibn Zayn al-Dīn al-Aḥsāʾī. -- [after 1813 or 14].
record.note: For the author see Brockelmann, S II, pp. 844-45; the Rasāʾil, composed in A.H. 1235 are presumably a different collection.
C. Landberg's catalogue ascribes the handwriting to the author himself, which seems to be an error.
Very small naskhī.
Limp Islamic binding, in brown.

record.title: al-Durr al-naẓīm fī faḍāʾil al-Qurʾān al-ʻaẓīm / Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn al-Khashshāb. -- [ca. 1800].
record.note: On the title page (leaf 1 recto), the work is ascribed to ʻAbd Allāh al-Yāfiʻī; and it is not clear whether the text is that of Ibn al-Khashshāb's original work, or of al-Yāfiʻī's abridgment of it; cf. India Office catalog, no. 1209.
Modern (ca. 1800) naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.

record.title: al-Maḥṣūl fī uṣūl al-fiqh / Fakhr al-Dīn ... Muḥammad ibn ʻUmar al-Rāzī. -- 1871.
record.note: C. Landberg's card said these two volumes formed the first volume of the work; but a comparison with Landberg MSS 609 shows that this is the complete work.
Fair naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic bindings, in purple.

record.title: al-Inālah fī al-fatḥ wa-al-imālah / ʻAlī ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻAbd al-ʻAzīz al-muqriʾ al-Damīrī. -- [1800?].
record.note: For the author's brother see Brockelmann, S II, p. 99.
Fair modern (ca. 1800) Yemenite naskhī, in red, green, and black.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.

record.title: Bulūgh al-arab fī laṭāʾif al-adab. -- 1587.
record.note: Alternate title: al-Mukhtār min nawādir al-akhbār.
Coarse naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, paper covered.

record.title: Maqāmāt / Abū Muḥammad al-Qāsim ibn ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻUthmān al-Ḥarīrī al-Baṣrī. -- 1762.
record.note: Calligraphic naskhī, vocalized throughout, in red and black.
ʻUnwān in gold and colors on leaf 3 verso; gold page-borders.
Islamic binding, in brown, elaborately gilt, with flap.

record.title: Nuzhat al-nāẓir wa-musharriḥ al-khāṭir. -- [1567?].
record.note: al-Baghdādī, Dhayl Kashf al-ẓunūn, II, 642 has a Nuzhat al-nāẓir fī mā yusharriḥ al-khāṭir, without giving any further particulars.
Fair naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.

record.title: Sharḥ al-abyāt al-thalāthah wa-al-sittīn fī bayān ghazawāt al-Nabī / Ibrāhīm ibn Muṣṭafá al-Ḥalabī. -- 1812.
record.note: For the author see Brockelmann, S II, p. 428.
The 63 lines of the matn correspond to Muḥammad's age (cf. preface).
Cursive hand, in red and black.
Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.

record.title: Bahjat al-maḥāfil wa-bughyat al-amāthil / Yaḥyá ibn Abī Bakr al-ʻĀmirī. -- 1814.
record.note: Two Yemenite hands, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.

record.title: Ghunyat al-muḥtāj ilá sulūk al-Minhāj : al-juzʾ al-sādis / al-Adhraʻī. -- [13--?].
record.note: The title is written on the lower edges as: al-juzʾ al-sādis min al-Ghunyah al-Adhraʻīyah.
Old (14th century?) naskhī.
Islamic binding, in brown, front cover and part of flap missing.
Other volumes wanting.

record.title: Ghirbāl al-zamān / al-Ḥusayn ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn al-Ahdal. -- [17--?].
record.note: The title, leaf 1 recto, reads: al-Ghirbāl fī al-taʾrīkh lil-ʻĀmirī; the attribution to al-ʻĀmirī (presumably Yaḥyá ibn Abī Bakr al-ʻĀmirī) is evidently false.
C. Landberg's card entered the work under al-ʻĀmirī, but the text is the same as in Landberg MSS 518.
Modern (18th century) Yemenite naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in red, with flap.

record.title: Sharḥ al-Wasīṭ : [al-juzʾ] al-thānī / [Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Qamūlī]. -- [13--?].
record.note: The identification of author and title of this volume is uncertain.
Title given on the lower edges.
Fair naskhī, probably of the 14th century.
Islamic binding, in brown, of which only the front cover is preserved.
Other volumes wanting.

record.title: Mukhtaṣar Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim / ikhtiṣār ... Zakī al-Dīn Abī Muḥammad ʻAbd al-ʻAẓīm ibn ʻAbd al-Qawī ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Mundhirī. -- 1314.
record.note: For the author see Brockelmann, I, 367; S I, p. 627.
Fair naskhī.

record.title: Taʻlīqat al-qāḍī Ḥusayn : [al-juzʾ] al-thāmin (?). -- [13--?].
record.note: The identification of the work is uncertain. Title, as written on the lower edges, is partly rubbed off and indistinct.
For the author see Brockelmann, I, 387; S I, p. 669. On the Taʻlīqah, cf. also al-Subkī, Ṭabaqāt al-Shāfiʻīyah, III, 155 ff; Ibn Khallikān (ed. Cairo), I, 145.
Fair old (14th century?) naskhī.
Islamic binding, in brown, loose, the back cover supplied from a smaller book.

record.title: al-Baḥr al-muḥīṭ / Abū Ḥayyān Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf. -- [before 1377].
record.note: Calligraphic naskhī, in red and black.
Loose in modern Islamic binding, in red, with flap.

record.title: al-Shudhūr al-ʻasjadīyah fī al-khilāfah al-Aḥmadīyah / Muḥsin ibn Aḥsan [ibn] Abū [sic] Ṭālib. -- [before 1782].
record.note: Fair Yemenite naskhī, in red and black.

record.title: Īḍāḥ al-maʻānī al-sanīyah min alfāẓ kalām al-Ḥājibīyah / Qāsim ibn Yūsuf al-Ṭalamī (?). -- 1558.
record.note: The vocalization of the author's surname is uncertain.
Yemenite naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.

record.title: Mishkāt al-anwār fī laṭāʾif al-akhbār / Muḥammad al-Majdūlī. -- [17--?].
record.note: The author's name, as above, is given in the title. The usual attribution (Brockelmann, Hitti, etc.) of this work to al-Ghazzālī is manifestly wrong, since among the authors quoted are al-Ghazzālī (leaves 27 recto, 29 recto, 83 verso, 199 recto, 214 recto), Ibn al-ʻArabī (leaves 28 recto, 31 recto, 214 verso), Naṣīr al-Dīn al-Ṭūsī (leaf 276 recto), and "mawlānā Jalāl al-Dīn [al-Suyūṭī?]" (leaf 30 recto).
C. Landberg's card mentioned al-Suyūṭī among the authors quoted.
The Princeton copy (Hitti 1892) is dated 1531, hence the work must have been written before that date.
Fair modern (18th century) naskhī, in red and black; leaves 440-442, 449-452, 455 supplied in a later hand.
Loose in Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.

record.title: [Taʾrīkh Miṣr wa-ʻajāʾibuhā]. -- 1642.
record.note: A note in a later hand on leaf 1 recto identifies this work with al-Nujūm al-zāhirah of Ibn Taghrībirdī, which is clearly an error.
Fair naskhī, in red and black.
Loose in Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.

record.title: Muʻīd al-niʻam wa-mubīd al-niqam / Tāj al-Dīn Abū Naṣr ʻAbd al-Wahhāb ibn ... Taqī al-Dīn ʻAlī ibn ʻAbd al-Kāfī al-Subkī. -- 1761.

record.title: Sharḥ al-Durrah al-muḍīʾah : al-qism al-awwal / [Aḥmad] ibn Muḥammad al-Jazarī. -- 1738.
record.note: For the author's given name see Berlin catalog, 511.

The title inscribed on the lower edges (Nuwayrī ʻalá al-Durrah) identifies this with the commentary of Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Nuwayrī (d. 857/1453, Brockelmann, S II, p. 21), Brockelmann, S II, p. 275. This, however, seems to be an error, for this commentary was completed, according to leaf 172 recto, in 878/1473.
Ḥājjī Khalīfah (III, 210) describes an anomymous commentary that seems to be identical with, or similar to, this commentary.
Small calligraphic Turkish naskhī, in red and black.

Ḥājjī Khalīfah (I, 516) ascribes to Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Farābī the Īqāẓ al-ḥunafāʼ mentioned in the incipit; the ʻIqd al-jawāhir lil-asbāṭ, also mentioned in the incipit, is evidently a different work from al-Maqrīzī's ʻIqd jawāhir al-asfāṭ listed in Ḥājjī Khalīfah, IV, 230.
Neither of the two works mentioned in the incipit is listed in Brockelmann.
The Īqāẓ al-ḥunafāʼ, too, was abridged from Ibn Iyās.
Fair modern (18th century) naskhī, in red and black.

record.title: Niẓām al-gharīb / ʻĪsá ibn Ibrāhīm al-Rabaʻī. -- 1858.

record.title: Sharḥ al-Shadharah al-dhahabīyah fī ʻilm al-ʻArabīyah / Aḥmad ibn Zayd al-ʻĀtikī. -- [before 1631 or 32].
record.note: The commentary is listed in Ḥājjī Khalīfah as anonymous.
The work was completed (leaf 156 recto) in A.H. 1021 (A.D. 1612).
Berlin catalog 3286 has another author with same surname.
C. Landberg's catalogue spells the surname al-Fātiḥī, evidently by mistake.
Fair naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.

record.title: al-Ḍawʾ al-lāmiʻ li-ahl al-qarn al-tāsiʻ : al-niṣf al-thānī min al-rubʻ al-awwal / Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Sakhāwī. -- 1863.

record.title: Tashrīf al-adhhān wa-al-fuhūm bi-gharīb al-jamʻ li-ṭāʾifah min al-ʻulūm / Muḥammad ʻAbd al-Laṭīf al-Taḥlāwī. -- [before 1853].
record.note: For the author see Berlin catalog, 288(9); Brockelmann, S II, p. 335.
C. Landberg's note on leaf 1 recto says that the owner was an eminent poet; he is listed in Brockelmann, II, 474; S II, p. 720, under his teacher al-Darwīsh.
Fair Yemenite naskhī, in red, blue, and black.
Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.

record.title: al-Sāmī fī al-asāmī / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Maydānī. -- 1257.

record.title: Kitāb al-tījān / ʻAbd al-Malik ibn Hishām. -- [10--?].

record.title: Rasāʾil / Zayn al-Dīn ibn Ibrāhīm ibn Nujaym. -- 1740.
record.note: Presumably an extract from the larger collection of the author's epistles, Brockelmann, II, 310; S II, p. 426; Hitti, 1755; Berlin catalog, 4831 (with full list of epistles; nos. 2, 3, 4, 5).
Colophons on leaves 20 verso, 26 recto, 28 verso.
Nos. 1 and 6 are not in the complete collection, Arabic MSS 169.
Fair nastaʻlīq, in red and black.
Loose in Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.

record.note: According to the title, leaf 192 recto, the author was a contemporary of the imam al-Muʼayyad billāh (944 or 5-1030?), and of ʻAbd al-Jabbār ibn Aḥmad (Muḥammad) ibn ʻAbd al-Jabbār al-Hamadhānī (d. 1025, Brockelmann, S I, p. 343).
Yemenite 17th century naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, covered with flowered cottoncloth, with flap.

record.title: Nafāʾis al-marjān fī jamʻ qiṣaṣ al-Qurʾān / ʻAbd al-Wahhāb ibn Muḥammad al-Ḥusaynī. -- 1687.
record.note: For the author see Brockelmann, II, 132.

record.title: Taʾrīkh unmūdhaj al-Yaman. -- [17--?].

record.title: ʻUddat al-akyās / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Sharafī. -- 1649.
record.note: For the author see Brockelmann, S II, p. 550.
The title, as above, appears in the incipit; the title on leaf 1 recto reads: al-Sharḥ al-ṣaghīr ʻalá al-Asās.
Yemenite naskhī, in red and black.

record.title: al-Bahjah al-marḍīyah [fī] sharḥ al-Bahjah [al-Wardīyah] : al-juzʼ al-awwal / [Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥīm al-ʻIrāqī]. -- 1462.
record.note: The identification of the author and title is uncertain. The title is given in the colophon as: Sharḥ al-Bahjah.
C. Landberg thought that this might be the work of ʻImād al-Dīn Ismāʻīl ibn Ibrāhīm ibn Sharaf al-Qudsī (d. A.H. 852), mentioned by Ḥājjī Khalīfah, III, 10.
The British museum copy of the 1st volume of al-Bahjah al-marḍīyah (cat. no. 897) also ends with the bāb al-farāʼiḍ.
Fair naskhī, in red and black.
Loose in Islamic binding, in brown, flap missing.

record.title: Futuwwah fī al-shadd wa-al-ʻahd wa-akhdh al-mashyakhah ʻalá ahl al-ṭarāʾiq wa-al-siyādāt wa-ahālī al-amānāt. -- 1693.
record.note: Leaf 1 is supplied by a later hand, and the title, as above, may not be genuine.
Coarse naskhī.
Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.
For similar works on Sufi futuwwah cf. Berlin catalog, 3375-3381.

record.title: Shajarat al-shaqīq fī ʻilm uṣūl al-ṭarīq / Niʻmat Allāh ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Zuhrī. -- 1707.

record.title: al-Tafāwuḍ fī al-tanāquḍ / Maḥmūd ibn Ḥamzah al-Dimashqī. -- [1884].
record.note: C. Landberg's catalogue states that this (and Landberg MSS 472) is the "Original des Verfassers." The handwriting however is the same as that of Landberg MSS 769, which is signed by the copyist and dated A.H. 1302 (A.D. 1884); all three manuscripts were probably copied at the smae time, and the colophon of Landberg MSS 769 presumably refers to them all.
Good naskhī, in red and black.

record.title: al-Durrah al-muntakhabah fī al-adwiyah al-mufīdah al-mujarrabah / ʻAbd al-Qādir ibn ... Aḥmad ibn Ḥasan al-Muwaqqarī. -- 1618.
record.note: Author and title, as above, are given in a later hand on leaf 1 recto. The same name occurs in the colophon as that of the owner of this copy, and the later owner's ex-libris also seems to imply that al-Muwaqqarī was the owner. Both author and title are therefore highly suspect.
al-Muwaqqar is a town in Syria (Yāqūt, Marāṣid, ed. Juynboll).
Fair naskhī, in red and black, apparently by more than one hand.
Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.

For the meaning of the last word in the title cf. Scheltema, p. 46, footnote 3.
Paged by the author as 225p.
Photograph of the author mounted on leaf preceding title-page.
Cursive hand, in red and blue.

Yemenite naskhī, in red and black.

record.title: [Musnad] / ʻan kull shaykh min mashāʾikh Abī ʻAlī al-Ḥasan ibn Aḥmad ibn Ibrāhīm ibn Shādhān al-Bazzāz. -- [10--?].
record.note: A certificate on leaf 14 recto relating to persons who heard these traditions from al-Samnānī who heard them from Ibn Shādhān is dated A.H. 493, so that Ibn Shādhān must have lived about that time.
Good naskhī.
Islamic binding, paper covered.

record.title: al-Tanbīh al-fāʾiq ʻalá khalal al-wathāʾiq / Maḥmūd ibn Ḥamzah al-Dimashqī. -- 1885.
record.note: Also known as: Risālah fī ḥalāl al-maḥāḍir wa-al-sijillāt (Brockelmann).

This manuscript, and Landberg MSS 472, 739 and 770, seem to be parts of one codex copied at the same time by the same copyist. C. Landberg called Landberg MSS 472 and 739 "Originale des Verfassers;" in the entry for this manuscript, however, the same statement was rightly crossed off.
Fair naskhī, in red and black.

record.title: Kashf al-majānah ʻan al-ghasl fī al-ijjānah / Maḥmūd ibn Ḥamzah al-Dimashqī. -- 1885.
record.note: This is apparently one and the same codex with Landberg MSS 769, and the colophon of the latter (where the whole is termed majmūʻ) evidently refers to the whole.
Fair naskhī, in red and black.
With: 4 other titles.

record.title: Taṣḥīḥ al-nuqūl fī samāʻ daʻwá al-marʾah kull al-muʻajjal baʻda al-dukhūl / Maḥmūd ibn Ḥamzah al-Dimashqī. -- 1885.
record.note: Fair naskhī, in red and black.
With: 4 other titles.

record.title: Kashf al-sutūr ʻan ṣiḥḥat al-muhāyāt fī al-maʾjūr / Maḥmūd ibn Ḥamzah al-Dimashqī. -- 1885.
record.note: Fair naskhī, in red and black.
With: 4 other titles.

record.title: [Radd ʻalá mā ḥarrarahu ʻAbd al-Sattār Efendī fī amr al-qiṣāṣ] / Maḥmūd ibn Ḥamzah al-Dimashqī. -- 1885.
record.note: Fair naskhī, in red and black.
With: 4 other titles.

record.title: al-Ikhbār ʻan ḥaqq al-qarār / Maḥmūd ibn Ḥamzah al-Dimashqī. -- 1885.
record.note: Fair naskhī, in red and black.
With: 4 other titles.

record.title: al-Iklīl / al-Ḥasan ibn Aḥmad al-Hamdānī. -- 1872.
record.note: Yemenite naskhī, in red and black.
Other volumes wanting.

record.title: al-Iklīl / al-Ḥasan ibn Aḥmad al-Hamdānī. -- [1800?].
record.note: Fairly modern (ca. 1800) Yemenite hand, in yellow and black.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.

record.title: Manār al-anwār fī uṣūl al-fiqh / ʻAbd Allāh ibn Aḥmad al-Nasafī. -- 1364.
record.note: Fair naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.

record.title: Tuḥfat al-aḥbāb fī al-sulūk ilá ṭarīq al-aṣḥāb / Aḥmad al-Ṭarabizūnī. -- 1851.
record.note: Brockelmann does not give the author and title of the commentary, but the manuscript listed in British Museum Suppl. 244:1, referred to there, is the same work as in this manuscript.
al-Baghdādī has a different incipit, presumably absent in the copy from which leaf 1 was supplied. The British Museum copy's incipit is same as al-Baghdādī's.
Good naskhī, in red and black. Leaf 1 supplied by a later hand.
Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.

record.title: Arbaʻūn ḥadīthan / takhrīj al-ḥāfiẓ Fakhr al-Dīn Abī Muḥammad ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Baʻlī al-Ḥanbalī. -- [13--?].
record.note: Hasty 14th century hand, in red and black.
With: 5 other titles.

record.title: Kitāb al-jumaʻ / Aḥmad ibn Shuʻayb al-Nasāʾī. -- [before 1482].
record.note: For Kitāb al-sunan see Brockelmann, I, 163; S I, pp. 269-270; Hitti, 1367.
Hasty hand, in red and black.
al-Sakhāwī's autograph compared with Landberg MSS 234 (leaves 144-165).
With: 5 other titles.

record.title: al-Iṣṭilāḥāt al-Ṣūfīyah / Muḥyī al-Dīn [ibn al-ʻArabī]. -- [before 1410].
record.note: Title on leaf 25 recto: Ḥudūd al-Ṣūfīyah.
Compared with Bankipore catalog, XIII, 886.
Fair naskhī.
With: 5 other titles.

record.title: Maḥāsin al-majālis / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-ʻArīf. -- [14--?].
record.note: Fair 15th century naskhī.
With: 5 other titles.

record.title: Aḥādīth wa-ḥikāyāt wa-ashʻār / Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Wāḥid ibn Aḥmad al-Maqdisī. -- 1395.
record.note: Title on leaf 774: juzʾ fīhi aḥādīth ʻawālī wa-ḥikāyāt wa-ashʻār.
For the author see Brockelmann, I, 398; S I, p. 690.
Cursive hand.
With: 5 other titles.

record.title: Juzʾ fī muḥallal al-mus[ābaqah]. -- [13--?].
record.note: Old (14th century?) cursive hand.
With: 5 other titles.

record.title: 880-02 Minhāj al-ibtihāj bi-sharḥ Muslim ibn al-Ḥajjāj : [al-juzʼ al-awwal] / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Qasṭallānī. -- 1701.
record.note: Incomplete at beginning.
According to Ḥājjī Khalīfah, the author did not finish the commentary.
Incipit: Incomplete at beginning; folio 1a begins: "... lā yumkinu al-ʻabd an yunshiʼa jamīʻ al-maḥāmid minhu wa-min ghayrihi wa-hādhā qawl al-Muʻtazilah ..."
Fair naskhī, in red, green, and black.
Loose in Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.

Colophon: "Tamma ... ʻalá yad ... Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻUthmān al-shahīr bi-al-Baḥr yawm al-Ithnayn al-mubārak, sādis shahr Muḥarram al-ḥarām, iftitāḥ sanat thalāthah ʻashar wa-miʼah wa-alf."

Translation of the colophon: "It was completed ... by the hand of ... Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻUthmān, known as al-Baḥr, on blessed Monday, the sixth of the sacred month of al-Muḥarram, the beginning of the year 1113 [of the Hijrah = 13 June 1701]."

record.title: 880-02 ʻUnwān al-sharaf al-wāfī / Ismāʻīl ibn Abī Bakr ibn al-Muqrī. -- 1881.
record.note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ... al-Ḥamdu lillāh walī al-ḥamd wa-mustaḥiqqihi alldhī lā yaqūmu bi-ḥamdihi aḥadun min khalqihi ..."
Yemenite naskhī, in red and black; full-page ʻunwāns in colors on leaves 1 verso and 2 recto.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.
The scribe's and owner's names are defaced.

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min raqmihi ẓuhr yawm al-Sabt ākhir yawm min shahr al-Muḥarram ... sanat thamāniyah wa-tisʻīn wa-miʼatayn baʻda al-alf ... wa-dhālika bi-khaṭṭ ... ʻAlī ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī ibn Aḥmad ibn Jābir ibn Aḥmad ibn Jābir [?] ibn Jābir ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān min nasl ʻUbādah ibn al-Ṣāmit al-Khazrajī ..."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy was completed at noon, on Saturday, the end of the month of al-Muḥarram ... of the year 1298 [of the Hijrah = 2 January 1881] ... in the handwriting of ... ʻAlī ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī ibn Aḥmad ibn Jābir ibn Aḥmad ibn Jābir [?] ibn Jābir ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān, of the progeny of ʻUbādah ibn al-Ṣāmit al-Khazrajī ..."

record.title: 880-03 Maʻālim al-tanzīl : al-juzʼ [al-thālith] / al-Ḥusayn ibn Masʻūd al-Baghawī. -- 1852.
record.note: Volume IV of the same set is Landberg MSS 767.
Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Subḥāna alladhī asrá bi-ʻabdihi laylan. Subḥān Allāh tanzīh Allāh taʻālá min kull sūʼ ..."
Yemenite naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min raqm hādhā al-juzʼ al-mubārak nahār al-Jumʻah min shahr Jumād Awwal, yawm khalat thamān ayyām, sanat thamāniyah wa-sittīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf, 1268, bi-khaṭṭ ... Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Ḥājj ʻAlī, min ʻIzlat Jabal Ṣabrān ... wa-kāna dhālika bi-rasm al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Rabb ibn Qāsim Saʻīd Nuʻmān al-Sharjī."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy of this blessed part was completed on Friday, eight days having passed from the month of Jumād Awwal, of the year 1268 [of the Hijrah = 29 February 1852], in the handwriting ... of Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Ḥājj ʻAlī, of ʻIzlat Jabal Ṣabrān ... for al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Rabb ibn Qāsim Saʻīd Nuʻmān al-Sharjī."

record.title: 880-01 al-Qawāʻid al-Imāmīyah. -- 1764.
record.note: Ibn Abī al-Rijāl (Brockelmann, S II, p. 561) is presumably merely the copyist of the prototype of this manuscript.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ... Allāhumma innī aḥmaduka wa-al-ḥamdu min naʻmāʼika, wa-ashkuruka wa-al-shukru min ʻaṭāʼika ... wa-asʼaluka an ... tajʻala mā ʻazza minnā ʻalayhi min taʼlīf hādhihi al-qawāʻid ʻiddatan wa-dhukhratan li-yawm liqāʼika ... qāʻidat al-fiqh lughat al-fahm ..."
Coarse Yemenite naskhī.
Islamic binding, paper covered, with flap.

Colophon: "Qāla fī al-umm al-manqūl ʻalayhā bi-khaṭṭ al-Qāḍī Aḥmad ibn Ṣāliḥ ibn Abī al-Rijāl: Najaza mā wajadnāhu min Kitāb al-Qawāʻid al-Imāmīyah, wa-laʻallahu yaʻnī nafsahu ... wa-taʻammadtu kitābat hādhā al-kitāb, wa-in lam yakun min kutub madhhabinā, li-maqāṣid ʻiddah ... bi-khaṭṭ ... Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Ḥidrī (?) al-Iṣāmī (?) ... Intahá al-naql ṣubḥ yawm al-Aḥad, salkh shahr al-Ḥijjah al-ḥarām, sanat 1177.

Translation of the colophon: "He said in the 'mother' (prototype) [copy] which was transcribed in the handwriting of al-Qāḍī Aḥmad ibn Ṣāliḥ ibn Abī al-Rijāl: Completed is what we found of 'Kitāb al-Qawāʻid al-Imāmīyah' (Book of Imāmī doctrines). However, he might only mean himself ... I purposely wrote this book, although it is not of the books of our doctrine, for different intents ... [Copied] in the handwriting of ... Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Ḥidrī (?) al-Iṣāmī (?) ... The copy was completed on Sunday morning, the end of the sacred month of al-Ḥijjah, of the year 1177 [of the Hijrah = 30 June 1764]."

record.title: 880-02 al-Aḥkām al-sulṭānīyah / ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Māwardī. -- 1629.
record.note: A poem preceding the colophon is signed Aḥmad ibn Mūsá (the scribe?).

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla aqḍá al-quḍāh Abū al-Ḥasan ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥabīb al-Māwardī al-Baṣrī ... al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī awḍaḥa lanā maʻālim al-dīn wa-manna ʻalaynā bi-al-Kitāb al-Mubīn ..."
Fair naskhī, in red and black.
Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min raqmihi ḍuḥá nahār al-Arbiʻāʼ, al-yawm al-thāmin ʻashar min shahr Dhī al-Ḥijjah ... sanat thamān wa-thalāthīn wa-alf ..."
Translation of the colophon: "The copy was completed on Wednesday morning, the eighteenth day of the month of Dhū al-Ḥijjah ... of the year 1038 [of the Hijrah = 8 August 1629] ..."

record.title: 880-01 [Majmūʻat Aḥādīth]. -- [15--?].
record.note: Incipit: "Min Ḥadīth Bishr ibn Maṭar ʻan Sufyān ibn ʻUyaynah: Thanā Muḥammad, thanā Naṣr, thanā Qutaybah, thanā Bakr ibn Muḍar, ʻan ʻUbayd Allāh ibn Zuḥar, ʻan ʻAlī [ibn] Yazīd, ʻan al-Qāsim, ʻan Abī Umāmah, ʻan Ibn Masʻūd, qāl: Inn Allāh ... yaʻruḍu aʻmāl banī Ādam fī kull yawm Khamīs ithnayn ..."
Two or more fairly old (16th century) scholar's hands.

record.title: 880-02 Kashf al-ghawāmiḍ fī ʻilm al-ḥisāb wa-al-farāʼiḍ / Badr al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad sibṭ al-Māridīnī al-Shāfiʻī. -- 1484.
record.note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ḥamda al-shākirīn ... Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu Muḥammad Sibṭ al-Māridīnī al-Shāfiʻī: Hādhā kitāb fī ʻilm al-ḥisāb wa-al-farāʼiḍ ..."
Good naskhī, in red and black.
Loose in Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.
