Translation of the colophon: "The copy was completed by the hand of ... Ḥusayn ibn Ḥazm, in the city of Bilighirād [Belgrade (?), Serbia (?)], in the year 1035 [of the Hijrah = 1625/1626]."

record.title: 880-03 al-Risālah al-Sharafīyah fī al-nisab al-taʼlīfīyah / ʻAbd al-Muʼmin ibn Yūsuf al-Urmawī. -- [after 1268].
record.note: Treatise on music.
Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ... Aḥmadu Allāh ʻalá ālāʼihi, wa-ashkuruhu ʻalá sawābigh naʻmāʼihi ..."
Calligraphic naskhī.
Copious diagrams.
Islamic binding, in brown.
"Wa-tammat al-risālah ... bi-yad muʼallifihi, fī awākhir Jumādá al-Awwal, sanat sitt wa-sittīn wa-sittimiʼah."
Translation of the colophon: "The epistle was completed ... in the hand of its author, at the end of Jumādá al-Awwal, of the year 666 [of the Hijrah = 23 February 1268]."

record.title: 880-03 al-Kāfī fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qawāfī / Shihāb al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn ʻAbbād al-Qināʼī. -- [17--?].
record.note: Treatise on prosody.
Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-inʻām, wa-al-shukru la-hu ʻalá al-ilhām ..."
Fair modern (18th century?) naskhī, in red and black.
With: 2 other titles.

record.title: 880-02 al-ʻArūḍ al-Andalusī / Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad al-maʻrūf bi-Abī al-Jaysh al-Anṣārī al-Andalusī. -- [17--?].
record.note: Treatise on prosody.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla ... Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad al-maʻrūf bi-Abī al-Jaysh al-Anṣārī al-Andalusī: Aḥmadu Allāh wa-atawakkalu ʻalayhi ... Wa-baʻd, fa-qad qaṣadtu fī hādhā al-mukhtaṣar an adhkura ʻilal al-aʻārīḍ ..."
Fair modern (18th century?) naskhī, in red and black.
With: 2 other titles.

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Risālah al-Andalusīyah / ʻAbd al-Muḥsin al-Qayṣarī. -- [17--?].
record.note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Aḥmadu Allāh ʻalá an qaṣara salāmat al-ṭabʻ ʻalá nawʻ al-insān ..."
Fair modern (18th century?) naskhī, in red and black.
With: 2 other titles.

record.title: 880-02 Fatḥ al-Wakīl al-Kāfī / Aḥmad ibn Aḥmad al-Sujāʻī. -- [before 1843].
record.note: For the author see: Brockelmann, S II, p. 445 (surname spelled al-Sijāʻī; Brockelmann, II, 323 has Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Sajjāʻī).
Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī basaṭa qulūb aḥibbatihi bi-al-asrār wa-al-maʻārif ..."
Coarse modern naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, paper-covered, with flap.
Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min tamām hādhā al-shar[ḥ] yawm al-Aḥad ... fī shahr ... al-Muḥarram ..."
Translation of the colophon: "This commentary was completed on Sunday ... in the month of al-Muḥarram ..."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Qaṣīdah al-Khazrajīyah / Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Sharīf al-Andalusī. -- 1813.
record.note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī bi-ḥamdihi nastaftiḥu, wa-Huwa al-fattāḥ al-ʻalīm ..."
Good naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in black.

Colophon: "Waqaʻa al-farāgh min naskhihi ʻalá yad ... Ghālib ibn Yūsuf al-Shidyāq, wa-qad qābalahu akhūhu Anṭūniyūs muqābalatan ṣaḥīḥah, wa-dhālika fī aḥad ʻashar yawman min Aylūl, sanat alf wa-thamānimiʼah wa-thalāth ʻashrah Masīḥīyah."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy was completed by the hand of ... Ghālib ibn Yūsuf al-Shidyāq, and it was correctly collated by his brother Anṭūniyūs, on 11 Aylūl [September] of the Christian year 1813."

record.title: 880-02 Kitāb al-nabāt : [al-juzʼ al-thālith] / Abū Ḥanīfah Aḥmad ibn Dāwūd al-Dīnawarī. -- 1247.
record.note: Manual of botany.
Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn ... wa-min āfāt al-ḥarth wa-al-nakhl al-jirdān ..."
Fair naskhī, fully vocalized.
Islamic binding, paper-covered, with flap.
Colophon: "ʻAllaqahu ʻAbd Allāh ibn Sālim ibn al-Ḥaḍir al-Māridīnī sanat khams wa-arbaʻīn wa-sitimiʼah Hijrīyah fī Ṣafarihā ..."
Translation of the colophon: "Copied by ʻAbd Allāh ibn Sālim ibn al-Ḥaḍir al-Māridīnī in Ṣafar of the year 645 of the Hijrah [June/July 1247] ..."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥayāt al-ḥayawān al-kubrá / Muḥammad ibn Mūsá al-Damīrī. -- 1729.
record.note: Princeton has a shorter version.
Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ... al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī sharrafa nawʻ al-insān bi-al-aṣgharayn al-qalb wa-al-lisān ..."
Two fair naskhī hands, in red and black.
Islamic bindings, paper-covered, with flaps.

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah yawm al-Arbaʻ al-mubārak, al-thānī min al-ʻushr al-thānī min al-shahr al-sādis, min al-ʻām al-ḥādī, min al-ʻaqd al-khāmis, min al-qarn al-thānī ʻashar ... ʻalá yad ... Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn Ḥamādah al-Manzilī [?] ..."

Translation of the colophon: "This copy was completed on blessed Wednesday, the second day of the second tenth of the sixth month of the first year, of the fifth decade of the twelfth century [5 Jumādá al-Thāniyah, 1141 of the Hijrah = 6 January 1729] ... by the hand of ... Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn Ḥamādah al-Manzilī [?] ..."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Asbāb wa-al-ʻalāmāt / Nafīs ibn ʻIwaḍ. -- [16--?].
record.note: For the author see: Brockelmann, S II, p. 299 (date of death - S I, p. 895).
Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām al-atammān ʻalá man yudāwī al-arwāḥ bi-ṭibb al-ḥaqīqah ..."
Fairly modern (17th century?) naskhī; last leaf supplied by a later hand.
Islamic binding, paper-covered, with flap.

record.title: 880-03 al-Lumʻah al-Māridīnīyah fī sharḥ al-Yāsamīnīyah / Badr al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad Sibṭ al-Māridīnī. -- [17--?].
record.note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ... al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī aḥṣá kull al-ashyāʼ ʻadadan ..."
Modern (18th century?) naskhī, in red and black.
Possible manuscript note by Eli Smith.
Colophon: "Katabahu ... Muḥammad abū Yūsuf ..."
Translation of the colophon: "Copied by ... Muḥammad abū Yūsuf ..."

record.title: 880-02 Tawḍīḥ li-maqāṣid Alfīyat Ibn Mālik / al-Ḥasan ibn Qāsim al-Murādī ibn Umm Qāsim. -- [17--?].
record.note: Line 791 is according to de Sacy's edition of al-Alfīyah.
Binder's title wrongly attributes the work to Ibn Hishām.
Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu wa-al-shukr la-hu ... Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā tawḍīḥ li-maqāṣid Alfīyat Ibn Mālik ..."
Fairly modern (18th century?) nastaʻliq, in red and black.

record.title: 880-02 Faṣl al-khiṭāb fī uṣūl lughat al-Aʻrāb / Nāṣīf al-Yāzijī. -- [18--].
record.note: Arabic grammar.
His father's name is given in the explicit of this manuscript.
Brockelmann spells al-Yāzījī, but this manuscript has al-Yāzijī.
Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Fattāḥ. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī ʻilmuhu yastaghriqu al-asmāʼ wa-al-afʻāl ..."
Fair 19th century naskhī, in red and black.
Colophon: "Qad ʻallaqahu bi-yadihi al-ḥaqīr Mulḥim ibn Ibrāhīm al-Shiblī."
Translation of the colophon: "Copied by the hand of the wretched Mulḥim ibn Ibrāhīm al-Shiblī."

record.title: Rasāʼil / Muḥammad the Prophet. -- [before 1857].
record.note: Copied before 1857.
Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Fa-qad warada annahu kāna hādhā maktūban fī al-lawḥ al-maḥfūẓ ..."
Modern naskhī.
Colophon: "Qad nuqila dhālika min majmūʻah munshaʼat Farīdūn Bik al-maṭbūʻ fī awāʼil shahr Jumādá al-Ākhirah, sanat arbaʻ wa-sittīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf ... 1264."

Translation of the colophon: "This was transcribed from the collection of the foundation of Farīdūn Bik which was printed in the beginning of Jumādá al-Ākhirah, of the year 1264 [of the Hijrah = 5 May 1848]."

record.title: 880-03 al-Mawāhib al-ladunīyah bi-al-minaḥ al-Muḥammadīyah : [al-juzʼ al-thānī] / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Qasṭallānī. -- 1717.
record.note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ... al-Maqṣad al-khāmis fī takhṣīṣihi, ʻalayhi al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, bi-khaṣāʼiṣ al-Miʻrāj wa-al-Isrāʼ ..."
Fair naskhī, in red and black.

Colophon: "Tamma ... ʻalá yad kātibihi ... Muṣṭafá ibn al-Shaykh Muḥammad Ḥamīdah al-Qādirī ... Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskh hādhā al-kitāb ... yawm al-khamīs ... al-sādis min shahr Shaʻbān ... sanat 1129 ..."

Translation of the colophon: "It was completed ... by the hand of its copyist ... Muṣṭafá ibn al-Shaykh Muḥammad Ḥamīdah al-Qādirī ... The copy of this book was completed ... on Thursday ... the sixth [day] of the month of Shaʻbān ... of the year 1129 [of the Hijrah = 16 July 1717] ..."

record.title: 880-02 al-Durr al-maṣūn fī ʻulūm al-kitāb al-maknūn : al-juzʼ al-thālith / Shihāb al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn Yūsuf ibn al-Samīn. -- [14--?].
record.note: The title (1r) has taʼwīl for ʻulūm.
Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ... Sūrat al-Māʼidah. Qad taqaddama naẓīr qawlihi: Yā ayyuhā alladhīn āmanū awfū. Wa-al-bahīmah kull dhāt arbaʻ fī al-barr wa-al-baḥr ..."
Coarse old (15th century?) naskhī, in red and black.
On the title page (1r), the scribe had written originally al-juzʼ al-thānī, and then corrected the error.
Lettered on spine "Kifâyat fî al-Hidâyat", which is the title of Salisbury MSS 90, leaves 57-259.
Colophon: "Intahá al-juzʼ al-thālith, wa-huwa niṣf al-kitāb ... Wa-ʻallaqahu li-nafsihi ... Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm al-Shubaykī [?] ..."
Translation of the colophon: "The third part is completed; it is half of the book ... Copied by Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm al-Shubaykī [?] for himself ..."

record.title: 880-02 al-Bidāyah min al-Kifāyah / Abū ʻAbd Allāh Aḥmad ibn [Maḥmūd ibn] Muḥammad al-Ṣābūnī al-Bukhārī. -- [ca. 1332].
record.note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ... al-Ḥamdu lillāh dhī al-jalāl wa-al-ikrām ... Qāla al-Shaykh ... Abū ʻAbd Allāh Aḥmad ibn [Maḥmūd ibn] Muḥammad al-Ṣābūnī al-Bukhārī ... Wa-baʻd, lammā tayassara lī al-farāgh ... min kitāb al-Kifāyah fī al-hidāyah, iltamasa minnī baʻḍ al-aṣḥāb an ulakhkhiṣa minhu mā huwa al-ʻumdah ..."
Good naskhī, in red and black.
With: 1 other title.

record.title: 880-02 al-Kifāyah fī al-hidāyah / Nūr al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn Maḥmūd al-Ṣābūnī. -- 1332.
record.note: Incipit: The biginning is missing; text starts with: "... ʻilm wa-manshaʼ kull saʻādah. Wa-li-hādhā usammī ʻilm al-uṣūl ..."
Good naskhī, in red and black.

Hitti, under no. 862, capitalizes al-Hidāyah, as if the meaning were "commentary on the Hidāyah", but this seems to be an error; Brockelmann does not capitalize it, and the word seems to mean here "guidance (to true faith)."
Brockelmann's reference to "Pet. AM Buch. 143" belongs under the abridgment al-Bidāyah.
With: 1 other title.
Colophon: "Wa-waʼfaqa al-farāgh min taʻlīqihi fī al-thāmin ʻashar min Ṣafar, sanat thalāth wa-thalāthīn wa-sabʻimiʼah."
Translation of the colophon: "The copy was completed on the eighteenth of the month of Ṣafar, of the year 733 [of the Hijrah = 16 November 1332]."

record.title: 880-01 Risālah fī maʻrifat sirr diyānat al-Durūz. -- [18--].
record.note: A Druze catechism.
Incipit: "S. Adurizīyun anta. J. Naʻam bi-niʻmat Mawlānā al-Ḥākim, Subḥānuhu ..."
Good 19th century naskhī, on light blue paper.

record.title: 880-01 Majmūʻat rasāʼil fī al-Ismāʻīlīyah wa-al-Qarāmiṭah. -- [18--].
record.note: Modern 19th century naskhī, in red and black.

The first text in this volume was extracted from a book obtained by the Rev. Eli Smith from Mekhaîl Meshâka of Damascus. The second text was obtained through the courtesy of Louis von Wildenbruch, Prussian Consul General of Syria (died before Oct. 25, 1849), whose dragoman, Mr. Catafago, found it near Aleppo. The third text was also obtained through von Wildenbruch.

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Muʻallaqāt / al-Ḥusayn ibn ʻAlī ibn Aḥmad ibn al-Ḥusayn al-Zawzanī. -- 1848.
record.note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-Imām ... al-Ḥusayn [ibn ʻAlī] ibn Aḥmad ibn al-Ḥusayn al-Zawzanī ... Hādhā Sharḥ al-Qaṣāʼid al-sabʻ amlaytuhu ʻalá ḥadd al-ījāz wa-al-ikhtiṣār ..."
Calligraphic naskhī, in red and black, on variously colored paper.
Islamic binding, in red, with flap.
Colophon: "ʻUlliqat biyad ... Faraj Allāh ibn Niʻmat Allāh Makhzūmah, wa-dhālika fī ibtidāʼ shahr Ḥazīrān al-mubārak sanat alf wa-thamānimiʼah wa-thamāniyah wa-arbaʻūn Masīḥīyah."
Translation of the colophon: "Copied by the hand of ... Faraj Allāh ibn Niʻmat Allāh Makhzūmah, in the blessed month of Ḥazīrān, of the Christian year 1848."

record.title: 880-02 al-ʻIqd al-farīd : al-juzʼ al-thālith / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Rabbih. -- [15--?].
record.note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Anshada baʻḍuhum abyātan yamdaḥu fīhā ʻUmar wa-yastaʻṭifuhu. Fa-lammā qaraʼahā ʻUmar amar bi-iṭlāqihi ʻammā salafa minhu ..."
Two fairly old (16th century?) hands, an older one (1-10r) and a younger one (10v-168).
Incipit corresponds to the printed edition (A.H. 1293) III, 128; leaf 166 corresponds to III, 246; leaves 167-168 have not been identified; there are lacunae in the text also.

record.title: 880-03 Dīwān al-Jaʻbarī / Ibrāhīm ibn Abī Bakr al-Jaʻbarī al-Ṣūfī. -- 1851.
record.note: Collected poems.
Ascribed in the incipit to Ibrāhīm ibn Miʻḍād al-Jaʻbarī (died 1289).

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-Shaykh al-wariʻ al-zāhid man ẓaharat karāmātuhu wa-shāʻat barakātuhu, al-Quṭb al-Rabbānī, wa-al-haykal al-ṣamadānī, Sayyidī al-ʻārif billāh taʻālá, al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm ibn Abī Bakr al-Jaʻbarī al-Ṣūfī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-barakātihi wa-barakāt ʻulūmihi wa-madadihi fī al-dīn wa-al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah. Āmīn. Yā Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Qāla, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu: Aḍḥá muḥibbuka sākiba al-ʻabarāti // yā man mamātī fī hawāhu ḥayātī. Wa-saqaytanī min kaʼsi ḥubbika shurbatan // fa-sakirtu minhu wa-ṭāba fīhi mamātī. Ghannā bi-dhikrika yā ḥabībī munshidī // fa-ṭaribtu ʻinda ḥalāwati al-naghamāti ..."
Secundo folio: Wa-waqftu fī bābi al-maḥabbati khāḍiʻan.
Good naskhī, in red and black.
With autograph note by Iskander Yaʻqūb Abkāriyūs.
Compared with Berlin catalog 7890 and Gotha 2311; the incipit is the same, but the explicit in Berlin catalog seems to belong to an additional poem.
On folio 1a: "Dīwān al-Imām al-ʻālim al-humām Ibrāhīm ibn Abī Bakr al-Jaʻbarī. M."
At the head of folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Khāṣṣat al-faqīr Iskandar Yaʻqūb Abkāriyūs. Sanat 1851. Uʻṭiya ilá ṣadīqihi al-Siniyūr ʻĀlī Simīth."

Colophon: "Tamma al-Dīwān al-mubārak bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-kāna al-najāz min naskhihi fī awākhir Tishrīn al-Thānī, sanat 1851 lil-Masīḥ, ʻan yad nāsikhihi Mīkhāʼīl ʻArab al-Shalfūn, bi-ism al-khill al-ḥabīb al-Khawājā Iskandar Yaʻqūb Āghā. M." Under the colophon, two verses of poetry, a request for the reader: "Billāhi in naẓarat ʻaynāka mā katabat // yadu al-faqīri ilá ghufrāni Mawlāhu. Fa-iqraʼ la-hu muhdiyan Umm al-Kitābi wa-qul // Allāhu yajʻalu Dāra al-Khuldi maʼwāhu."

Translation of the colophon: "The blessed Dīwān was completed by the praise of God, His help, and His abundant benevolence. This copy was completed at the end of Tishrīn al-Thāni [November], of the year 1851 of Christ, by the hand of Mīkhāʼīl ʻArab al-Shalfūn, for the beloved friend al-Khawājā Iskandar Yaʻqūb Āghā. M." Under the colophon a request for the reader of the Dīwān, in two verses of poetry, as follows: "By God if your eyes were to look at // what the hand of the poor to the forgiveness of his Lord wrote. Recite on for him 'Umm al-Kitāb' [al-Fātiḥah] and say // May God make the 'Eternal Abode' his resting place."

record.title: 880-01 Qiṣṣat ʻAbd Allāh ibn Nāfiʻ. -- 1799.
record.note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Ḥukiya, wa-Allāh aʻlam, annhu kāna ʻinda al-Malik al-Rashīd, nadīm min jumlat nudamāih, ismuhu ʻAbd Allāh ibn Nāfiʻ, wa-kān ghuṭib ʻalayhi al-Malik al-Rashīd. Wa-sabab ghaṭabihi annahu ṭalabahu fī baʻẓ al-layālī, fa-mā atá. Fa-aṣbaḥ atāhu ṭawāshī, wa-qāl: Ḥaḍrat Amīr al-Muʼminīn ghaḍib lākin nak mā atayt. Fa-khāfa ʻAbd Allāh min saṭwat al-malik wa-kharaj min Baghdād. Wa-lam yazal sāyir yaqṭaʻ al-bilād ḥattá waṣala ilá Qashmīr al-Hind, wa-kāna bi-hā malik ismuhu Jamʻaṣ ..."
Secundo folio: baṭal humām wa-asad ḍirghām.
Coarse naskhī.

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh minhu yawm al-thalāthah. Fa-kamulat fī 27 Muḥarram, fī sanat 1214. Fa-tammat al-ḥikāyah ʻalá yad al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá, Murshid ibn Maqdisī Yūsuf Qahrānī."

Translation of the colophon: "It was completed on Tuesday. Completed on 27 Muḥarram, in the year 1214 [of the Hijrah = 1 July 1799]. The tale was completed by the hand of the poor to God Almighty, Murshid ibn Maqdisī Yūsuf Qahrānī."

record.title: 880-01 Majmūʻat ashʻār. -- [18--].
record.note: Incipit: "Raṣd. Dhā al-hajr lammā yāman ghazā bi-al-muqali // ṣabrī ʻadamā wa-qad tawālat ʻilalī ..."
Secundo folio: Ṭalʻatu al-badr al-mufaddá khaṭafat minnā al-qulūb.
Modern (19th century) naskhī.
On fly-leaf: "Presented to me by Rev. Eli Smith of Beirut. E.E.S."

record.title: 880-01 Majmūʻat rasāʼil Fārisīyah wa-Turkīyah : manuscript.
record.note: Binding: In dark brown leather with flap; cover embossed with central medallion and corner design; cover and flap framed in gold.
In fair small naskhī, in red and black.
The scribe was (according to a manuscript note by M. Reinaud, attached to front cover) "ci-devant ambassadeur de la Porte Othomane en France et plus tard grand vizir."
Colophon: "Ḥarrarahu al-faqīr Muḥammad Ghālib kātib qalam Dīwān Hamāyūn fī al-Bārīs, fī 3 L sanat 225."
Translation of the colphon: "Transcribed by the poor Muḥammad Ghālib, the penman at the Royal Bureau in Paris, on 3 Shawwāl, of the year 225 [of the Hijrah = 1 November 1810]."

record.title: American gentleman’s Ottoman travel permit.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.
Layout: Single columns of 9 diagonal lines.
Script: Dīwānī.
The document signed in H. 1 Safar 1251/29 May 1835.

The American nobleman in question may be identified as Horatio Southgate (d. 1894) who documented his journey to Gümüşhane, which he undertook with a similar travel permit from the Ottoman Sultan. Compare: Southgate, H. Narrative of a Tour Through Armenia, Kurdistan, Persia and Mesopotamia, p. 146.
Later hand annotations on top right of the document: Buyruldu (بيورلدي), a passport from a pasha.

record.title: Syriac tracts : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Binding: In marbled cardboard; black leather on spine and corners; spine tooled with gold horizontal lines and printed with the title "Nestorian tracts" also in gold.
Good modern East Syriac (Nestorian) script, European paper.

record.title: al-Mustaṭraf min kull fann mustaẓraf / [Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Ibshīhī]. -- 1725.
record.note: Fine naskhī, in red and black.
Islamic binding, in red, with flap.

record.title: 880-01 Ktābā da-qdām wad-bātar. -- 1838 or 1839.
record.note: Incipit: "ʻAl ḥaylā lā ḥāšūšā mšare ʻabdā ḥalāšā l-mektab lam ṭaksā mparšā da-šḥímā awkít d-ramšā. Ant Malkā Mšíḥā ríšā hab ḥaylā b-pagrā u-napšā d-netmanʻún l-waʻdā mqadšā b-ʻudrān Abúk Qadíšā wab-súwaḥ Rúḥā d-Qúdšā ..."
Secundo folio: Qadmāyat marmítā d-kúlah šabtā.
Good Nestorian script in black and red.
2 full-page vignettes in colors.
In front of this volume is bound a manuscript description of this manuscript by Dr. A. Martigny, who gives the date erroneously as 2141.

Colophon: "... Šlem ... Ktābā hānā da-qdām wad-bātar ... b-yarḥā bríka Kānún Ḥrāy l-kh ... ba-shnāt aaqna l-Yawnāye ... etktāb dén ba-qrítā ... Síre kād mpāšaq hú ktābā l-wot Qāšíša Perkins ... ktāb dén ... Mšamšānā Yósef bar mnāḥā Abrāhām bār Dúmān ..."

Translation of the colophon: "... The Book of da-qdām wad-bātar was completed ... on the 25th of the blessed month of Kānún Ḥrāy [January] ... in the year 2151 of the Greeks [1838/1839] ... It was written in the village of ... Síre for Priest Perkins ... Copied by ... Deacon Yosef bar mnāḥa Abrāhām bār Dúmān ..."

record.title: Henry A. DeForest correspondence.
record.note: On the back of the first letter (sent by Ilyās Fawwāz to Dr. DeForest): "Ilá Baḥamdūn. Bi-mannihi taʻālá. Yaḥẓá bi-maṭāliʻ li-janāb [al-janāb] al-akram ḥaḍrat Sayyidī al-ajall al-Ḥakīm Dī Furist al-Amīrīkānī al-muḥtaram, adāma Allāh taʻālá baqāʼahu."

On the back of the second letter (sent by Yūsuf Ṭablat/Ṭaylab (?) to Dr. DeForest: "Bi-mannihi taʻālá. Li-Bayrūt. Wa-yaḥẓá bi-maṭāliʻ janāb Sayyidī al-ajall al-afkham al-Ḥakīm Dīfūrist al-Amīrīkānī al-muḥtaram."

At the bottom of the third letter (sent by Yūsuf ʻAbd al-Malik to Dr. DeForest): A note in English, as follows: "From Yūsuf 'Abd El Melik head of the house of Druse Sheikhs who govern the district of mt. where I now reside."

On the back of the fourth letter from the Bey of Tunis to the President of the United States: Hononary forms of address in Ottoman Turkish, as follows: "Dawlatlū, ʻInāyatlū, ʻUṭūfatlū, Rāyatlū/Sarāytlū [?], Afandim, Sulṭānim, Ḥaḍratlarī bū dafʻah."

record.title: 880-02 Qarah Ḥāshiyah : manuscript / Yaḥyá ibn Aḥmad al-Kāshānī.
record.note: The beginning is missing; text starts with: "... waṣfīyah bi-al-nisbah ilayhi, kamā bayna al-ḍarb wa-al-maḍrūb. Taʼammal [?]. Qawluhu bi-ṭarīq al-fayḍ dūna al-istifāḍah, li-yakhruja mā bi-al-ḥads wa-al-kasb al-ẓānn al-ilqāʼ lā yunāwiluhu. Wa-qīl lā budda min al-khayr li-yakhruja al-waswasah. Wa-qīl mā yakūnu bi-ṭarīq al-fayḍ fa-huwa ḥaqq wa-khayr maḥḍ, fa-kharaja al-waswasah li-annahu sharrun maḥḍ. Wa-yuraddu ʻalayhi qawluhu taʻālá: 'Fa-alhamahā fujūrahā wa-taqwāhā. Wa-yalzam al-istidlāl ayḍan fī qawlihim: Ilhām al-ḥaqq, wa-ilhām al-khayr, wa-ilahām al-ṣawāb, wa-amthāluhu. Wa-yumkinu an yujāba ʻan al-awwal anna al-murād al-ilhām minhā mujarrad al-ifhām, kamā ṣarraḥ bi-hi fī al-Kashshāf, wa-ʻan al-thānī bi-al-tajrīd ayḍan, lākinnahu takalluf ..."
Secundo folio: akhṣar ishʻār bi-annahā minhu.

In naskh/taʻlīq script; in black ink on white paper; the phrases of the oriqinal (al-Sharḥ al-Masʻūdī of al-Shirwānī) preceded by the word "Qawluhu" in red; markings in red; text within gold frames; considerable marginalia; catchwords.
Unbound (in four quires).
On folio 1a: An ownership note: "Sanat 1848. Mulk kātibihi Niʻmah Thābit [?]."

Colophon. No colophon. Text ends with: "... thumma atá min ʻindihi bi-jawāb yashtamilu ʻalá farīd tafṣīl lā yalīqu dhikruhu bi-kitāb lā yaḥtamilu ziyādah taṭwīl. Wa-in shiʼta īḍāḥ al-maqām wa-al-iṭṭilāʻ ʻalá ḥaqīqat al-ḥāl fa-ʻalayka bi-baqīyat [?] muṭawwalātih min muṣannafātih li-taʻthura ʻalá aqsām al-jawāb wa-muḥtamalātih. Qawluhu yatimmu mā dhakarnāhu, li-annahu idhā kāna thābitan fī nafs al-amr lā yakūnu muḥālan bal mumkinan, wa-al-mumkin lā yakūnu mulziman lil-muḥāl ḍaruratan, fa-lā yatawajjahu ʻalayhi dhālika al-manʻ [...]. Qawluhu min al-tardīd al-madhkūr, fa-ẓahar anna al-jawāb ʻan amthāl hādhā al-manʻ laysa illā bi-ṭarīq al-tardīd wa-ithbāt annahu ghayr muḍirr, kamā sabaqa mithāl dhālika al-manʻ al-ghayr al-muḍirr fī al-tanbīh al-sābiq dhikruh, fa-li-yutadhakkar. Tamm. Tamm. Tamm."

record.title: Journal of the march of a detachment of U.S. recruits for Oregon commanded by Major George A. H. Blake, 1st Dragoons, from Fort Benton to Fort Vancouver W.T., 1860 Aug-Oct.

record.note: Bound in contemporary red morocco with gilt decorations and edges.

record.title: Discours de Louis 15. pendant la maladie de laquelle il est décédé le 10. mai 1774, [ca. 1774?]
record.note: Text: Quoique je ne doive rendre compte de ma conduite à personne qu'à Dieu seul; vous voiés en moi le roi David; je suis faché du scandale que j'ai donné à mon peuple, je lui en demande pardon, je ne désire plus vivre que pour le soutient de la foy et de la religion et rendre mes sujets aussi heureux à la fin de mon regne qu'ils l'ont été au commencement.
Pages 466-468 blank except for page numbers.
